loans.name: Seda

texts.en: Seda is engaged in agriculture. She keeps cattle and cultivates land. Seda lives with her husband and daughter, who help her to run the farm. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, and it's barely enough to cover daily costs. Seda has applied for this loan to develop her farm. She plans to purchase seeds for cultivating and forage for the cattle. By developing her agricultural activities, Seda will get more income and insure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and forage

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel is 38 years old and married with three children. Two of the children are in school. She has had a business selling food at a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Aluel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans to sell

loans.name: Djiguiya 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  DJIGUIYA 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FARANI, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêts passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  riz   SOLOMANI    KARIA , 4ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de TAGAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Dalladi

texts.en:
Dalladi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dalladi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dalladi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Dalladi can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Dalladi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Dalladi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: with cash flow, to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia sells automotive products such as the engine seals pictured. She has this business because her husband works for a factory that makes many of these products. Therefore, he has access to purchase these goods at wholesale prices and quantities while his wife is in charge of the store that sells them. They do much of their business with mechanics around the area.

Lucia is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in a wider variety of products. She does not to rely only on her husbands factory and she wants to have diversity in her product offerings. This couple has two children together. This business and her husband’s job are the main sources of income in this household.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Lucia is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in a wider variety of products

loans.name: Ma Esperanza

texts.en:
"Ms. Pearl", as she is called by her neighbors, operates a small taco stand. With her earnings, she helps her husband with the family's expenses. "I started selling tacos in 2002, using my own kitchen. Today I have a little place installed outside my house. I need this loan to buy supplies. My main job is to keep my customers satisfied. I am asking for a loan of $1,000.00."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Doña "Perla" como la llaman sus vecinos, cuenta con un pequeño puesto de tacos, con lo que vende apoya a su marido para los gastos de la familia. " Yo empece en el año del 2002 a vender tacos utilizando mi propia cocina, hoy en día cuento con un puesto instalado a las afueras de mi vivienda, requiero de apoyo para la compra de mercancia mi principal labor es mantener a mis clientes satisfechos solicito un prestamo de $1,000.00 dlls.

loans.use: To buy food products. / Para la compra de los productos alimenticios.

loans.name: Evans Wekesa

texts.en: Evans operates a metal workshop at the community’s local trading centre. He has undertaken training in welding up to grade 3.  He started his business in 2006, after completing his training.  He makes doors, window frames, and gates.  Through his business, he has been able to provide employment for two people. He has also helped the community by bringing services closer to them at a cheaper rate.  With a loan from PEMCI, he intends to increase the stock of welding materials so that he can meet the demand of his clients, which he has not been able to meet due to lack of capital.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Australia

texts.en:
Australia M. is the proud owner of Botellera Dundun, a bottle recycling service that she maintains out of her home in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. Working in conjunction with the Dominican Republic’s largest brewery, Australia collects used bottles and glassware from her community and earns a profit by recycling these with local breweries. Australia’s business not only brings added provisions for her two children, Claraelena and Valentin (age 18 and 26, respectively), but she also is an admirable role model in her community through her stewardship for the local environment. With this loan, Australia will be able to expand her business by investing in bags to increase her storage of bottles.

Note: Australia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase storage bags and bottles

loans.name: Reydo Enedino

texts.es:
Reydo is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. In spite of the problems that his young daughter Melady experiences, Reydo perseveres with hard work and dedication to his crops. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. By doing this he can keep saving to continue the treatment of his child in the capital, so that she can accompany him doing what she loves, healthy and strong. He would like to increase the amount of vegetables which he plants so that he can meet his clients’ needs, give a better live to Melady, and optimize her treatment in the capital city of his country. He is requesting a 275 loan which he has committed to repay within 6 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Reydo appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Reydo, es un padre optimista y muy trabajador, trabaja sus tierras con cariño y dedicación todos los días para que produzca excelentes vegetales, a pesar de los problemas por los que atraviesa su pequeña Melady, Reydo no pierde el empeño y dedicación por su cultivo. Al contrario este hecho le otorga mayor fuerza y vitalidad para hacer de sus productos los mejores de su ciudad; de esta manera podrá seguir ahorrando para continuar con el tratamiento de su niña en la capital a fin de que ella mañana pueda acompañarlo a realizar la actividad que tanto ama, sanita y con muchas fuerzas .Su deseo es incrementar la cantidad de siembra de vegetales para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, otorgarle una mejor calidad de vida a Melady y optimizar su tratamiento en un hospital de la ciudad capital de su país. Por ello solicita la suma de 275 dólares que se compromete a retornarlos es un período de 6 meses. Con el deseo de llevar a cabo su propósito, Reydo, apela a sus generosos corazones para recibir pronta acogida.

loans.use: An increase in vegetable planting can help Reydo and Melady to improve their quality of life.

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en: Ilyas Z. owns and operates a shop that produces windows and doors in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Ilyas is a single 29 year old man who has been working in this trade for a number of years. He has already successfully re-paid a loan in the amount of $1,175 with Norwegian Microcredit thus showing that he is a trustworthy customer. Ilyas is looking for funding in the amount of $1200 in order to invest in the improvement of his shop.

loans.use: To make improvements to his shop.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
On Normal Ave. one of the busiest commercial streets in the city of Juliaca, we find 24-year -old Luis, a very enterprising and happy young man, selling his large and diverse quantity of American toys and stuffed animals; a business that he has dedicated himself to for a year. His good judgment in selecting merchandise has led to much satisfaction and happiness in the favorable results he’s been seeing day to day. This young man’s wish is to rent a locale and sell a great variety of toy collections, merchandise that is in high demand during the Christmas season. For this reason he asks for a 6 month loan. Let us support this enterprising youth who wishes to improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

En la Av. Normal, una de las calles más comerciales de la ciudad de Juliaca; encontramos a Luis de 24 años de edad, joven emprendedor y muy alegre, ofreciendo su inmensa diversidad de juguetes y peluches americanos, negocio al que se viene dedicando hace un año, y que por la buena selección de su mercadería le otorga mucha satisfacción y alegría por los resultados favorables que día a día va obteniendo.El deseo de este joven es alquilar un local y vender una gran variedad de juguetes de colección, mercadería que por estas épocas navideñas tendrá gran demanda. Por esa razón es que solicita un préstamo que se compromete a reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses.Apoyemos a este joven emprendedor que busca mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity and variety of toys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Zaenab

texts.en: Zaenab, 29, is married to I. and has 3 children. I. is a public transportation driver who earns a very small income. So to support her family, Zaenab opened a grocery store at her house where she sells snacks, household goods, etc., earning about $10 a day. She is requesting a loan of $100 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little grocery store

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is someone that's always looking for the best for her family. Since she got married she has dedicated herself, alongside her hardworking husband, to the purchase and resale of wood logs, poles, and firewood. This business they carry on has fortunately permitted them to provide their three beloved children with an education, and they, in their spare time, help them out in their noble business gratefully. She and her life partner, they have wanted to expand their business and increase the goods they sell. They believe that with this investment they will be able to improve their income significantly. With this in mind, they request a loan that will permit them to complete their plans and realize their great dream of becoming one of the largest distributors of their product. Your support is so greatly appreciated by this family. They need your help.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hermelinda es una mujer que siempre ha buscado lo mejor para su familia, desde que contrajo matrimonio decidió dedicarse junto a su laborioso esposo a la compra y venta de troncos, carrizo y leña, esta actividad que desempeñan afortunadamente les esta permitiendo ofrecer estudios superiores a sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes en sus tiempos libres los apoyan afanosamente en esta noble labor.Ella y su compañero de toda la vida, tienen pensado ampliar y aumentar los insumos que ofertan en su espacio de ventas, ellos creen que con esta inversión podrán mejorar mucho sus ingresos económicos, con este propósito recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo de dinero que les permitirá cumplir su propósito y el gran sueño de convertirse en uno de los más grandes distribuidores de estos artículos.Tu aporte será muy agradecido por esta familia, no los dejes esperando ellos necesitan de tu ayuda.

loans.use: To increase her capital investment to offer greater quantities of firewood, wood, and poles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
The beautiful, high quality embroidered pieces give testimony to Blanca's efforts. Spending long hours in a space she set up in her house, she embroiders the pieces she will later sell to her customers, enabling her to earn the necessary income to help her family. With her goal of constructing her own home one day, she is requesting a loan so that she can increase her production and her earnings.

Los resultados y los bellos trabajos de calidad de Blanca dan testimonio de la ardua labor que ella realiza en su casa con el propósito de ofrecerle el sustento necesario para el cumplimiento de sus objetivos a su amada familia, en un espacio de su hogar permanece largas horas bordando y adornando con bellos colores los fustanes que luego ha de vender a sus clientes. Con el anhelo de construir su morada propia solicita un préstamo a fin de incrementar su producción y ganancias para llegar a cumplir su meta.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER EMBROIDERY BUSINESS AND INCREASE HER EARNINGS.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman A. is a 48 year old farmer who raises sheep for meat production. He has seven years of experience in this field. He lives in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Persons Settlement and breeding sheep is the only source of income for his family. Elman applied for a 800 USD loan to purchase 10 sheep and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa belongs to the communal bank “Sol Naciente”, located in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and has five children. Her husband is a doctor, but they do not have enough income to meet their household expenses. It’s for this reason that Elsa, with the first loan of S/. 300 from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in a small business selling food and soft drinks.

She currently has a restaurant, and rises at 7 am to fix breakfast for her husband and children, after which she dedicates herself to preparing her food to sell between the hours of 12 pm and 3 pm.

With this loan of S/. 1,000, to be repaid in four months, she purchased materials to implement her restaurant such as tables, tablecloths, chairs, lumber, paint, etc.

Elsa feels very happy and thankful for all the support Manuela Ramos has provided for her enterprise since now she can manage her own income and savings independently, and also support her children in their educations which is a top priority for her.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Sisley 735, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es medico, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no son suficientes para los gastos del hogar, es así que Elsa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas y gaseosas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un restaurante, se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar su desayuno de su esposo y de sus hijos, de allí se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para venderlos a sus comensales desde las 12 pm hasta las 3 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró materiales para implementar su restaurante como mesas, manteles, sillas, madera, pintura, etc. Elsa se siente muy feliz y agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos para sus negocios pues ahora puede manejar sus propios ingresos y ganancias de manera independiente y también apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios que es su prioridad.

loans.use: Purchase materials and other sundries to improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Hermelinda Nelly

texts.es:
Hermelinda is 48 years old and she lives with her little girl of 10 years and her husband.

She has been selling cosmetics for 29 years, carrying the most prestigious brands. She started her business out of great need. At the time her first daughter required many financial investments, and since then she has kept up the business. She sells her products door to door so this way she might obtain the orders that she needs. The hardest part for her is to have to walk on rainy days. But that doesn't stop her and she just keeps going. She is working hard for her last daughter, so that she can continue attending school.

Hermelinda is requesting a loan in the amound of 1300 soles which she will use to purchase cosmetics wholesale and she wants to invest in another business. And for it, she needs to buy a photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hermelinda tiene 48 años y vive en la actualidad al lado de su pequeña hija de 10 años y su esposo. Desde hace más de 29 años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de las líneas más prestigiosas en belleza, lo hizo por necesidad, porque en aquella ocasión debido a su primera hija necesitaba bastantes recursos económicos, sigue dedicándose a ello, sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa para que de esa manera pueda obtener los pedidos que necesita, lo más difícil para ella es tener que caminar en días de lluvia, pero eso no la detiene y sigue adelante. Ella trabaja para que su última hija pueda seguir con sus estudios. Hermelinda solicita un préstamo de 1300 soles en que utilizará para la compra de cosméticos al por mayor, además desea invertir en otro negocio, comprar una fotocopiadora.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics wholesale and to purchase a photocopier.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es:
Priscila is 52 and lives with her husband, who is a teacher, and their 14-year-old son.

For mO. than 30 years, she has been dedicated to agriculture. Now she is dedicated to growing corn, which she carries out starting very early in the morning after preparing food and fulfilling her role as a mother. She then goes to her farm to irrigate and fertilize adequately. She finishes her work at night fall when she returns home very tired. It pleases Priscila to be active, which is reflected in her production. The difficult part of her job is paying the elevated costs of fertilizer.

Priscila hopes to make her son a worthy person and, above all, a professional.

Now she has to invest in fertilizer so her production will be favorable and to obtain income that will help her expand her farmland and her plantings of new products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Priscila tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, y con su hijo de 14 años.

Por más de 30 años, se dedica a la agricultura, ahora está dedicada a la producción de maíz, que la realiza desde temprano en la mañana, después de preparar los alimentos y cumplir con su rol de madre, para luego ir rumbo a sus chacras, regar y abonar adecuadamente, esta labor la termina al atardecer, donde retorna a su hogar, muy cansada.A Priscila le agrada sentirse activa, lo que se refleja en su producción, lo difícil en su trabajo es pagar los costos elevados de los abonos y fertilizantes.

Priscila tiene el deseo de hacer de su hijo una persona de bien, y sobre todo, profesional.

Ahora, tiene que invertir en abonos para que su producción sea favorable, y así obtener ingresos que la ayuden a la ampliación de sus terrenos y la siembra de nuevos productos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertliizer and expansion of her farmland

loans.name: Davud

texts.en:
Davud A. is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He is a hard-working man struggling to feed his children and parents (who live with him) by selling clothes for teenagers and children. 

Davud has a trading place in the central local market in the city of Imishli. All of the goods are bought from the capital of the country which is three hours away from his region. Davud is trying to have a wide range of goods to better meet the requirements and different levels of income of his customers. 

Today, Davud feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income, so he is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase winter clothes and raise his family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible father give his children a brighter future.

loans.use: to  purchase winter clothes for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Try Im Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for four people located in Tumnob Leu Village in Kampong Cham Province. Each member plans to use the money for different purposes. Mrs. Try I. is the group leader. She is a rice farmer, and a 56-year-old widow with three children: one of whom works in a garment factory while the other two attend the local school. Although Mrs. Try I.’s family members have several different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. In order improve their living conditions, Mrs. Try I. would like to start a grocery business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living with this new loan.

All the members in her group loan have end-of-term loans (EoT), which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. This type of loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To start a grocery business.

loans.name: Kisa

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Kisa Kasanga from Mbeya. She is single with two children, ages 3 and 6.

Kisa has been running an ice cream business since 2001. Selling ice cream is big business in Tanzania as the temperature here is HOT HOT HOT!! There is no typical type of ice cream stand in Tanzania. You will find people selling ice cream in little trolleys on the beach and along the streets, in deep freezers in convenience stores, and right inside people’s homes. However, they all offer a wide variety of delights from smoothie popsicles to chocolate dipped ice cream, some local and some brand names. No matter what or where you purchase these tasty treats, they always bring a smile and a sense of relief from the constant Tanzanian sun.

She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week. Kisa currently earns about 134 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD to purchase a deep freezer in order to keep her ice cream cool. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Kisa thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer in order to keep her ice cream cool

loans.name: Bulenga B4- Sarah Namaga Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is married with 4 children between the ages of 18 and 24. She is 41 years old and very hard-working. She sells matooke (plaintains), potatoes, cassava, yams, and other raw foods in the Bulenga Market. From her business, she fetches a minimum profit of UGX 150,000 per week. 

She is using the loan to purchase more matooke, cassava, and yams from villages like Bukiko, Busama, and Bugama at fair prices that enable her to profit from the sales. Sarah is focused and hopes that, once she collects enough savings from the business, she can open a hardware shop in the same locality. She desires a healthy, educated, and sustainable family.

loans.use: Purchase more matooke (plantains), cassava, and yams.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es socio del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.

Sofía es de Huancayo, conviviente, tiene 33 años y tres hijos  de 9, 4, y 3 años  sus hijos están en la escuela, Sofía vende hace tres años ropa, empezó ofreciendo algunas prendas poco a poco, el tiempo ha pasado y ella tiene mas caseritas y  la mercadería la compra en gamarra al por mayor, le sale mas a cuenta  ella deja la ropa a su clientes  y cada quince días pasa a cobrar esto le da tiempo para seguir  trabajando en la limpieza de casas por horas, y no descuidar a sus hijos  que están pequeños.

Desde que esta en Finca ella ha aprendido ha manejar mejor su dinero, ha saber llevar su negocio y ser puntuales en sus pagos  en el Bancomunal. 
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para invertirlos en la compra de ropa  para poder entregar los pedidos a sus clientas. 

El sueño de Sofía es ahorrar lo suficiente para buscar un puesto en el mercado pesquero  para vender ropa.
texts.en:
Sofia is a member of the Fuerza y Poder ("Strength & Power") community bank. She's 33-years old, a native of Huancayo and partnered with three children who are 9, 4 and 3 years old, respectively. Sofia has sold clothes for three years, starting with a few things and slowly growing the business. She buys wholesale supplies of clothes in Gamarra. She sells on credit and collects payments from her customers every 15 days. She cleans houses part time which still leaves her time to care for her children who are still quite small.

Since starting with Finca, Sofia has learned to better manage her money, operate a business and repay her loans to the community bank on time. She needs a 1000-soles loan that she will use to buy clothes so that she can deliver her customers' orders.

Sofia's dream is to save enough money to get a stall in the Pesquero market where she can sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for clothing business.

loans.name: Anna A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Anna Ng’ondya from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 20.  Anna has been running a genge business since 2008. 

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

She works at the business for 13 to 16 hours per day, six days per week.  Anna currently earns about US$44 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$600 in order to purchase more beans, rice and cooking oil in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the stock of goods. Anna thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more beans, rice and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 48-year-old married man with two children, living in Ain Al Helwi in southern Lebanon. He has owned a grocery store since 1999, where he sells all kinds of goods in addition to vegetables and fruit. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 in order to buy a new cheese refrigerator.

loans.use: Buy a new cheese refrigerator

loans.name: Luisa Margarita

texts.es: La señora  Luisa Margarita R. tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el barrio Dennis Larios ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su mamá y dos hijos , doña Luisa trabaja como domestica y encargada de la casa desde hace diez años  , él apoyo de ella son sus hijos los cuales trabajan y estudian para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , ella siempre a luchado con sus hijos desde pequeños y los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda ya que le hace falta gran parte de materiales ; por lo cual ella solicita un financiamiento de seis mil córdobas para la compra de los materiales de construcción para hacer las mejoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa Margarita R. is 44 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Dennis Larios located in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her mother and two children. Mrs. Luisa has worked as a maid and head of household of a home for ten years. Her support is her children who work and study in order to help her with the household expenses. She and her children have struggled since they were young and the plan for the future is to improve their housing condition for which they lack many materials. This is why she is asking for a loan of 6000 NIO to purchase construction materials to do the improvements.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve living conditions

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Alimatou T. est une veuve de 45ans avec 4 enfants en charge. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son capital et promouvoir son activité de vente de tissu teint à l’indigo « Thioup ». Elle fait en même temps un petit commerce de crème et de glace, très rentable en cette période de chaleur.
texts.en:
Alimatou T. is a widow of 45, raising 4 children. She is requesting this loan to bolster her working capital and expand her little business selling indigo dyed cloth called "Thioup". She also sells ice cream, which is quite lucrative in this hot weather.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of dyed cloth and ice cream

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Mrs. Leonora D. is 57 years old, married and lives at Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with four children. Her husband is a farmer. Some of her children are in college already. She says "if we only depend on the income of my husband from farming, it is not enough to support our daily needs.” She felt the difficulty of sending their children to school. And so, Leonora thought of an economic project that would generate additional income.

Cooking is her favorite household chore.  That’s why she got the idea of selling viand or food in retail. Last October 2008, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for a chance to take a loan. She’s happy that the cooperative has extended their services to the needy ones. From then on, she gained more customers and generated daily income. Today, she applies for PHP 7,000 for additional capital for her food vending. Seeing all her children succeed in life is her greatest achievement.

loans.use: Additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Qurbanali

texts.en: Qurbanali I. is a 58-year-old man who breeds sheep in the small village of Agsu City. He is married and has five children. Qurbanali is a veterinarian and knows how to properly keep animals. He is not alone in his business as his two sons help him in looking after the sheep. His dream is to provide all his children with a quality higher education and for this purpose he would like to expand his business. Qurbanali applied for a $2,000 loan to purchase 20 sheep and fodder.

loans.use: Purchase 20 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngin D. was born in 1968 and is a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been operating a farming business in the village for more than five years. She normally grows rice and vegetables. She is also flexible, growing through the conditions of different seasons. 

She is married, with four single children, all of whom are students and work with her business when they are not studying. Another source of the family’s income comes from her husband, who works as a domestic wooden-house builder.

Ngin D. will use the Kiva loan to buy a cow and use it to plow the farmland during this coming crop season. She will also raise its offspring.

A person who shown in the picture is Mrs. Ngin D.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing and breeding

loans.name: Maira Vanesa

texts.es: Maira Vanesa vive en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, el mayor  de 10 años de edad estudia su cuarto grado de Educación primaria y el niño menor de 4 añitos en pre-escolar, su esposo trabaja como taxista y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 8vo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda para echarle el piso a la habitacion y terminar de repellar, trabaja como Responsable de la Farmacia de la casa  de la mujer desde hace 11 años, es una profesional con mucha experiencia en farmacia y en dar atencion mujeres campesinas de las comarcas que se hospedan cuando vienen a dar a luz a sus bebes, se caracterizapor ser una mujer humilde, responsable con muchos deseos de seguir estudiando. Se siente agradecida con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado su vivienda  y ha logrado comprar todos los electrodomesticos que ella tiene en su hogar , su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a sus hijos adelante y que sus hijos estudien para que sean hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Maria Vanesa lives in the #5 area of New Guinea. She is married and has two children. Her oldest is ten years old and in the fourth grade while her youngest son is four years old and in pre-school. Her husband works as a taxi driver and she helps him with the household bills. She wants to refinance her eighth loan to do some home improvements. She would like to put a floor in the bedroom and finish plastering. She has been the person in charge of the Womens’ House’s pharmacy for eleven years. She is an experienced pharmacy professional and has experience attending the farm-women from the outer areas that come to stay when they are ready to give birth. She is a humble and responsible woman who wants to continue studying. Maria Vanesa is grateful to AFODENIC since she has been able to make improvements to her home with former loans. She has also been able to buy the appliances she has in her home. Her dream is have a nice house, and to work, so she can help her kids get ahead. She also wants her children to study so they can be good men.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Echarle piso a una habitacion y terminar de repellar

loans.name: Abidemi

texts.en: Abidemi is 34 years old and married with four children. She sells cellophane bags. Abidemi hopes for the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more cellophane bags to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Mercy Grace

texts.en:
Mercy Grace L. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Mercy Grace is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy Grace owns & operates a retail business selling homemade products including peanut butter and dried fish in the local community. Mercy Grace is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Mercy Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mercy Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joyda

texts.en:
Joyda M. is from the village of Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 36 years old. Joyda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Joyda owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Joyda has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (about $63) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joyda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joyda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Joyda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a member of the Pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 19,15, and 10 years.

Tatu started her own cafe business selling food 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Tatu`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to by more rice,cooking oil,sugar for food.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Tatu hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more rice,wheat,cooking oil

loans.name: Pouv

texts.en:
Mr. P., age 47, makes a living driving a taxi-motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community. He currently earns an average of $5 a day and has been running his service for a long time. He is the father of three children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school.

P.’s wife sells soft drinks and gasoline along the street to earn a living. P. would like a loan which will enable his wife to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: To allow his wife to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La señora Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 56 años de edad (todos ya casados), de estado civil casada tiene 3 hijos, vive en Cuturapi  Sector San Juan, y estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino en las comunidades de la zona y venderlo luego de su mejora en las ferias zonales, Fortunata también se dedica a la cría de ganado mayor para engorde.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos.

loans.name: Las Gardenias Group

texts.es:
ALCANCÍA COMUNAL "LAS GARDENIAS"

Los diez integrantes son personas emprendedoras, gracias al negocio D. éstos han logrado salir adelante pese a las inconvenientes que no falta en todo progreso, D. los ingresos D. estos trabajos buscan mejorar la calidad D. vida en sus hogares. Tales son los casos D.:
Sara, quien es presidenta del grupo decidió vender hace cuatro años cerveza en su casa, lo hizo porque llegó un tiempo que la situación se puso un poco difícil y el dinero D. su esposo no cubría todos los gastos D. la casa. Al comienzo no le gustó porque era poco lo que recibía D. ganancias; pero después esto cambió lo que le permitió incrementar su negocio en golosinas. Es así que poco tiempo pudo comprar playstation, ingresos que son utilizados en la educación a sus dos hijos menores D. edad. Necesita el crédito para invertir en cerveza que es lo que mayor venta tiene.

Silvia tiene 36 años, casada y es madre D. dos niños; lo que la motivó a trabajar fue sus hijos pues ella está empeñada a darle lo mejor a ellos.
Una amiga suya la invita a participar como ayudante para la venta D. productos D. belleza (Unique), al principio recaudaba pocos ingresos porque no era tan conocida, lo que con el tiempo esto cambió debido al carisma y buen trato que Silvia da a sus clientes, actualmente cuenta un número D. compradores. Los ingresos D. sus ventas esa para la educación y recreación a sus niños. El crédito que necesita es para la inversión D. su reciente negocio D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Community Piggy Bank "LAS GARDENIAS"

The ten members are enterprising people. Thanks to their businesses they have achieved in getting ahead in spite of the inconveniences that are evident in all progress. With the income from these jobs, they are looking to improve the quality of life of their households.

Such cases are: Sara, who is the president of the group, decided to sell beer in her house four years ago. She did it because one time a situation arrived that was a little difficult, and the money from her husband did not cover the expenses of the house. At the beginning, she didn´t like it, because she only received a little profit, but after that she changed it so that she grew her business to incluD. candies. After a little bit of time like that, she could buy a playstation. The income was used for the education of her two younger children. Se needs the loan to invest in beer because it is the best sales that she has.

Silvia is 36 years old, married, and the mother of two children. What motived her to work was her two children. She is determined to give the best to them. A friend of hers invited her to participate as a helper in the sale of beauty products (Unique). At the beginning, she collected only a little income because she wasn´t very well known, but with time this changed due to her charisma and the good treatment that Silvia gave her customers. Currently, she has a number of buyers. The income from her sales is for the education and recreation of her children. The loan that she needs is for the investment for her recent grocery business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Anta.  The group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta.  She is from Anta and lives in Anta.  She is 52 years old, lives with her partner and has 4 children who are studying at a university in Cusco.

Irma has had a grocery stall for the last 15 years in the Sunday market.  She sells various items such as vegetables and dry goods.  She buys her items from Huancaro, a neighborhood with many wholesalers.  With this loan, she will stock her grocery store with more items.  She feels that Arariwa helps her and her family a great deal.

Irma appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To stock her grocery stall

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 40 years-old and married with seven children. Her children are in school and she hopes to give them a quality education. She sells drums that are used as storage for water and lubricants. She is the only person in her community that sells this type of drums. She is happy because the demand for her drums is high and she hopes to be able to meet the demands of her customers. Elizabeth has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more drums to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase storage drums.

loans.name: Embajadores 4 Group

texts.en:
Michelina is the coordinator of her group, Embajadores (Ambassadors), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural communities surrounding La Romana, an area famous for the sugarcane industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her partner and their three children.

Michelina is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothes by purchasing skirts pants and shirts in bulk and then selling them at a profit in her neighborhood. She will use the profits to invest in her home and family by purchasing a small radio, painting the house, purchasing sandals and pants for her children and school supplies. Her long-term dream is to have a bigger business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more shirts, pants and skirts to sell in her store

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans la vente de charbons de bois et de maïs dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Depuis d’elle a débuté ce commerce, elle aide financièrement son son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs 04  enfants. Elle vend aussi bien en gros qu’en détail. En cette période de fin d’année, elle enregistre une rupture de stocks pour ses sacs de maïs ; et c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 08 sacs de maïs ; le prêt lui permettra également d’acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est très bien connue de nombreuses personnes.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is specialized in selling charcoal and corn in the Agoè district in Lomé.  Since beginning this business, she has been helping her husband financially in providing an education for their four children.  She sells as much wholesale as she does retail.   During this year-end period, she has noted a shortage in her inventory of corn.  And for this reason, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy eight sacks of corn.  The loan will also allow her to buy twenty sacks of charcoal.  She is very well-known by numerous people.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn and of charcoal

loans.name: Ada Lyla

texts.es:
Con mucha alegría, en el municipio de San Rafael la señora Ada Lyla se dedica a trabajar diariamente con el propósito de obtener los ingresos para apoyar a su hijo que actualmente está terminando de estudiar en la universidad. 
Al estar su hijo terminando sus estudios universitarios, ella solicita un crédito porque quiere apoyarlo con el pago del título y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar dicho crédito y así hacer realidad su sueño de que su hijo al que tanto ha invertido en sus estudios sea un profesional de éxito para orgullo de ella y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Ada Lyla works happily every day around the municipality of San Rafael to make a profit to help her son who’s finishing his college degree. For this reason, she would like to request for a loan to pay for his graduation fees. She came to Ceprodel to request for that loan, and therefore, make his son’s dream come true, who has invested so much in his studies to be a successful professional and make his family proud.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her son's graduation fees

loans.name: Lylin

texts.en:
Lylin C. is a business-minded woman. She and her husband have been blessed with one daughter and one son, both of whom look to her for her support. She lives in Morong, in the province of Rizal, Philippines. She belongs to a poor family who needs help to change their standard of living and to be able to pursue their family dreams.

With her belief in getting out of poverty, she decided in 2007 to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with start-up capital for generating income. During her previous loans from ASHI, she carefully invested in her sari-sari store (a small retail store selling different goods). The income is what she uses for daily expenses.

Now on her fourth loan, Lylin requests 20,000 PHP to create a broader business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase 16 sacks of rice and groceries for her store. She is very determined and disciplined to use the funds that are lent to her. 

During her almost three years in ASHI, she has shown herself to be hard-working and has strong beliefs to make her dreams come true. She would love to have her own durable and concrete house someday. Lylin C. still dreams of the best for her family: to provide the best education for her children and to have a happy family. She is grateful to ASHI-Kiva partner for support, even in all of her dreams and the challenges in life.

loans.use: To pay for 16 sacks of rice and groceries for her store

loans.name: Chan Thou's Group

texts.en:
This group loan, which consists of six people, is located in Popeal Khae village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. C. Thou C. is the group leader who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. C. Thou C. is a teacher in the local public school and her husband, Mr. Koeun Korng, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family living.

In the rice field, this family has some problems because their rice field has infertile soil. Unfortunately, they do not have enough money to change the quality of their land to increase their rice yield this current year. Thus, Mrs. C. Thou C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support their field.

Mrs. C. Thou C. is the mother of four children who are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her husband's rice field

loans.name: Determiners Group

texts.en:
Samuel G. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Determiners.  He married and has 4 children who are 5, 7, 10 and 14 years old.  In addition to his children, Samuel supports three siblings.

For 5 years, Samuel has been running a drugstore on Cooper Road, which is located just south of downtown Monrovia on Cooper Road.  He says that he provides his medicine at a reasonable price, which keeps customers returning.

Samuel plans to use his 12,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 60,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase additional medicine. His goal is to expand his business and, most importantly, to help support his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Samuel is the one holding the sign.  Dorothy K. is inset at the lower left of the photo.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio tiene 50 años de edad, está casado y cuenta con 6 hijos que son menores de edad, tiene una vivienda propia. Ignacio es empleado de la Alcaldía Municipal de la localidad donde vive lleva 3 años trabajando en esta actividad, además que tiene un moto taxi que lo hace trabajar, del cual recibe una renta diaria. En cuanto al servicio de moto taxi, tiene muy poca competencia, por lo que son pocos los que se dedican a esta actividad en la localidad donde vive. Y como empleado fijo ya le hicieron renovación de contrato 2 gestiones. El crédito es para comprar una segunda moto la que hará trabajar también como moto taxi, esta moto la va a manejar su hijo quién la trabajará por una renta diaria de Bs. 30.-. Esta operación es la tercera de Ignacio en la institución y tuvo un buen comportamiento en todas sus cuotas anteriores.
texts.en:
50-year old Ignacio is married, has six children, and lives in his own house. He has worked for three years in the municipal office in the town where he lives. He also owns a motor-cycle taxi which he rents out, and from which he gets a daily income. With regard to his taxi business, there is little competition as few people take up this line of work in the town where he lives. His contract at the municipal office has been renewed twice. The loan will be used to buy a second motor-cycle, also to be used as a taxi, and driven by his son who will rent it from him for Bs. 30 per day. This is Ignacio’s third loan with this organization, and he has always been responsible about making his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a motor cycle

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
56-year-old Rachael owns a shop. She sells groceries like biscuits, milk, drinks and more to her customers. She is married and they are blessed with three children. They all live in Lagos State, Nigeria. Rachael plays a supportive role in the home with the proceeds from her business. She assists her husband in feeding, clothing and paying school fees for the children. Her dream is to see her shop grow into a bigger shop and to give the children the best education.  

Rachael is requesting a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. This will call for more customers and increase profit, which will lead to expansion of the business. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is a dressmaker. She is 43 years old and married with three children. Her oldest child is 18 and in college. She says that her business is really helpful to her family, especially for her children’s education. She hopes to have her own shop someday.

Leonides would like to request a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it to buy cloth, thread and other materials she needs for her dressmaking business.

loans.use: Cloth, thread and other materials

loans.name: Berna

texts.en: Berna is married with children and all her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a house where they stay with additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Berna owns a retail shop in Kitawuluzi selling all kinds of merchandise like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, bread, milk, soda and other cold drinks.  She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt, cooking oil, crates of soda and crates of mineral water. Her monthly expenses includes utility bills, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the “God Bless” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni who are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in the group in order to expand their businesses. Zainab T. is the leader of this group. She is a 26-year-old, and she was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has 2 children attending primary school. 

For 3 years now, Zainab has been selling women’s dresses and shoes. With her share of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying women’s dresses and shoes wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buying women’s dresses and shoes wholesale

loans.name: Noudagnon

texts.fr: A. Noudagnon est né le 21 Janvier 1979 à Podji au Bénin. Marié à HOUNKANRIN Bernadette, une revendeuse, Noudagnon est père d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Noudagnon a un autre enfant à charge. Noudagnon vit depuis sa naissance  au quartier Adonvê à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Noudagnon vit avec sa famille dans ce quartier. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Noudagnon a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite l’électricité. Noudagnon exerce cette activité depuis sept ans environs. De façon secondaire, Noudagnon vend également du charbon de bois. Noudagnon s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de s’équiper en matériels électriques, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Noudagnon sollicite pour une première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Noudagnon ambitionne plus tard ouvrir une boutique de vente de matériels électriques, ce qui lui permettra d’accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
A. Noudagnon was born on January 21, 1979 in Podji in Bénin. Married to HOUNKANRIN Bernadette, a petty trader, Noudagnon is the father of one child who is attending school. Noudagnon is also raising another child. Since his birth, Noudagnon has been living in the Adonvê area in Ekpè, in the township of Sèmè-Podji. Noudagnon still lives with his family in this district. The couple share in supporting their family. Noudagnon left school at the secondary level and learned the trade of electrician. He has been working in this trade for about seven years. Secondarily, he sells charcoal. He buys his supplies in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. In order to raise the level of his business and equip himself with electrical supplies, and thus better serve his clientele, Noudagnon is requesting, for the first time, a loan from ALIDé. He hopes later on to be able to open a store selling electrical goods, which would allow him to increase his earnings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of electrical goods (pipes, wires, bulbs, etc.)

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Bo Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 26 people who live in Chamkar Ta Ngaet village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mao B. is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their businesses. She is 50 years old. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to grow crops to sell to support her family. Now, she has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Mao B. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a widow with two children, who are both helping her with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M., from Biasong, Dipolog City, is 51 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a tailoring business providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials, she is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. Virginia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her business

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
B. Tursunoy is 57 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 6 children. Tursunoy, together with her husband, produces national chests for saving the dowry of brides. The national chests in Tajikistan are very colorful. They are made of wood. Mihri has been in this business for 23 years already. The stability of the business allows her to have income and ensure the family has the possibility of improving their living conditions. Because of high demand for her products now, Tursunoy is requesting a loan in the amount of 7000 Somoni in order to purchase raw materials for producing chests. Tursunoy thanks all lenders who are giving her a chance to get ahead.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase raw material for producting chests

loans.name: God’S Blessing #2. Group

texts.en:
Bendu W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God’s Blessing #2.

Bendu is 35 years old, single and has five children who range from 5 to 14 years old. She was not privileged to attend school due to poverty. She cares for one sibling. 

For three years, she has been selling beans and wheat in the Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more bags of beans and wheat.

She describes herself as a friendly woman. Her goal is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and wheat

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Chhan C. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband in the cultivation of crops from her own farmland. The couple married years ago but they don't have any children yet. Chhan C. will use the loan she has requested to buy more piglets for her stall. She intends to use any remaining money from the loan to use towards planting a rice crop.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her stall.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian J. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Ian is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ian owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ian has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ian is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  Antonio Bianco L. es un gran artesano y quiere construir un local que pueda utilizar como galería y como taller donde pueda pintar sus hermosos cuadros.
El vive en puerto Jimenez de Puntarenas, una de las zonas más exóticas y bellas de Costa Rica , durante toda su vida se dedico a la zapatería, pero al llegar por primera vez a esta zona se vio cautivado por la belleza del paisaje y  la variedad de animales silvestres en la zona, por lo que empezó a pintarlos y crear figuras de madera con dichos animalitos. Su hija de 17 años se ha visto también inspirada y ya 2 de sus pinturas se exponen en galerías importantes de Italia.
Don Manuel desea un crédito de ¢600,000 (seiscientos   mil colones)  para iniciar la construcción de dicho local, el es socio de Raíces Capitales S.A, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y está muy motivado de poder seguir su sueño y de apoyar a su hija.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio Bianco L. is a great artisan. He wants to build a place that he could use as a gallery and as a workshop where he could paint his beautiful pictures. He lives in Puerto Jimenez in Puntarenas, one of the most exotic and pretty areas in Costa Rica. All of his life he has been a shoemaker. However, upon arriving in this area for the first time he was captivated by its beautiful scenery and the variety of wild animals in the region. Therefore, he started to paint and create wood figures of the animals. His 17 year old daughter has also been inspired, and two of her paintings are on display in important galleries in Italy. Manuel wants a loan for ¢600,000 (six hundred thousand colones) to start building said location. He is a member of Raíces Capitales S.A., one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and he is very motivated to be able to continue his dream and to support his daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a gallery/workshop

loans.name: Ivan Marcelino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ivan;   el tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero;   El socio se dedica al transporte público él trabaja con su carrito  prestando servicio de transporte público en la ruta del Sr de Cabildo desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m.  El socio ahora desea hacer el mantenimiento respectivo a su unidad vehicular. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ivan is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas” Communal Bank.  The communal bank is located in the San Sebastián district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Ivan is 28 years old and single.  He works in public transportation.  He uses his own car to provide public transportation on the Sr. de Cabildo route.  He works from six a.m. until nine p.m.

He would like to have maintenance done on his vehicle.  He is requesting the loan to pay for maintenance on his vehicle.

He is grateful for and values the loan granted through these means, and he pledges to make his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: Maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Dossou

texts.fr: Dossou est un homme très dynamique, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de peintures, il fait ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé « ETS LA GLOIRE ».  Il s’approvisionne à Lomé. Le crédit qu’il sollicite va lui permettre d’accroître son stock de marchandise avec  10 boîtes de peintures AG, 15 boîtes de peintures LEYLAC, 12 boîtes de verni, 9 boîtes de peintures BASS, 10 boîtes de diluant.
texts.en: Dossou is a very energetic man. He makes a living by selling paint. He has his own stores which he had named “Glory, Inc.” He stocks up in Lomé. The loan he is seeking will allow him to increase his merchandise stock by 10 cans of AG paint, 15 cans of Leylac paint, 12 cans of varnish, 9 cans of Bass paint, 10 cans of diluent.

loans.use: Purchasing paint

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Mercedes Del Carmen, es madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad. La señora  tiene su negocio que es la venta de comida localizada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende sus platillos como gallo pinto, tajadas, queso frito, refrescos, tortas, maduro entre otros. Hace más de cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio, el cual inicio como una alternativa,  debido a que tenía a sus hijos que alimentar, por lo que se armó de valor y decidió establecerlo. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos que son necesarios para su negocio. El deseo por el momento es trabajar duro para capitalizar el negocio, de tal forma que pueda en un futuro realizar mejoras a su casita, y brindarles mayores comodidades a sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Mercedes Del Carmen is a single mother with two young children. She has a business in which she sells food from her home. She sells dishes such as gallo pinto (a rice and beans dish), plantains, fried cheese, soft drinks, and cakes, among others. She has been in business for four years, which she started because she has children to feed. It took courage to decide to establish her business. The loan will be used to buy basic grains that are necessary for her business. Her desire at the moment is to work hard so she can capitalize her business so that in the future she can improve her house and improve the quality of life of her children.

loans.use: to buy basic grains

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N., aged 30 years, is a single mother of three children. One of her two sons is employed while the other son and daughter are still in school. She sells clothes at Athi River Estate, which is a busy market, and to residents of Portland, Bamburi, Makadara, and at Kenya meat commission factories. She has been running her business for the last 16 years and she gets a monthly profit of 3,500 Kenyan shillings from the business.

Alice was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. She has applied for a loan, which she wants to use to buy more clothes for selling. If the loan boosts the business, she will open a boutique and sell both locally made and imported clothes.

Alice describes herself as a hardworking and focused lady who has dreams of having a big boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase new furniture and office supplies for his education center.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael C. is from the village of Maluno Sur, Benito Soliven. He is 30 years old. Michael is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Michael owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Michael has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Michael joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michael is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Michael from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 40 years old, and married. To make a living, Nicolas owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nicolas wants to be able to provide all that his family needs.

Nicolas joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicolas has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nicolas is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean A. is from the village of La Buena Vida, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old. Mary Jean is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jean owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to clothing and shoe products from AVON & NATASHA in the local community. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like blouses and t-shirts. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Mary Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like blouses and t-shirts

location.town: La Buena Vida, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.ru: Очилдиев Хошим проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 34 года. Он женат, имеет троих детей. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве "Ходжибобо". Сам Хошим занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: O. Hoshim lives in the Shahrituz region. He's thirty-four years old, married and has three children.
