His wife works on the "Hodjibobo" farm, while Hoshim has, for the past seven years, rented a plot of land where he grows vegetables. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta tiene 41 años de edad, tiene un hijo, nació y vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de Violeta es la venta y compra de cerveza, ella tiene un pequeño depósito donde guarda y vende la cerveza, ella tiene abierto el depósito las 24 horas del día y vende todos los días de la semana. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad Violeta requiere el préstamo para comprar más cajas de cervezas. 

Violeta pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Violeta is 41 years old and has one child. She was born and still lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is buying and selling beer. She has a small warehouse where she stores and sells the beer. Violeta keeps her warehouse open 24 hours a day and generates sales every day of the week. She has been in this business for seven years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her business. Violeta is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more cases of beer.

Violeta belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase cases of beer

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
From Kompong Chhnang province, Sun S. is a 37-year-old married woman who is good at making bamboo baskets at home. Her husband always helps her by taking the finished products to sell in and around his community. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profit. They have done this since 1980. 

Sun S. is a mother who has four single children. Recently, Sun S. has taken out a loan to invest in her business by purchasing more baskets for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more baskets to sell, together with her own

loans.name: Maria Cristy

texts.en:
Maria Cristy C. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old and married. To make a living, Maria Cristy owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages. Maria Cristy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Maria Cristy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Cristy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria Cristy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Rejie

texts.en:
Rejie G. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. He is 21 years old and single. To make a living, Rejie owns and operates a specialized retail store. His main source of income comes from buying and selling gasoline per liter in the local community. Rejie has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Rejie joined HSPFI 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase gasoline. This will be Rejie’s first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his loan to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to sell by the liter

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy M. O. is 53 years old,  married, and has five children.  She has been tailoring since 1990.  In 1994, when Faulu Kenya began, she decided to join so that she would easily access financial resources.  Being a long-time member of Faulu Kenya, she has benefited because she has sustained her business with her previous loans.  Besides tailoring, she sells second-hand clothes.  She hopes to own a business premise in the future instead of renting.  She is requesting a loan for 90,000 KES to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s welding business. Through the loan, he will buy a new welding machine that will help him weld spare parts and other iron items belonging to his clients. His current welding machine is not producing quality work and that’s why Mariam applied for a loan to buy a new welding machine. 

She belongs to Faisalabad which is an industrial city of Pakistan famous for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Mariam Abad. She moved here some years ago with her family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family and works very hard to bear the financial expenses of his family. 

Mariam has a son and a daughter. Both of them are illiterate due to financial constraints. Her husband is well known for his good customer dealings and for the quality of services he offers to his clients.  He has been operating this business for the past 6 years and Mariam is hopeful that an investment will help him further improve his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she established a good credit record and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Mariam.

loans.use: To buy a new welding machine for her husband's welding business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias H. owns Medical Dimensions, a business that provides life-saving medical training to the Greater El Paso area. As a licensed CPR instructor with over 12 years of experience teaching, Elias is capitalizing on his experience and extensive contacts in the medical community by opening Medical Dimensions. Elias’s clients are businesses and institutions in all fields that require basic medical training for their employees. Until he gets his business up and running full force, Elias has continued his full-time job as an advanced medical training instructor. In addition to teaching CPR, Elias is developing a curriculum that teaches health care professionals how to communicate with Spanish-speaking patients. With Spanish so widely spoken in El Paso, some medical institutions are requiring their employees to attain basic proficiency in “Medical Spanish.” Elias’s course will teach medical terminology and basic phrases in Spanish that will facilitate better patient care. Elias officially opened Medical Dimensions on April 21st of this year. His first classes are scheduled to begin in June, when he will be teaching his Medical Spanish courses at two regional hospitals. With this loan, Elias bought a computer and printer for his business, as well as supplies for his classes. He is currently finishing his course preparations as well as procuring items such as face masks and valves that will be used by his students during training. Elias loves teaching CPR because he knows that it can be the difference between life and death. He lives by the motto coined by Albert Einstein that goes, “Try not to be a person of success, but rather try to become a person of value and success will follow, because people are to be valued not for how big or small they are, but rather for their ability to perform the tasks for which they were made.”

loans.use: to purchase a computer, printer, and supplies for his cardiopulmonary resuscitation training classes.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol nació en Ayacucho, tiene 29 años de edad, convive con Misael de 30 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Santa Rosa por motivos de trabajo. Marisol se entrega por completo a su carrera y agradece a sus padres por brindarle educación superior. Marisol ejerce la profesión de enfermería, trabaja en el centro de salud de la ciudad de Santa Rosa y en sus horas libres aprovecha para laborar en las boticas. Ella se entrega por completo a su trabajo, por que gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano pudo alquilar un puesto de ventas donde ofrece ropa de vestir, y atiende exclusivamente los fines de semana. Le gusta su trabajo y estar pendiente de sus pacientes. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo y ahorrando para abrir un centro medico dentro de la ciudad de Santa Rosa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy comprometida en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente por que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. Agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por permitirle trabajar con ellos. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará prendas de vestir para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marisol was born in Ayacucho.  She is 29 years old and lives with Misael, 30.  They have three children and they all live together in a leased house in the city of Santa Rosa because of work.  

Marisol is completely devoted to her career and is grateful to her parents for providing her with higher education.  Marisol is a Nurse and works in the city of Santa Rosa’s Health Center.  In her free time she works in the drug stores.  She gives herself over completely to her work because, thanks to her daily effort, she managed to rent a sales stand where she sells clothes exclusively on the weekend.  She enjoys her work and caring for her patients.  Her plans are to continue to grow and to save up in order to open a health center in the city of Santa Rosa.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very committed to pay all her installments punctually because she wants to access future loans later on.  She thanks all the members of the communal bank for allowing her to work with them.  She will use the requested loan to buy articles of clothing to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing.

loans.name: Twahirwa

texts.en: Twahirwa, a 32-year-old father of a two-year-old child, is married to a tailor, while he has been selling chickens, goats and eggs for the past six years.  This business has enabled him to feed his family, and he is now requesting a loan to buy more animals such as goats to sell in order to make more profits. Twahirwa plans to better provide for his family with the profits he hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a married woman with five children. She is 48 years old. She has been in the rice farming business for quite a long time now.

Receiving a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. will help her continue her livelihood. She could buy fertilizers and seeds. 

In the future, Merlyn hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
35-year-old Sally is a farmer working in the Philippines. She is married and a mother of three grown children. Sally plants rice and harvests palay to earn a living. She has been running this type of business for 16 years. She earns approximately PHP 21,000 every quarter in this business. Sally requested a loan of PHP 30,000 from GDMPC to pay for soil preparation for the coming planting season.

Sally has been a member of GDMPC for two years. Sally hopes to buy a one-hectare rice field for her business.

loans.use: To pay for soil preparation

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is a 30-year-old Rwanadan entrepreneur with four children between the ages of 2 and 8 years old. The oldest two are in school. 

For the past four years, she has been running a general store with her husband. This business has enabled them to care for their family. 

She requires a loan to purchase more goods such as sugar, candles, and matches that she will sell in her store.

The profits generated from this business will allow her to make savings, feed her family, and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, candles, and matches to sell

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 29-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son and three daughters. Safaa lives in Dora village in Hebron, which is located in Palestine. Her husband works in the area behind the borders.

Safaa has her own project raising poultry and selling its products. She wants to expand and buy more poultry but she doesn't have enough money, so she needs to take a loan of JOD 700 from FATEN.

When Safaa gets her FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to buy more poultry and sell more of its products. This will generate more income, which will help her family to have better living conditions. Safaa is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To buy more poultry to raise

loans.name: Abd Al Razeq

texts.en:
Abd A. Razeq is a 33-year-old man from Bani Kenanah, Jordan and the father of three children.

Abd A. Razeq has a barber shop and he is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase appliances for his shop.

An aspiration of Abd A. Razeq's is to expand his business so that he can increase his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase appliances for his shop

loans.name: Sorie I.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Makeni. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of 17,300,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. Then at the end of each month, their school’s bursar will deduct their repayments and pay SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

Sorie is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kamabai village, the 58 year old has been in the teaching profession for 32 years now. Sorie is married and has four children – three in primary school and one in secondary school. Sorie has applied for this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes nació en la ciudad Quillabamba (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 36 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo.

Actualmente, Mercedes vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas,  ella es cosmetóloga y tiene un local alquilado donde hace cortes, peinados, teñido de cabellos y otras cosas más. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien y gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Mercedes requiere el préstamo para comprar sus materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo champús, acondicionadores, tintes y tijeras.  

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Mercedes was born in the city of Quillabamba (Cusco, Peru).  She is 36 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have one child.

Mercedes currently lives in the city of Cusco and this is where she carries out her business.  She is a cosmetologist and has rented premises where she provides customers with haircuts, hairdos, hair dyes, and other services.  She has been in this business for 15 years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Mercedes needs a loan to buy materials for her work such as shampoo, conditioners, hair dyes and scissors.

The 'Comuzone I' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as a touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world: Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioners, hair dyes and scissors

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Grace has a food shop that sells pork & chicken barbecue. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making barbecue.

Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making barbecue.

loans.name: Djahangir

texts.ru:
Djahangir 53 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Djahangir yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Bala Bahmanli vmeste so svoyey jenoy i dochkoy. On uje 11 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta. On delayet yogurt i Kefir, prodayot ix v magazini.
texts.en: Djahangir is 53 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Djahangir is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bala Bahmanli village of the Fuzuli region together with his wife and daughter.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for 11 years and breeds cattle.  He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cows in order to increase the amount of milk products.  Djahangir makes yogurt and buttermilk and sells the products to stores.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 50-year-old man who is always cheerful in his everyday life, according to the residents of his neighborhood. It is in this neighborhood where he got married and where his first child was born. Adel is the father of 11 children. The burden is becoming heavier than ever, as he needs to cover his children's expenses in terms of living, education, and other things required by the big family.

Adel started his business long ago in order to cover the big expenses imposed by his big family. His business was initially a cafe shop that didn't require a large amount of capital except to purchase kilos of sugar and tea. This business achieved a good reputation in old Sana'a, where it is located, and many people became regulars. Adel's family life was somewhat improved by the limited income of that cafe, but Adel did not stop at this point. He had some thoughts about further enlarging his business by opening another shop next to the cafe for selling cabab, which is a publicly sold food eaten as breakfast.

Adel was in need of a loan to start the other business and visited one of Al-Amal Bank's branches. He received three loans sequentially and this had a good impact on his business and family. Adel took the fourth loan of 180,000 YER from Al-Amal in order to pay the rent of the two shops and purchase needed materials like tea, sugar, new dishes, and tables for the cabab shop.

In the future, Adel hopes to expand his business by opening a restaurant selling all types of food, not only cabab. He also hopes to build a house for his family and children.

loans.use: to purchase tea, sugar, new dishes, and tables

loans.name: Yeyssa

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée , mère de sept enfants.Elle pratique l'élevage traditionnelle depuis son enfance.Après avoir ouvert un compte à l'UIMCEC, elle a bénéficié d'un premier crédit pour faire de l'embouche ovine et l'a remboursé entièrement.Elle sollicite un second pret de 250000f pour acheter des moutons qu'elle va engraisser et les revendre sur les marchés locaux.Son ambition est de démarrer l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: This borrower is a married mother of seven children. She has been engaged in traditional animal rearing since her childhood. After having opened an account with UIMCEC, she benefited from her first loan to raise sheep and repaid the loan completely. She is seeking a second loan of 250,000 F to buy sheep that she will fatten and sell at the local markets. Her ambition is to start raising cattle.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman with four children. Rachel is 38 years old, residing in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental: Philippines.

Rachel owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of different products to earn a living. She has 6 years of experience in this business. Each month, she earns approximately 6,840 PHP from her business.

She requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to re-sell. Rachel has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rachel wants to expand her business and to help her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to re-sell

loans.name: Blas Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Blas  de 46 años de edad, está casado con la señora Ramona de 49  años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de hortalizas de su propia producción.
La pareja tiene seis hijos, tres varones y tres niñas, de los cuales la mayor es estudiante de Facultad, y el varón mayor de 18 años ya ayuda a su padre. Blas comenta que hace mas de 25 años se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería, construcción y plomería, de joven fue chofer, pero luego se lanzo a realizar obras de edificios, como vivienda, colocación de cerámicas, plomería y otros. 
Su cónyuge colabora con el cuidado de los hijos y de sacar adelante la producción de su huerta. Es admirable la actitud e interés del señor Blas por la educación de sus hijos, él busca recursos para llevar a cabo la educación superior de sus hijos, ya que están apartados de la ciudad y cuentan con pocos recursos.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad ofrecida y manifiesta que estaría destinando el capital para la compra de una mezcladora que le va a ayudar muchísimo para mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr Blas, age 46, is married to Ramona, age 49. Ramona sells vegetables which she grows herself. They have six children, three boys and three girls. Their oldest daughter is in university, and their oldest son, age 18, helps his father.
Blas tells us that he has worked in brick laying, construction, and plumbing for over 25 years. When he was young, he was a driver, but he then decided to work on buildings; working on homes, installing pipes, plumbing, and other such things.
His wife helps take care of the children and works in their garden. Blas' interest in his children's education, and his attitude toward it, is admirable. He is trying to get the necessary resources to put his older children through higher education. They live outside of the city and have few resources.
Blas thanks the Fundacion Paraguaya for the opportunity they are offering and says that he will use this loan to buy a mixer. This will help him greatly to improve his work.

loans.use: to buy a mixer.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres y esta estudiando en la universidad.

Él se ha dedicado desde muy pequeño a la agricultura, fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron. José siembra maíz y maicillo, se levanta a las 3:30 a.m. todos los días, porque alimenta y ordeña a sus vacas, a las 4:30 a.m. las va a dejar a un terreno y él se va a trabajar a sus cultivos, para llegar ahí tiene que recorrer un kilómetro.

Los insumos agrícolas que necesita, los compra en una ciudad del oriente del país, por mayor comodidad. José ya tiene listos sus cultivos, para ser recolectados, por eso solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar una yunta de bueyes, que le facilite el traslado del maíz y ahorrarse ese pago, ya que en su comunidad ese servicio es pagado a un precio alto. Cuando termine de utilizar los bueyes los venderá, para recibir ese ingreso. Al tener un mayor margen de ganancia, le servirá para mantener a su familia, pagarse su estudio y terminar su carrera universitaria que es su mayor sueño.
texts.en:
José is nineteen years old. He is single, living with his parents, and is studying at the university.

José has been working in agriculture since he was very young. His parents were the ones who taught him agricultural skills. José plants corn and sorghum and wakes up at 3:30 AM every day to feed and milk his cows. At 4:30 AM he takes the cattle to their pasture and he walks one kilometer to attend to his crops.

He buys the necessary agricultural supplies in a city in the east of the country, for convenience. José has his crops ready to be harvested, and that is why is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo to purchase a team of oxen. This would facilitate that transport of corn and would save him money, since in his community this service is offered at a very high price. When he is finished using the oxen he will sell them to get that revenue back. 

By having a higher profit margin, he will be able to support his family, pay for his studies, and finish his college career which is his biggest dream.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya where he produces milk and vegetables for the local market. He has been in farming for the last four years and to generate additional income, is also employed as a motorcycle driver.

Paulo has requested funding from Juhudi Kilimo for his farming business. He wants a loan of 30,000 KES to help him buy poultry birds to expand into the poultry business. He says the additional income will enable him buy his own motorcycle and then he will not have to rely on the income he gets from being employed as a motorcycle driver. He adds that the income will improve his family's living standards.

Paulo notes that finances are hard to come by and Juhudi Kilimo loan services are very handy for farmers. He reiterates also that diseases are a great challenge in the area.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo es soltero, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar. El se dedica a la venta de pescados que el mismo trae de las rivera del río Paraguay, se dedica a esto hace como 5 años, 
nos comenta que tiene todo lo que necesita para poder dedicarse a este trabajo.
Comenta que este trabajo lo ha ayudado a salir adelante y ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa. El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante y por progresar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de una congeladora, ya que le ayudará mucho en su negocio. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Señor Hugo, age 31, is single. He lives in Pilar city and sells fish which he fishes himself from the Rio Paraguay's brooks. He has done this for approximately five years.
He tells us that he has everything he needs in order to do this work.
He also tells us that this job has helped him to help his family with the household costs and to get them ahead. He is a very hard-working person who has always taken pains to get ahead and succeed.
He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a freezer, which will help him greatly in his business. He thanks the Fundacion for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for selling fish.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 31 years old. He has three children between the ages of 2 and 7. Two of his children go to school. 

Jean Bosco has been running a food business for three years. He has requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for his children. He would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald tiene una imprenta con la cual genera sus ingresos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina tipográfica, pues la que está usando es antigua y ya no funciona correctamente. Ronald  es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Huaychani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a Impro y la segunda vez con kiva. Su historial crediticio es excelente.
texts.en: Ronald has a print shop that generates his income. He needs the loan to buy a printing machine because the one he’s using is antique and does not function correctly.  Ronald is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Huaychani zone.  This is the fifth time he’s worked with Impro and the second with Kiva.  His credit history is excellent.

loans.use: to buy a printing machine for his print shop.

loans.name: Tasla

texts.fr: Madame Tasla est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans et mère de huit enfants et deux qui lui sont confiés.Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis sa création et fait partie du groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey.Elle est unie avec ses camarades par des liens sociaux.Tasla s'active dans le commerce de produits divers depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.Avec son nouveau crédit de 400000 lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandise qu'elle va revendre au niveau de son quartier.Les bénéfices lui permettent de gérer ses besoins personnels et entretenir sa maison qu'elle à mis en location.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tasla, age 53, is married and the mother of eight children. She also has two other children entrusted to her care. She's been a member of the "banc villageois" since its establishment  and is part of Takku Liggey Group. She's linked to the other members by social bonds.

For a long time, Tasla's business has been to buy and sell various products, and she has a good experience in this field. With her new XOF 400'000 loan, she will be able to buy supplies to resell in her neighborhood.

Her profits enable her to provide for her own needs and maintain her house, which she rents out.

loans.use: to buy various products to resell

loans.name: Victoire's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Victoire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Victoire âgée de 44 ans a très fréquenté peu l’école. Victoire est mariée à chauffeur du nom de Pierre. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Victoire et son mari. Pour cette raison, Victoire vend des savons par la technique de distribution depuis cinq ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Victoire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Victoire sollicite ensemble avec le seul membre de son groupe, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des savons.

loans.name: Jesudogbe Group

texts.fr: JESUDOGBE est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philomène (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Philomène n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Philomène est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Marius. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Philomène et son mari. Pour cette raison, Philomène vend des brosses à dents végétales et des œufs dans sa région depuis quatre ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Philomène sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUDOGBE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des brosses à dent végétale et des œufs.

loans.name: Benitp Javier

texts.es:
El Joven Benito Javier, se dedica a la venta de CD y  DVD desde hace ocho  años, para llevar el sustento a su familia,  inicia a exhibir sus productos a su clientela a las 08:00 am finalizando a las 05:00 pm con este mismo horario de lunes a  sábado en este mismo horario.
 
El Joven Benito solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el cual fue empleado para la compra de juego play station, DVD y CD, los cuales le permitirán incrementar su inventario y capital de trabajo, el joven sueña con la preparación de sus cuatro hijos que están a su cargo.

loans.use: Compra de juego play station, DVD y CD

loans.name: Sayoramoh

texts.ru: Милая женщина из замечательного района Вахш, это Сайёрамох. Ей 32 года. Она любимая жена и прекрасная мать одного 7 летного сына. Сайёрамох занимается поваром в ресторане «Муниса». Она вкусно готовить у нее золотые руки. Этим делом занимается более 4 года. Ее муж работает администратором в том ресторане, которым ее жена занимается поваром. Этой ресторане проводят свадьбы, банкеты  и мероприятие. Сейчас у них в ресторане часто проводят свадьбы и банкеты, в день 2-3 раза. У Сайёрамох не хватает посуды, и  по той причине она  решила взять кредит, чтобы  приобрести необходимые средств. У Сайёрамох  мечта стать хорошим поваром и открыть собственный ресторан. Только Вы можете помочь ей!
texts.en:
A sweet woman from the district of Vakhsh, that’s Sayoramoh. She is 50 years old. She is a beloved wife and a mother of a seven-year-old son. 

Sayoramoh is a chef at the “Munis” restaurant. She has “golden hands” – she is a talented cook, her dishes are delicious. She has been in this business for over 4 years. Her husband is the manager in this restaurant where his wife is the chef. There are weddings, banquets and other events held at the restaurant.  Right now they have 2-3 weddings and banquets a day. There is not enough kitchenware for Sayoramoh, that’s why she is requesting a loan to buy the necessary utensils. Sayoramoh is dreaming to become a great cook and open her own restaurant. Only you can help her!

loans.use: to buy more kitchenware

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the sixteen members of the Kacoumpa women’s association in the village Loudia Ouoloff in the southern Casamance region of Senegal. Casamance is a post-conflict area, and many of its inhabitants who fled the separatist war there have only recently returned to rebuild their villages and their livelihoods. Represented by their leader Fatou Ba, this group describes their business activities as follows:

“The village of Loudia Ouoloff is located in the department of Oussouye and it is the capital of the district. It has more than 4,000 inhabitants who live around a village chief, in perfect harmony. The village of Loudia Ouoloff is about 9 km from the capital of the department; its inhabitants make a living from agriculture.

The purpose of the loan is to set up a rotating fund which will enable us to restart the business activities of the group. It will allow us to invest in projects that we villagers have created ourselves. Our group has engaged in commercial activities for a long time, with a focus on purchasing and retailing various types of merchandise. Our group also specialized in other areas such as weaving mats, making fruit and vegetable preserves, handmade brooms, etc. In order to restart these activities, the group requests a loan to enable us to allow fruits and vegetables to be made into preserves, and to pay palm-wine makers to provide us with the palm fronds we need to make the brooms and weave mats.”

Original French :

« Contexte du Projet: le village de Loudia Ouoloff est situer dans le département de Oussouye et il Est un chef lieu d\'arrondissement, i compte plus de 4000 habitants vivant autour d\'un chef de village Et en parfaite harmonie. Le village de Loudia Ouoloff est distant de 9 Km de la capitale départemental ; ces populations vivent de l’agriculture.

Objectifs du Prêt : L’objectif général consiste à avoir un fon de roulement afin de pouvoir relancé les activités du groupement. Il s’agit entre autre de pouvoir financé les projets que se sont créer les villageois eux même.

Activités : Le groupement mène depuis longtemps des activités commerciales dont la plus remarquée reste l’achat et la vente de marchandise divers. En outre le groupement s’est spécialisé dans d’autres domaines tel que le tissage des nattes, la transformation de fruits et légumes, la confection de balais, etc.…. Pour ce faire, le groupement sollicite un financement lui permettant de pouvoir acheté les fruits et légume pour la transformation, payé les récolteurs de vin de palme afin qu’il puissent mettre à leur disposition les rames de palmier pour la confection des balais et le tissage des natte. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables; transportation to market

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She operates a little store that serves snacks to the public. She is supplied by Coca-Cola Bottling branch in Takoradi once a week. Even though she has a wide client base, her supplies are highly limited by her capital. She would therefore like to seek the KIVA loan to increase the quantity of crates she buys on weekly basis.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 35, married and has four children. She has a small grocery store run from her home, where her neighbors from close by communities purchase supplies for their homes. Rosario travels one time a week to San Cristobal to stock her products, and using public transportation, it takes her two hours. Her goal is to expand her business and to buy a wider variety of products. She belongs to the group Pantelho 9.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

ROSARIO TIENE 35 AÑOS, CASADA, CUATRO HIJOS, TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES DONDE LE COMPRAN LOS VECINOS DE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS, QUIENES ABASTECEN SUS CASAS CON LOS PRODUCTOS QUE ELLA VENDE. ROSARIO VIAJA UNA VEZ A LA SEMANA A SAN CRISTOBAL PARA ABASTECER SU NEGOCIO USANDO TRANSPORTE COLECTIVO SE DEMORA DOS HORAS. SU OBJETIVO ES AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO Y COMPRAR MAS SURTIDO DE MERCADERIA. PERTENECE AL GRUPO PANTELHO 9.

loans.use:
"Vender"

COMERCIANTE

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego C. Alarcon is 32 years old and married with 2 children, both in local schools. His wife is named Laura Rosalia and she works at a large supermarket in the center of the city.

Diego has a fierce entrepreneurial spirit and he tells us that, even as a small child, he went out to work. Today, he has his own fast-food stand where he sells empanadas, sandwiches, rosquillas (a traditional pastry), and soft drinks. He’s managed to develop a well established set of customers, working mostly with street vendors who come to buy his food very early in the morning and then sell it on the streets of the city.

The food stand is very successful and is now the largest in the area. Furthermore, it is across from a bus stop and, consequently, the majority of its customers are people waiting for buses. He’s been operating this business for 5 years now, working with his mother who he helps to make the food.

Diego hopes to keep on expanding his business; to do so, he needs to buy supplies of basic foodstuffs--the most important of which are meat, eggs, flour and soft drinks—at wholesale prices and delivered to his door, so that he can save the time and effort that he now expends everyday to go to the market for supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Diego C. A. tiene 32 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, ambos están estudiando en un colegio público de la ciudad; su señora se llama Laura Rosalía y es empleada de un gran supermercado ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad.

Diego posee un fuerte espíritu emprendedor, el nos cuenta que desde muy niño salió a las calles a trabajar, hoy día tiene su propio stand de comida rápida donde vende empanadas, sándwich, rosquillas y gaseosas. Tiene así una clientela bien formada, el trabaja mayormente con vendedores ambulantes que acuden a su negocio bien temprano por las mañanas para comprar de él sus comidas y luego las venden recorriendo las calles de la ciudad.

Es un copetín muy exitoso ya que es el más grande del área y a más de eso está localizado frente a una parada de autobús y es así es como también la mayoría de sus clientes son gente que está esperando para el autobús. Está operando este negocio hace ya 5 años, trabaja junto con su madre que la ayuda a elaborar las comidas.

Diego está deseoso de seguir ampliando su negocio, para ello desea comprar sus materias primas al por mayor tales como carne, huevo, harina y gaseosas de esta forma podrá realizar los pedidos para ser entregados a domicilio y se ahorra tiempo y esfuerzos pues el acude al mercado todos los días para adquirir sus insumos.

loans.use: Buy basic supplies, the most important of which are meat, eggs, flour and soft drinks.

loans.name: Vaalele

texts.en: Vaalele F. is a young talented woman who chose operating a taxi as her small business.  She’s twenty-six years old with four children.  Her husband does most of the job driving the whole day and night to earn money to fulfill the needs of her family and kids.  She earns more than two hundred tala a day.  She is very happy about her business, because she believed in herself that she would expand her business in the near future.  She is thankful to S.P.B.D for this programme to help poor women assist with their families' needs.  She will use her loan to buy tires for the car, brake fluid, oil, etc.

loans.use: To purchase tires, brake fluid, oil, etc.

loans.name: Melita Levi

texts.pt:
Melita is a single mom. She has 4 children. All of Melita’s children attend school. She started the business to pay for her children’s schooling as well as other household expenses. If the business does well, she plans to expand her house to accommodate her growing children. She entered the program in 2004.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Melita e mae solteira. Ela tem 4 filhos. Todos os filhos de Melita estao a estudar. Por isso ela faz este negocio para poder pagar os estudos dos seus filhos e pagar outras despesas de sua casa.Se o negocio correr bem ela pensa no futuro ampliar a sua residencia uma vez que os filhos estao a crescer. Ela entrou para o Program em 2004.

loans.use: Melita would like to use the money to buy more wrap skirts for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIAL FOR HER EMBROIDERY BUSINESS

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
"If you need to buy eggs, go see Ms Dân in Tân Minh village. Her eggs are big, with a big yolk. Her chickens are meaty. And she give you good prices", that's what people from the Vệ Sơn Đoài hamlet are saying about Ms Dân. She is 55 years old, a member of TYM since 1995 in the Tân Minh village. Her success today is due to hard work and determination. She started with a loan of 20 USD which was used to raise chickens thus supplying food to her family. She also brewed rice wine. The next year, due to the successful sales of her batch of chickens, she was confident enough to take out a loan to buy 200 chickens. In 2006, she received a loan of 625 USD which was used to expand her operation, buidimg new cages for her chickens. Today, she has 250 egg laying chickens, 1300 for meat. Her revenue is 300 USD a month. Ms Dân is very happy about her success and she hopes to be able to expand her operation again. This time she is requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy chicken feed, getting ready for the new year rush.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

"Nếu ai có nhu cầu về trứng gà, hãy đến nhà chị Dân ở xã Tân Minh. Trứng gà của chị vừa to lại vừa nhiều lòng đỏ, gà thì con nào cũng béo chắc, khoẻ mạnh. Ngon mà rẻ lắm". Đó là lời người dân thôn Vệ Sơn Đoài vẫn thường rỉ tai nhau khi nói về chị Trần Thị Dân, 55 tuổi, thành viên cụm 22 xã Tân Minh. Chị Dân tham gia Quỹ năm 1995, đến nay đã được trên 10 năm. Nghe chị kể lại quá trình tham gia Quỹ mới thấy chị thật đảm đang, tháo vát. Mới đầu chị chỉ dám vay mức 20USD để chăn nuôi gà thịt, cung cấp thức ăn trong gia đình và nấu rượu bán. Năm tiếp theo, thấy mình khá mát tay trong nuôi gà, chị mạnh dạn vay vốn và đầu tư nuôi 200 con gà. Kết quả kinh doanh có lãi, năm 2006, chị xin vay 625USD để mở rộng chăn nuôi và xây chuồng trại. Hiện tại, trong chuồng trại nhà chị có 250 gà đẻ trứng, 1300 con gà thịt cho thu nhập 300USD/tháng. Chị Dân rất vui với thành quả của mình và mong muốn dự án của mình sẽ còn phát triển mạnh nữa. Vòng vốn này, chị có nhu cầu vay 950USD để mua thêm thức ăn cho gà, vỗ béo để chuẩn bị cho Tết Âm lịch Mậu Tý.

loans.use: Buy chicken-feed

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is 37 years old, and for the last fifteen years she has worked as a clerk for the FAGASACRUZ business while at the same time developing her work as a merchant. Her husband dedicates himself to offering his gardening services, and on Sunday, they both sell breakfasts at the market in their neighborhood. Cecilia's family consists of her husband and their three dependent children, aged 11, 9 and 3. Due to their experience and the amount of time they've been in business, they have very little competition.

Their present request is for acquiring ingredients for making breakfasts, and for their respective sales. The prices of these goods vary with scarcity in the market and with the season. This is the fourth deal Cecilia has had with Agrocapital, and in that time she has proven herself to be responsible and punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Cecilia es una señora de 37 años de edad, trabaja desde hace 15 años como dependiente en la empresa FAGASACRUZ y paralelamente desarrolla sus actividades como comerciante. Su esposo se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios como jardinero y ambos venden los días domingos desayunos en la feria de su barrio. La familia de Cecilia está compuesta por su esposo y sus tres hijos de 11, 9 y 3 años de edad que dependen de ellos. Debido al tiempo de experiencia y antigüedad en su trabajo no cuenta con mucha competencia. La presente soliciutd es para la adquisición de insumos para la elaboración de los desayunos y su respectiva comercialización los días domingos, los precios de estos insumos varian de acuerdo a la escacez de estos en el mercado o bien de la época. Esta es la cuarta operación de Cecilia con Agrocapital y en ese tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos.

loans.use: Ingredients for breakfast sales

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
The sale of packaged goods and bread products is Lili’s daily routine. She is 37 years old and is the mother of 5 children. This working woman wishes to better the environment of her business and implement a lager quantity of products now that this activity has become economically sustaining, and is what supports her and her family. This is because her store is the only one in the city that supplies so many families. With your important help Lili will be able to put into motion this project of hers in no time

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La venta de abarrotes y productos de pan llevar es la rutina diaria de la señora Lili, quien a sus 37 años, es madre de 05 hijos. Ésta trabajadora madre desea mejorar los ambientes de su negocio e implementarlo con mayor cantidad de productos ya que esta actividad se ha convertido en el sustento económico diario de su familia y porque es la única tienda en varios metros a la redonda de las que se abastecen diariamente una inmensa cantidad de familias.Con tu importante apoyo Lili podrá poner en marcha su proyecto en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Implement her business

loans.name: Kith

texts.en: Kith S. is 30 years old and has been farming rice and various kinds of vegetables since 1995. She makes less than $1 doing this. Her husband works in their village in Kampong Cham as a traditional doctor and earns $4 a day.  They have four children. Mrs. Kith has applied for a loan to buy additional medical supplies for her husband's practice. This will allow him to provide services to people beyond those in their immediate village. She will use any money left over from the loan to buy commercial fertilizer for their rice and vegetable fields.

loans.use: To buy medicine and additional health care equipment.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Over the years, ClotilD. has worked hard to obtain what she always longed for: to have a tight family and solid financial base. For this reason, on a daily basis, she applies the teachings that she learned as a girl from her beloved parents. She is devoted to the raising of animals and, thanks to her hard work, she has continued to be able to improve their living conditions and the breed of her animals. She wishes for a loan in order to acquire a greater quantity of balanced food and to improve her stable. .

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Durante años Doña ClotilD., se ha esforzado por conseguir lo que siempre ha anhelado, tener una familia muy unida y una sólida economía; por esa razón aplica a diario las enseñanzas que aprendió desD. niña D. sus amados padres.Se dedica a la actividad ganadera y gracias a su desempeño continuo ha podido mejorar sus condiciones D. crianza y la raza D. sus animalitos. Desea un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad D. alimento balanceado y para mejorar su establo.

loans.use: Purchase balanced food.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
The Conima district is the birthplace of Victoria, who left her village as a child, along with her younger brothers, in search of better opportunities. Once she had her own family she decided to dedicate herself to selling fuels and gas, merchandise that she acquires from the city of La Paz, Bolivia, and sells in the city of Juliaca, thereby earning essential income to support her family and above all the education of her beloved sons. While Victoria dedicates herself to this profession, her dear husband works providing taxi service to their community. Victoria wishes to acquire a loan that after investing will enable her to improve her income and thereby also improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El distrito de Conima es el pueblo natal de Doña Victoria, quien desde niña salió de su villa en busca de mejores oportunidades junto a sus menores hermanos, una vez que formó su familia decidió dedicarse al negocio de venta de combustibles y gas, mercadería que adquiere de la ciudad de la Paz - Bolivia y oferta en la ciudad de Juliaca obteniendo ganancias indispensables para el sustento de su familia y sobre todo para la educación de sus amados hijos.Mientras Doña Victoria se dedica a esta labor su querido esposo trabaja brindando servicio de taxi a su comunidad, el deseo de Victoria es adquirir un préstamo que luego de su inversión le permitirán mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Capital to continue her work in order to benefit her family

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., aged 50, joined TYM Fund in 2004. In the first round of loan, Mrs. H. asked for 3.000.000 VND to invest into a small business, which didn’t generate much profit. She then switched to the business of molding and selling steel and concrete mixer. As the demand for building materials has been enormous in recent years, the business has been relatively lucrative. She has been able to purchase more furniture for her home and build houses for her two children. The smallest one is living with her. In the next round of loan, Mrs. H. wishes to borrow 15.000.000VND ($900) to invest into concrete mixers. Her family’s income is about 5.000.000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương 50 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2004 vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán nhỏ, thu nhập từ dự án này là không cao nên vòng vốn sau chị đã chuyển hướng kinh doanh, vợ chồng chị bàn bạc kinh doanh buôn bán, đúc ép cóc bê tông, trong điều kiện kinh tế phát triển như hiện nay nhu cầu xây dựng tăng cao nên việc kinh doanh mặt hàng này rất phù hợp, thu nhập cao kinh tế gia đình phát triển hơn chị đã mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình ngoài ra chị đã xây dựng và cho 2 con ra ở riêng, 1 con hiện đang sống cùng gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đâu tư vào buôn bán cọc bê tông.

Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is married with two children aged one and three years old. She has owned and run a small stationery business since 2006. Every day she works from 7am to midnight and earns a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Pendo now hopes for a loan to buy more stationery items to sell in her store to increase profits.

loans.use: To buy more stationery items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: La señora Marianela M. H., tiene  29 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo de cuatro meses de nacido, su esposo trabaja como gestor de cobro en la empresa de acueductos y alcantarillados ENACAL, la actividad economica de la señora es una pequeña tienda de ropa para niños, cosmeticos y calzado para niños, actividad que tiene ocho años de desarrollar, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion, teniendo como proposito invertir mas capital  a su negocio, su deseo ahora que tiene un hijo, es poder adquirir una casa propia, su sueño es poder visitar a su ama en los estados unidos, dicho negocio da inicio como una idea de su esposo en poder obtener otros ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. Marianela M. H. is 29 years old and married. She has a four-month old son, and her husband works as an agent for ENACAL, selling irrigation and sewer systems. Marianela has a small store where she sells children's clothes and shoes, and cosmetics. Her husband suggested creating the business as a means of earning extra income and improving their standard of living. Marianela's store is located in her home, and she has managed it for eight years. Now that she has a child, Marianela would like to invest more capital into her business, so that she can buy a house of her own. Marianela's dream is to visit her childhood nanny in the U.S.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Taualofa

texts.en: Taualofa T., 49, is married with 5 children. She has 3 years of experience in the banana chips, pancakes, porkcakes, and ice cakes business. She sells to the village and general public 6 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Taualofa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve business and help out with her family. Her husband helps out with the business too.

loans.use: to further improve business status and also help to improve her home and help with her childrens' educations

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma has been selling dresses and making clothes in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. Currently, she is able to earn a profit of approximately $50 each month. Salma is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more material and clothing to increase her output.

Salma is 20 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and materials to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Туракулова Шарофат проживает в районе Гиссар.Возраст 34 года, замужм и имеет троих детей. Уже 6 лет занимается торговлей. Кредит хочет получить , чтобы завезти сезонный товар. Она торгует детской и взрослой одеждой. Шарофат одна обеспечивает свою семью. Погась кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharofat T. lives in the Gissar District. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children. For the past 6 years she has worked in sales. She would like to obtain a loan in order to introduce seasonal goods. She sells children's and adult clothing. She can repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Najjanakumbi B-Margret Group

texts.en:
N. Margret, 46, is a widow with 4 children within ages 9-18 years. She also supports her two siblings due to the death of her parents. Margret is  a hardworking and committed lady  who sells scones and cakes around Kampala. She has been in business 5 years, but due to insufficient funds, she has no ovens. She therefore takes her ingredients to a nearby bakery where she has the snacks baked. 

She supplies to retailers around town hence earning an average profit of Ush 120,000 per week. On a good day she makes sales worth Ush 80,000. She is using the loan to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil. She retains her customers by being polite and friendly to them. She dreams of acquiring her own ovens so that she can set up her own bakery. Increased income would enable her to put her children through  school successfully.

loans.use: Purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
La familia F. tiene su casa en un reciente fraccionamiento al sur de la ciudad, ellos desean iniciar con las mejoras a la vivienda, y como primer punto será el piso exterior pues actualmente es terracería, la elaboración del piso de concreto es primordial pues en tiempos de lluvia no es posible transitar por allí.
El Sr. F. trabaja para una línea transportista y por lo regular está fuera de la ciudad por tal motivo no aparece en la fotografía, sólo se contacto a su esposa y a una de sus hijas. 
Son una excelente familia y esperan su colaboración para lograr lo descrito.
texts.en:
The F. family has a house in a recently built neighborhood on the south side of the city. They would like to begin making some improvements to their house, starting with the outer room, which currently just has a dirt floor. It is impossible to walk through the room when it rains, so putting in a concrete floor is essential. Mr. F. works for a transportation company and is usually out of the city, which is why he does not appear in the photo; only his wife and one of his daughters are shown. They are a fine family and await your contribution so they can achieve their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction on outer room of their house.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Suleyman A. is 40 years old and is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs like cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea, sugar, eggs and many others in his grocery store that he has been renting for the last five years. Currently, Suleyman has about $2000 of goods in inventory. His monthly net profit is about $200. Today, Suleyman is requesting a loan of $1200 for the term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress in their studies. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs to resell in his grocery store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her family in Asaba, Delta State, in Nigeria. Rose operates her own vending business, and is requesting a loan to sell more provisions and food items. She would like to thank all her lenders in advance for their generosity and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and food stuffs to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate K. is a single parent with two children. She has received schooling through the junior high level. Kate is a hair dresser who owns a beauty salon at Adisadel near Cape Coast, which she has operated since 2003. Kate uses her income to pay for her children's school fees, rent, utility bills, and other living expenses. Kate will use the loan to purchase a variety of hair products to meet the demand of her salon customers. She plans to reinvest the profits from her expanded business into her salon.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for her hair salon.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: La jeune dame Fatoumata Soumaré est agée de 29 ans, mariée et a en charge 06 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissu teint « Thioup » et souhaite renforcer son capital. Elle compte ainsi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille en nourriture et santé.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Soumaré is a young lady, aged 29, married and responsible for 6 children. She sells dyed cloth called "Thioup" and would like to bolster her working capital. In this way, she expects to be be able to help cover her family's needs in food and health concerns.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of dyed cloth

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma B. is 38 years old and lives in Barangay Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. Her husband Victor is a jeepney driver, and they have a one-year-old daughter named Divine Asley.  

She is a meat vendor and store owner in their village. Her husband is very supportive of her endeavor, and her daughter serves as her inspiration to make it profitable.  

She is asking for a loan amount of PHP 25,000.00 to purchase different merchandise that she can stock in her store to meet the demands of her customers. She aims to improve her business and she is doing her best towards a successful life.

loans.use: To purchase different merchandise for her store

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman A. is a 45-year-old farmer who breeds calves for meat production. He started his business in 2001. He is a repair master but orders for repair are very random in his village. Calf breeding is the only source of income in Salman`s family. He is married and has two children. He would like to expand his business and purchase two more calves.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Pania

texts.en:
"Before, I was just a housewife who had no income. I started my sari-sari (variety) store business in 1978. Now, I am still able to manage my business. I want to make good in my business to be able to send and finish all my children in school," says Pania N., the mother of seven children.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 18,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to  buy additional merchandise for her business. The loan will really help her grow her business. The loan will also help attract more customers as well.

Through CEVI, she is still able to sustain her livelihood. CEVI provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise in her store

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (1220060273) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has two adult children.

M. owns and operates a restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 1,800,000 VND a month.

In 2006, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.

M. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Gbajumo

texts.en: O. is a fashion designer and clothes seller. She is business oriented. She has been in this business since the year 1991. O. is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She has been with LAPO for 2 years and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. O. is requesting for a $950 loan to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials. She thanks you, the Kiva lender.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Chunaidullo

texts.ru: Чунайдулло Гузиев проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена работает колхозницей. Чунайдулло более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает рис и продает его на рынке. Кредит просит для покупки удобрений и семян, чтобы посеить урожай.
texts.en:
Chunaidullo G. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 31 years old, married and has four children. His wife works on the farm. Chunaidullo has been in agriculture for more than five years. He grows rice and sells it on the market. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to sow a harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow rice

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita E. owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling baked goods commonly known as "puto" (steamed rice cakes) in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has one adult child. She is from the city of Dipolog. Anita has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Anita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make steamed rice cakes

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia P., 54, is from the town of Dumalinao. She is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Abundia does clothing alterations and tailoring. She has been in business for over 20 years and earns about 5000.00 PHP a month.

In 2007, Abundia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Abundia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000.00 PHP from PMPC. This was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Abundia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to buy additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her 3rd loan with PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

--------------------------- Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Raphaela

texts.en:
Raphaela is a member of the Frelimo borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is 32 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 18,  and 13 years old.

Raphaela has owned a shop business  for 8 years, she works 14 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Raphaela`s second loan from BRAC-Tanzania, she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Raphaela hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her shop

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado D. Pusuyo del Distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. el Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 51 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 08 hijos, vive en  la comunidad D. Inticaya, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año y medio, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/.1600.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá aumentar su capital para la compra D. ganado ovino y una vaca para engorD., los cuales luego D. la mejora los comercializara en las ferias D. la zona, nos cuenta que también se dedica a la crianza D. ganado y sus chacras.

Su mayor deseo es poder comprar mas ganado y ser mayorista.

A ella le  gustan   las reuniones.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 51, married, and has eight children. She lives in the Inticaya community. She has an elementary school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling livestock. She now needs a new loan for 1,600 PEN, which will allow her to buy sheep and a cow to fatten. After improving them, she sells them in regional fairs. She tells us that she also raises livestock and works her farm. Her biggest wish is to be able to buy more livestock and be a wholesaler. She likes the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and a cow

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn P. is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City. She is 42 years old. Evelyn is single. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a direct sales business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling beauty products from Avon and others in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Paz se formo en la ciudad de Cuenca,  ésta es una ciudad muy rica por su cultura y tradiciones como los días de los santos inocentes, el pase del niño viajero, entre otras, costumbres que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero. Sus integrantes  son un grupo de personas que se unieron para buscar mejoras sociales y económicas logrando consolidar una gran amistad, respeto  y ayuda mutua para salir adelante con sus familias.
< p>
La señora  María D. es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la parroquia de Quinta Chica en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 47 años de edad y se encuentra separada de su esposo hace varios años, tiene 5 hijos de 28, 25, 21, 16 y 4 años de edad, sus  primeros hijos ya trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos de la casa, aun no tienen casa propia viven arrendando. 

María trabaja en el mercado 9 de Octubre de la ciudad de Cuenca desde  hace 28 años, vende  todo tipo de grano tierno y cocinado, su trabajo consiste en recorrer todo el mercado  ofreciendo sus productos.

Este es su tercer año trabajando con los  préstamos de la banca comunal y segura que con ellos ha podido sobrellevar su negocio,  con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la FUNDACION ESPOIR  va a comprar otra variedad de granos secos como arveja, fréjol, habas, maní, etc. para abastecer mejor su negocio y así atraer a más clientes.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia para tranquilidad de toda la familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Paz" was formed in the city of Cuenca, which is a city that is very rich in its culture and traditions, such as the Day of the Innocent Saints, and El Pase del Nino Viajero (parade honoring the traveling Infant Jesus), among others. These are traditional celebrations that attract both national and international tourists. The members of the communal bank are a group of people that are united in looking to improve their social and economic situation, working to build a great friendship, respect and mutual assistance so that they can move their families ahead. Señora María D. is a member of the communal bank "La Paz." She lives in the Quinta Chica parish in the city of Cuenca. She is 47 years old and has been separated from her husband for a number of years. She has 5 children, age 28, 25, 21,16 and 4 years. Her oldest children already work and they help her with the household expenses; they live in a rented home, as they do not own their own home. Maria has worked in the market "9 de Octubre" in the city of Cuenca for 28 years. She sells all kinds of cooked beans; when she works she walks all around the market offering her products. This is her third year working with the loans of the communal bank, and she is convinced that they have helped her to improve her business. With this new loan that the FUNDACION ESPOIR is making, she is going to buy a variety of dried beans such as peas, kidney beans, broad beans and peanuts, etc., to better supply her business and in this way attract more customers. Her main dream is to be able to own her own home for the tranquility of the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of dried beans such as peas, peanuts, kidney beans, and broad beans to supply her business

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a Palestinian hardworking woman and the mother of four children, one of whom is married.

Ahlam works in several businesses: she raises goats and sheep to sell and currently has more than thirty; she also has birds that she sells, either for food or for their lovely sounds; she even raises peacocks which she sells for their feathers.

Currently, after her husband became sick and was not able to work on a continuous basis, she decided to establish a greenhouse to grow and sell vegetables; she already has the land and the basic equipments in addition to the necessary experience.

Ahlam received several loans from FATEN and has repaid them all in full and on time. Now she needs 2,500 USD to start her greenhouse. She appears in the photo at her barn.

loans.use: To establish a greenhouse

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La señora Juana Francisca tiene 57 años de edad es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de manualidades, por lo que tiene más de 4 años de tener esta actividad, ya que surgió como una alternativa de trabajo para ella y su familia por lo que su salario no le ajusta para pagar las deudas del hogar. Por lo que es por medio de Fundación León 2000 que ha logrado obtener estos financiamientos que hacen que su negocio mejore cada día. El sueño de Juana es mantener seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es el único medio de vida que tiene. Por lo que el financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo ya que tiene muchos encargos pendientes y no ha podido entregarlos porque no tiene el suficiente capital.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca, 57, is a very enterprising woman who takes pleasure in her work. She makes and sells handicrafts, a job at which she has more than four years of experience ever since it became her and her family's alternative to her job for as her salary wasn't enough to meet the debt she owed on her home. Through the Fundación León 2000 she has been able to receive loans that improve her business day by day. Juana hopes that she will continue operating her business now that it is the only way of life that she has. This loan will be used for working capital since she has many pending orders that she has not been able to fill due to a lack of funds.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer
