loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: La señora Ofelia Z. Z. es casada con el señor Juan Pablo Falcón y son propietarios de un negocio de nombre “Abarrotes Falcón “establecido desde hace 4 años, el labora para una empresa de venta de frituras desde hace 4 años, y están tramitando este crédito para una inversión en compra de mercancía por mayoreo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ofelia Z. Z. is married to Mr. Juan Pablo Falcón; they own a business named "Falcón Groceries" which they established four years ago. Juan Pablo has also worked for four years in a company that produces fried snacks, and he and Ofelia have been attempting to get this loan so that they can buy products at wholesale quantities for their business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wholesale supplies to sell in their business

loans.name: Daniel Group

texts.en: Eric is a 39-year-old man. He is married and has two children. Both of his children are in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a mostly commercial community. Eric is a poultry farmer. He is the leader of a trust bank group called Daniel. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Eric, the group leader is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more poultry

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe Jekafo sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koko, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatorzième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles font comme activités la vente  de fruits, charbons de bois, patates douces,  beurres de Karité etc.   
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1chargement de charrette  en orange, 7 régimes de bananes,  5 paniers d’ananas, 105 sacs de charbons de bois, 2 chargements de charrette en patates et 300kg de beurre de Karité. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  généralement dans les villages  environnants de Kadiolo. Acheminés  à Kadiolo les produits sont stockés dans des magasins à domicile. Elles vendent au marché de Kadiolo, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé comme contribution aux dépenses familiales (nourriture, santé et habillement) et le reste investis dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The four members of the Jekafo group are essentially married women 37 years old on average, with an average of five children each. Most live in polygamous families in Koko - one of Kadiolo’s neighbourhoods - in the third administrative region of Mali. They cooperate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customer’s needs, and have been granted 14 loans to date. All preceding loans were fully reimbursed. Their activities are selling fruit, charcoal, sweet potatoes, Karité butter, etc. With their new loan, they want to buy: • one cartload of oranges • seven banana bunches • five baskets of pineapples • 105 bags of charcoal • two cartloads of sweet potatoes • 300 kilos of Karité butter They usually get their supplies from villages near Kadiolo. Once brought to Kadiolo, the merchandise is stocked in home-based shops. They sell their wares in the Kadiolo market, as itinerant retailers, or from their home. They are paid directly or quite often on credit, from a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach individual monthly earnings of 37,500 FCFA on average, part of which will be used as a contribution to meeting family expenses (food, healthcare and clothing), and the remainder reinvested in their business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 39 years old, married to Andrew Karanja, and they have two school-going children. She has been in this quarry business since 2007.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this will be her second loan. She plans to use the cash to buy another piece of land where she will extract more stones for sale. This will increase her income.

In the near future, she plans to buy a lorry which she will use to transport the stones to sell in other markets.

loans.use: To buy another piece of land for her quarry business

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda M. is a 53 year old, married mother of two. She operates a quarry business in the busy Kituoni area in Kilifi. Her business is two years old and has been doing well.

Mwenda is borrowing her first loan from KADET and she plans to expand the quarry and purchase quarry equipment. Most of her customers are local residents who buy stones for construction purposes.

Mwenda hopes that her business will expand further and become a large commercial quarry. She hopes to be able to supply her stones to the big construction businesses in the area.

loans.use: To expand the quarry and purchase quarry equipment

loans.name: Rosibel Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Rosibel del Carmen V. C., tiene la edad de 41 años vive en el Barrio San Ignacio, su esposo labora como CPF, apoyandole económicamente a los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 12 y 9 años de edad, ella se dedica desde hace 31 años a la agricultura.

En los años que han laborado en este rubro, los principales problemas que han enfrentado, ha sido la sequía por la escaces de lluvias y agua en la zona, esto ocaciona una caida en la producción de la cosecha, ellos comenzaron con la siembra de la piña y la pitahaya, gracias a una herencia de su padre y dentro de los planes que tiene para futuro, esta el realizar trabajos de conservación del suelo, ellos solicitan un prestamo para la inversión en sus tierras, en la compra de material vegetativo para nuevos siembros, esto les apoyara para la producción de nuevos siembros que se consumen en masa, apoyandoles económicamente para nuevas inversiones o fuentes de ingresos a futuro.

Ella ha tenido otros prestamos con Afodenic y es una mujer responsable que el apoyo que se le brinde, le servira de provecho y beneficio para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosibel del Carmen V. C. is 41 years old. She lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood. Her husband works as a CPF, supporting her and covering household costs. They have two children who are 12 and 9 years old. She has spent more than 31 years working in agriculture. In all the years she has worked in agriculture, the main problem she has faced has been drought due to the lack of rain and water in the area. Drought has caused a fall in the harvest's production. The couple began with the sowing of the pineapple and the pitahaya (dragon fruit) thanks to her father's inheritance. Included in their plans for the future are conservation projects for their land. They are asking for a loan to invest in their land. They plan to buy vegetative material for new sowing, which will help the couple increase production of plants that are widely consumed. This will provide economic support for new investments or future sources of income. Rosibel has had other loans with Afodenic and is a very responsible woman. The support you can give her benefits and supports her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetative material for sowing

loans.name: Setar-E-Zeba Group

texts.en:
Zeba Gull is the group leader of Setar-e-Zeba Group. She is resident of Kabul, Afghanistan, and runs a bakery in her house. She is a hardworking woman and responsible and is glad that through her business she can support her five children.

Zeba Gull works in her bakery from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and bakes bread for her neighbors that live in the same area as she does.

With the Kiva loan, she wants to purchase flour and firewood for her bakery and would like to expand her business. She hopes to make her business large and to have a shop instead of working in her home.

loans.use: To buy flour and firewood for her bakery

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan T. N., 39, lives in Phu Man village, Cho Town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She is married with three children who go to school. She breeds pigs and also has a small shop at home that serves breakfast. She has done this work for 11 years and has a monthly income of about 3.800.000 VND. She joined SEDA in 2007 and has repaid her loans punctually. She wants to borrow 7.840.000 (or 400 USD) to expand her shop.

loans.use: to expand her shop

loans.name: Everlita

texts.en:
Everlita C. is from the town of Poblacion, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Everlita owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells spices and vegetables. Everlita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Everlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Everlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María Reina

texts.es: María Reina G. D. G. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento D. Morazán. Ella posee un comedor, en el cual se dedica a elaborar diferentes tipos D. comida para desayunos y almuerzos, el comedor está ubicado en el parque central llamado el Overisco. La señora María vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta D. leña, así mismo vive junto a su nuera quien le ayuda en el comedor, y junto a su pequeño nieto quien se dedica a estudiar. María trabaja D. lunes a sábado, elaborando desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales comercializa con habitantes del lugar y con trabajadores que trabajan en los alrededores. Ella es una señora muy conocida en el lugar, ya que elabora alimentos muy deliciosos y así mismo brinda muy buen servicio. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar: arroz, maíz, frijoles, carne, verduras y otras más, las cuales son la materia prima para la elaboración D. los alimentos. Ella cuenta con un gran deseo D. salir adelante y así prosperar aún más en su negocio para poder vivir D. una forma mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
María Reina G. D. G., age 47, lives in San Francisco Goteras in the Morazán department. She has a restaurant, and she makes different typical foods for breakfast and lunch. The restaurant is located in the central park, and it is called The Overisco. María lives with her husband; he sells firewood. She also lives with her daughter-in-law, who helps her in the restaurant, and her small grandson. The grandson goes to school. María works from Monday through Saturday making breakfasts and lunches. She sells them to local people and to workers who work in the surrounding areas. She is a very well-known woman in the area because she makes delicious food and offers very good service. María is requesting a loan to be able to buy rice, corn, beans, meat, vegetables, and other things. These are the ingredients to make the food. She has a great desire to get ahead and to prosper even more in her business. She wants to do this to be able to live a better way with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, basic grains, and other products to make food

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Paraje  Centro 2 Group

texts.es: Doña Rosario S. Pelicó  ella tiene 1 hijo , es una persona  trabajadora, con baja escolaridad y a pesar de su extrema pobreza esta señora ha salido adelante, con sus familia y su esposo  en  La  crianza de animales tales  como ganado porcino, y ganado,    ella es una persona entusiasta a pesar de su  ignorancia estudiantil, es  alguien que le ha sacado provecho a la crianza de animales,   y lograr incrementar su negocio de crianza de animales  y lograr apoyar a su esposo en el gasto de la familia,  su punto de venta  de estos animales, es en el Paraje Pologuá, de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc, municipio de San Momostenango,  Totonicapán . Ella necesita ampliar su capital de trabajo, en la crianza de animales, es el segundo crédito  que solicita en las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de pologuá, para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias,  y apoyar en el crecimiento de la economía del país. Este grupo de señoras residen en el Paraje Centro de la aldea San Antonio Pasajoc Municipio de Momostenango del  departamento de  Totonicapán. Es un grupo integrado por 4 personas.
texts.en:
Rosario S. Pelicó has one child. She is a hard-working person with little education. In spite of her extreme poverty she has gotten ahead, with her family and her husband, in raising animals. She raises animals like pigs and livestock. She is an enthusiastic person in spite of her lack of education. She is a person who has profited from raising animals, and she has increased her business of raising animals. She has helped her husband with the family expenses. She sells these animals in Paraje Pologuá in the San Antonio Pasajoc village, San Momostenango municipality, Totonicapán. She needs to increase her working capital in her business of raising animals. This is the second loan she has requested in the Pologuá offices of the Asociatión ASDIR. The loan is to be able to finance her economic activity. This way she will be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family. This will support the economic growth in her country. This group of women lives in El Paraje Centro in the San Antonio Pasajoc village, San Momostenango municipality, Totonicapán. The group is comprised of four people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
37-year-old Theresa M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Theresa plants and harvests rice for sale. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over 11 years now.

Theresa joined CEVI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from CEVI. Theresa is requesting her ninth loan, for 15000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Latifan's Group

texts.en:
Latifan has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband's grocery shop.

Latifan is a daughter of Ghulam Mohammad. She is 53 years old and the leader of her group. Her credit behavior is very good, and this is her fourth year to be with Asasah.

Latifan has given birth to five children, and all of them are male. Two of her sons are involved in a furniture polisher business. Another son helps his father in the grocery shop. Her other two sons are enrolled in a school to receive an education.

With the loan amount, her husband will buy groceries in bulk.

Note: In the photo, Latifan is showing her domestic sewing business.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Oltetia Stephen

texts.en:
Oltetia Stephen Y. is 32 years old. He married to Peninah Y. and he is a father of one school-going child. Oltetia is a farmer. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his fourth loan. He is planning to spend it to prepare land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to the good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Oltetia’s dream is do large-scale farming and start daily farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals

loans.use: To prepare land for planting potatoes

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, ont en moyenne 3  enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz est la spéculation cultivée par ROKIA C., la présidente du groupe.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et recruter de la main d'œuvre  pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 65 000 FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 5 group are married women, 37 years old on average with 3 children, and live mostly in polygamous households in Sekereni, one of the villages in the town of Loulouni, in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) to manage their agricultural businesses properly during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and the previous loans were repaid properly. Rokia C., the president of the group, grows rice. With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment, and also to recruit manual labour to manage 1 hectare of farmland. The products are sold in the village and at the Loulouni market after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize a profit of 65,000 FCFA at the end of the planting season. Her profit will allow her to repay the loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses. She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make use of the larger social and cultural setting and thus acquire better gains.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for labour costs, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, hoes, and small agricultural equipment

loans.name: Perez

texts.en:
Perez A. J. is a widowed lady with four children between the ages of 21 and 12. 

Her business is located at the Jubilee municipal market in Kisumu. She sells fruits and vegetables to the local people and visitors as well. She has been in this business for ten years now and has one employee. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoiled for choice. She works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Apart from the grocery business Perez gets more income from her rental houses. However, she is using her loan of  60,000 KES to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand her business and satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes to give her children a good education and add to the number of her rental units to increase her income in the future. She describes herself as kind, humble and God-fearing.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Stalamarice

texts.en:
Stalamarice is a single mother of two. She has engaged in a tailoring business for fifteen years and also farms for extra income.

Stalamarice is a member of Maarifa group in Faulu Kenya. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through the group to buy fabric. She hopes to build a homestead for herself in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo en el barrio Villa Bonita de la ciudad de Villa  Elisa , el comité cuenta actualmente con 15 integrantes todas vecinas del barrio. 
Hablaremos de Juana M. ,  quien es la Directora del Comité, ella  es casada, vive en su propia casa , con su marido.  S e dedica a la venta de Ropas ,   para mujeres, hombres y niños.
Juana , es muy trabajadora y hogareña . 
Su negocio lo tiene en su casa en un pequeño salón donde expone sus mercaderias para los clientes.
Ella desea ampliar su negocio comprando más variedades de ropas ya que se acerca esta entrando la primaV. y el resto del crédito lo utilizará para terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The committee was formed in the neighborhood of Villa Bonita in the city of Villa Elisa. The committee currently consists of 15 members, all residents of the neighborhood. We'll focus on Juana M., who is the director of the committee. She's married and lives in her own home with her husband. She sells clothing for women, men, and children. Juana is very hardworking and she loves her home. She runs her business out of her house from a small sitting room where she displays her merchandise for her clients. She wants to expand her business by buying more varieties of clothing because spring is around the corner and she will use the rest of the loan to finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell and construction materials

loans.name: Lidy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidy;   ella tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos, La socia desde hace 8 meses es empleada en una cuna guardería, ella trabaja como asistente en la cuna ayudando a las profesoras a cuidar a los niños, les cambia los pañales, les da su refrigerio y comiditas, y les hace jugar hasta que sus madres recojan a los bebes. La socia dice que es bueno estar cerca a los niños y que le apena mucho que muchas madres deban dejar a sus hijos para ir a trabajar tan pequeños y que ella puede estar trabajando con sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser ella dejará el trabajo en la guardería infantil para hacer en su casa costura.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Women United Communal Bank.  The Bank is situated in the San Sebastián District, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.  Her name is Lidy.  She is 31 years old with two children, and she lives with her partner.  She has been employed for eight months as an assistant in a nursery.  She helps the teachers take care of the children, changing their diapers, giving them their snacks and little meals, and getting them to play until their mothers pick them up.  She says it is good to be with the children and that it makes her sad that many mothers have to leave their young children to go to work.  Lidy is able to be with her children while she works.  

Lidy is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine.  She plans to leave her job in the nursery to work as a seamstress in her home.  She is thankful and appreciates being able to obtain a loan through this process; she promises to comply with the terms of repayment.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Reida

texts.en: Reida M. is currently in the business of selling bags of maize and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize to sell.  She is 29 years old and is Married to a peasant. She has three children and two of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: María Zoila

texts.es:
María Zoila tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos dependientes, reside junto a sus padres en el caserío Sasape Viejo del distrito de Túcume, una zona agrícola y turística que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a brindar servicio de peluquería en un local alquilado situado en el pueblo principal de Túcume. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes servicio de corte de cabello, ondulaciones, tintes de cabello entre otros. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro y a la calidad de sus trabajos.

Ella desea adquirir algunas herramientas e insumos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de atención y mejorar su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer bastante empeñosa y entregada a su trabajo, los ingresos que percibe de su actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personas y ayudar a la economía de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante para poder ayudar a sus padres a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Zoila is 32 years old.  She is single and doesn't have any dependent children.  She lives with her parents in the village of Sasape Viejo in the district of Túcume, a farming and tourist region which is in the province of Lambayeque, approximately one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been running a hairdressing salon for ten years in rented premises located in the main town of Túcume.  There she offers her customers hair-cutting services, perms, hair coloring, etc.  Her business has a lot of customers owing to the amount of time she has been in the trade and the quality of her work.

She would like to acquire some equipment and supplies which will enable her to improve the quality of her customer service and improve her business.  This is why she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 nuevos soles.

María is quite a determined woman who is committed to her work.  The income which she earns from her business is used to cover her personal expenses and help with her family's finances.  Her greatest wish is to get ahead in order to help her parents and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for making improvements to her hair-dressing salon

loans.name: Trishna

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Trishna B..  She is married and has one child, aged 9.  In 2004, she established  her tailoring shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase raw materials for her tailoring work.  In the future, Trishna plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.  Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buys materials for tailoring business

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long S., 29, is married and resides with his wife and a child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. S. and his wife grow morning glories, earning an income of about USD 7 each per day. S. has to spend USD 57 on food, USD 15 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use and more morning glory seeds. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and morning glory seeds

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Emeteria

texts.en:
Emeteria A. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Emeteria is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Emeteria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Emeteria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Emeteria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emeteria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emeteria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Emeteria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Teresa M. es socia del banco comunal 12 de Abril, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, cuenta con su centro histórico el mismo que en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrado patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.

La Señora Teresa tiene 47 años, está separada hace 4 años y tiene 5 hijos de 28, 27, 25, 23, 20 años de edad, todos sus hijos son solteros, cuatro de ellos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar solo su segunda hija vive independiente. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Teresa se dedica a la venta de frutas, esta labor la realiza hace 14 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad en donde labora desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde  de domingo a domingo.
 
Se encuentra dos años en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas. Su meta es  crecer mas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa M. is a member of the “12 de Abril” (12th of April) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful natural surroundings.  It has an historical center, which was named to be the “Cultural Heritage of Humanity” in December of 1999.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Teresa is 47 years old, has been separated for four years, and has five children, ages 28, 27, 25, 23, and 20.  All of her children are single.  Four of them work and help with the household finances.  Only her second oldest daughter lives on her own.  They live in a rented home.

Teresa has been selling fruit for 14 years.  She has her own stall in one of the city markets, where she works from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, seven days a week.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for two years and she enjoys it because she has good friends there.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in more fruit.  Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expand his business

loans.name: Amralt

texts.en:
Amralt, 36 years old, lives with her daughter and husband in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her family live in their own house and enclosure.

Amralt operates a water trolley sales business. She began her business in 1998, selling the trolleys in the Narantuul market. Her husband helps her with the business and in taking care of their 1-year-old daughter at home. Her husband makes the water trolleys himself with iron. Amralt is a hardworking and friendly woman who says, " I'm very satisfied in my business." She is requesting 2,300,000 MNT to buy iron and rubber to make the water trolleys to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy iron and rubber to produce trolleys

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma B. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Alma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling homemade honey in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Alma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale like sugar & pure honey. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients needed to make honey and other products

loans.name: Abel  Mwamuye

texts.en:
Abel Mwamuye M. is a 34-year-old man. He is married to Bendera and they have been blessed with five children.

Abel has been working in the quarry for the past year. This is his first loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to lease a plot of land to do quarry work so that he can meet the demand of his customers.  

The anticipated profits will be directed into the construction of a permanent house for his family. He hopes to buy a stone cutter to finish the project, as this will ease his work.

loans.use: To lease land to quarry

loans.name: Wilson Kipngetich

texts.en:
T. Wilson is 36 years old and married to Domtila T., who is a farmer. They have two school-going children, ages 12 and 6. He owns a butchery in Chemundu Trading Centre in Kapsabet Town. He has been in this business for a period of four years, and his monthly profit is 6,000 KES. 

He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully paying the previous loans well and in good time. He intends to use the entire loan amount to buy sheep and goats for slaughter to sell to his customers; the anticipated profits will be used to improve the business and also his family's welfare. 

His dream is to own several butcheries and become a famous supplier of mutton in the town.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for slaughter

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 34 years old and lives in the Calavi district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's economic centre. Together with her husband Denis, she looks after their three children, all of whom are schooled.

For the past 10 years, Augustine has made and sold clothing for distribution across her neighbourhood. This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments. It will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. She hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two young children. He is the manager of a small grocery store. After seeing the necessity for a higher income source, he decided to diversify his business by adding a small area in his shop where he produces fast food such as burgers, beef sandwiches etc. Despite his older age, this man contributes with all his efforts to be able to satisfy his family needs.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new baking tools, equipment and a barbecue in order to increase his business productivity. He looks forward to generating better profits and being able to expand his business even further.

loans.use: to purchase new baking tools, equipment, and a barbecue.

loans.name: Luzvimin

texts.en:
Luzvimin D. is from the village of Tumuran, Kadingilan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Luzvimin is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzvimin owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling junk foods, canned goods, beverages, candies, & biscuits in the local community. Luzvimin has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzvimin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luzvimin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Luzvimin is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Luzvimin from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 29 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Félix de 30 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Ariel de 09 años y Magdiel de 03 años de edad, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los verdes campos del centro poblado de Harwimayo, ubicado en la selva tropical Ayacuchana, han sido en la vida de Gloria un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran café, cacao y palillo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido de mucho provecho. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad de San Francisco. Gloria solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es extender la siembra de cacao, por ser una de sus plantas que mayor  precio tiene en el mercado. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Gloria is 29 years old.  She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 30 year-old Félix, and her two beloved children, 9 year-old Ariel and 3 year-old Magdiel, who are the motivation behind all her efforts.  The green fields of Harwimayo, in the tropical rainforest of Ayacuchana, have been a pleasant place for Gloria to work.  Her parents taught her this work when she was very young and now she owns her own farmland where she works together with her partner.  With a lot of care, they grow coffee, cacao and palillo (a type of guava).

What Gloria most enjoys about her work is harvesting her land since that is when she feels that her hard work has been worthwhile.  She has been in this business for ten years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops to the warehouses in the town of San Francisco.  Gloria is requesting this loan so that she can carry out one of her plans which is to extend her cacao plantings.  This is one of her plants which fetches the highest price in the market.  Over time, she hopes to be able to gather together enough money to buy more land.

This is Gloria's first loan from MFP.  It is her duty to make her repayments punctually and she is prepared to do this if she would like to access further loans.  She is grateful to the institution for granting her this loan.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy cacao seeds and, thereby, increase her production.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds

loans.name: William

texts.es: El señor William tiene una microempresa de comercialización de repuestos para abanicos, licuadoras, ollas a presión y artículos de segunda, también presta el servicio de reparación de  electrodomésticos menores. Él  inicio como ayudante de su cuñado que tenía ese tipo de negocio y desde allí aprendió el oficio,  para luego  independizarse y tener su propio taller en un lugar poco comercial del municipio de Galapa; desde  hace dos años logró negociar con su cuñado en un punto comercial    donde le ha ido muy bien, su clientela ha crecido y tiene una gran variedad de repuestos. Con sus ventas puede cubrir sus gastos operativos y familiares y en algunas ocasiones necesita la colaboración de un ayudante,  al que le paga por días, esto ocurre  cuando hay mucha demanda de sus servicios; en su taller William  cuenta con las herramientas necesarias para trabajar, tiene un inventario variado y de buena calidad;  William es un hombre separado y tiene a su cargo a su madre y al hijo menor y sueña con tener un local propio para sacar a sus dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 16 adelante, ofreciéndole una educación de calidad.  Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él planea abrir otras líneas como son los productos de refrigeración, electricidad y electrónica que tienen una gran demanda en el municipio donde tiene su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. William has a micro business selling part for fans, blenders, pressure cookers and used items.  He also repairs small home appliances.  He started out as an assistant to a brother-in-law who had this type of business and that’s where he learned this occupation to later become independent and have his own workshop in a spot in the town of Galapa that isn’t very commercial.  

Two years ago he was able to negotiate with his brother-in-law for a more commercial location where he has done very well.  His clientele has grown and he has a large variety of spare parts.  His sales make it possible for him to cover operational and family expenses and sometimes even needs to hire an assistant to help out who he pays a daily wage.  This occurs when demand for service is high.  William has the tools necessary to work in his shop; he has a varied, good quality inventory. 

William is separated and has his mother and youngest son in his care.  He dreams with having a locale of his own to provide a good education for his two children, who are 11 and 6 years old, so that they can get ahead in life.

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He plans to use it to add other lines of products like, refrigeration, electricity and electronics which are in high demand in the town where his business is located.

loans.use: to buy refrigeration, electric and electronic products.

loans.name: Monserrate Amalia

texts.es:
En la localidad conocida con el nombre de Pachinche  de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Monserrate, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 15 y de 12 años los mismos que estudian la mayor en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar y de uso personal como: planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, zapatos, perfumes, etc. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella ofrece sus productos a sus clientes, realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, nos cuenta que lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y que le dedica dos días a la semana.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, zapatos, planchas, tostadoras, licuadoras, etc. Está en el banco comunal hace cinco ciclos y le gusta por la responsabilidad de sus compañeras y de la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un restaurante ya que le encanta la cocina.
texts.en:
The members of the “Damas Emprendedoras De Pachinche” (Enterprising Ladies of Pachinche) Communal Bank meet every two weeks at the place known as Pachinche, which is in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is known for its hard-working people who are devoted to agriculture and to raising livestock.

This is where we met Monserrate, age 39.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children.  The oldest is 15 and is in high school.  The youngest, age 12, is in elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

She is a very good mother and housewife.  In order to get her own income and to help her husband with the household expenses, she has a business.  She sells household items and personal use items like irons, blenders, fans, shoes, and perfume, etc.  She sells door to door.  She offers her products to her customers, takes their orders, and delivers the products.  She takes the orders on credit, and she collects each week.  She tells us that she has been doing this two days a week for five years.

This loan is to buy perfume, shoes, irons, toasters, and blenders, etc.  She has been in the communal bank for five cycles, and she likes it because of the responsibility of her colleagues and the institution. 

Her dream is to have a restaurant because she loves to cook.

loans.use: to buy perfume, shoes, irons, toasters, and blenders, etc.

loans.name: Manday Group

texts.en:
Merlinda is married, with children. She is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. Merlinda is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 18 years. She has requested a loan to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer. 

Merlinda has been a member of PMPC for three years. She is the leader of this three-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rechie

texts.en:
Rechie is 30 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and a father of one school-age child.

Rechie owns and operates a motorcycle transport service to earn a living. He is a motorcycle taxi driver who carries and transports passengers. He has been in this service for four years. Each month, he earns a total average of PHP 2,500 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to pay labor costs for motorcycle repair and to purchase spare parts and tires.

Rechie has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Rechie hopes to purchase another motorcycle taxi and gain more profit.

loans.use: To pay labor costs to repair his motorcycle and to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine, age 29, is married to Cosmus and blessed with one child who is three years old. She operates a cereals shop but also has a boutique alongside. She has been doing these businesses for four years and earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan funds to buy more cereals and more clothes for her boutique. Valentine hopes to educate her child and buy a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.en:
Nazgul, 39, is a resident of Tup, a small, nice village in the west of Kyrgyzstan. She is married to a cab driver and has six children. For the past ten years, Nazgul has been busy with a dairy business. Every morning she receives 15 liters of milk and distributes it to her regular customers. She also cultivates land and resells cattle. Nazgul’s business was started with an initial capital of 15,000 KGS and she earns a monthly income of 5,000 KGS. She has used her savings to purchase farming equipment and an automobile, and to repair her house.

Nazgul is requesting a loan to purchase three cattle to fatten and resell. 


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For 15 years, she and her husband have operated a food stall to sell meals for people in their community.

Thanh would like a loan to purchase new furniture, good quality food and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family through the loan.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, food and rice in bulk for her food stall.

loans.name: Juan Fidel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Fidel es casado, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 3 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la albañilería y a la sastrería, inició este negocio de sastrería gracias al apoyo de un familiar, tiene 6 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital y comprar materia primas par aumentar su producción, ya que en el futuro quiere tener un negocio mayor y con mejor capital.
texts.en:
Juan Fidal is married, 41 years old and has a primary school education. He has four children, three of whom are in school. He works as a mason and a tailor. He began working as a tailor thanks to the support of his family. He has six years of experience.
He is asking for this loan in order to increase his working capital and buy the basic materials needed to increase his production. In the future he would like a larger business with more income.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es: Milena tiene 30 años, es natural de Cullpa Alta y en la actualidad radica con sus padres en casa de ellos. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas del campo, sus padres le enseñaron esta actividad, convirtiendose con el tiempo en su principal fuente de ingresos, permitiéndole solventar los gastos familiares. Es así que cultiva papa y alverja, productos de temporada. Por otro lado se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos, la cantidad depende de los pedidos que le hagan sus clientes. Es la primera vez que esta trabajando con MFP, su  madre le recomendó trabajar de esta manera para poder crecer en su trabajo. Con el dinero comprará sacos de abono para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
30-year old Milena is a native of Cullpa Alta and lives with her parents. Throughout her life she has worked on the land alongside her parents who passed on their knowledge. In time this became her principal source of income allowing her to pay the family bills. She grows potatoes and peas depending on the season.

Milena is also a weaver. The amount of weaving she does depends on orders from her customers. 

This is Milena's first loan with MFP. Her mother suggested that she take out a loan so that she could expand the business. With the money she plans to buy bags of fertilizer for the next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is a hard-working, honest and kind person. He is 36 years old and a married man who has three children. All his children are still studying. 

Nestor is involved in providing passenger transportation in the local town. He has been in this kind of business for 10 years and he ensures that his passengers are comfortable while traveling. Nestor does his routine daily due to his student passengers. In his daily routine going to and from the market and school, he is able to earn about 2,000 Philippines pesos (P). According to him, he wants to give his children good living conditions.

To make his dream come true, he is requesting a loan amount of P7,000 to be used in buying wheels, a chain and gasoline for his motorcycle. Aside from the transportation business, he is also engaged in hog raising, from which he sometimes gets income for their daily needs and the school fees of children. 

He is hoping that he could obtain this loan amount to be able to increase the profit he could generate and maintain the businesses he manages.

loans.use: to buy wheels, a chain and gasoline for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is 48 years old and is engaged in a hog fattening business as a primary source of income. He was blessed with seven children and has to provide for their needs, especially for their education. But due to the difficulty of life, his eldest already married to lessen the burden on their father by decreasing the family needs. One of his children also stopped studying and choose to help him in the business.


Edison is earning P3,000 each disposing time, but it is very minimal to provide for their needs. With the aspiration to increase his sales, he is asking for a loan in the amount of P15,000 to buy vitamins for his current hogs and to purchase two more hogs as additional sources of sales. He hopes through his hard work and this loan amount, he will provide better living condition and will not have to experience forever the pain of poverty.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for his current hogs and to purchase two more hogs as additional sources of sales

loans.name: Mabinty's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the priM. schools in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These dedicated staff members have formed themselves into a group of four out of a total of fourteen teachers in the school, in order to seek a loan of 4,000,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders.  

With the help of this loan, they can solve immediate financial needs that their mere salaries alone cannot enable them to do.  At the end of each month, they will use their monthly salaries to repay the loan.  Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Mabinty is the leader of this group of teachers. Mabinty is 53 years old and a native of Mabonto village in northern Sierra Leone. Mabinty is married and has four children. She has served in the teaching profession for 33 years. She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Maléki

texts.fr:
Maléki est un homme âgé de 24 ans. Il est marié å une  couturière et ont  ensemble un enfant.  
Maléki travaille comme revendeur de cartes de recharges  depuis 04ans. 
Il est distributeur de cartes dans les environs de la ville de Lomé. Ses marchandises sont achetées chez les grossistes. 
Maléki a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’augmenter son activité par l’achat des cartes de recharge.
texts.en:
Maléki is a twenty-four year old man. He is married to a seamstress and they have a child together. 
Maléki has worked as a reseller of mobile phone recharge cards for four years.
He is a card distributor in the surroundings of the city of Lomé. His merchandise is purchased from a wholesaler. 
Maléki has received his fourth loan from WAGES in order to increase his business through the purchase of recharge cards.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children.
 
Milagros has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Milagros has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Key

texts.en: Key, 29, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Key and her husband buy cows and pigs to resell. Key is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more cows to resell, which will generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more cows to resell.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas de 48 años de edad, convive con Dionicia hace 12 años. Ambos tienen un hijo de 9 años y viven en una casa propia en el distrito de Palcamayo.
Blas es un hombre trabajador. Se dedica al servicio de transporte gracias a ala movilidad con la que cuenta, recorriendo la ruta de Palcamayo – Tarma, “el pasaje por persona es de 3.50 soles y por viaje llevo 4 personas y en trayecto suben más personas, y gano por viaje 30 soles, es un trabajo muy rentable”, menciona.
Pero la actividad que lo apasiona es la agricultura. Ha sabido distribuir sus terrenos de cultivo para producir papas, ollucos, cebada y avena. Los que vende satisfactoriamente en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma.  Gracias a la variedad de sus cosechas pudo contactar con compradores de la ciudad de Lima, lugar donde viaja con frecuencia para comercializar 20 sacos de ollucos por viaje. “En Lima es rentable vender el olluco, por eso invierto más”, aclara.
Con el tiempo piensa ampliar sus sembríos de olluco y papas, ya que sabe como negociarlos, por esa razón también se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras y tubérculos. Sería su préstamo número 15 el que obtendría de MFP, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. En cuanto a su banco comunal, reconoce que el trabajo en equipo es el más importante para crecer como comunidad o grupo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus tierras, así también semillas de papas y ollucos.
texts.en:
Blas, who is 48 years old, has lived with Dionica for 12 years. Together they have a son who is 9 years old, and they live in their own house in the district of Palcamayo. Blas is a hard-working man. He offers transportation services thanks to his vehicle, traveling on the Palcamayo-Tarma route. "The fare per person is 3.50 PEN, and I carry four people. Along the way, more people get on, and I earn 30 PEN per trip. It is very profitable work," he mentions.

But the activity that fills him with enthusiasm is agriculture. He has learned to apportion his cultivated land to produce potatoes, olluco (a root vegetable), barley, and oats, which he sells satisfactorily in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Thanks to the variety of his crops, he was able to contact buyers from the city of Lima, where he travels frequently to sell 20 sacks of olluco per trip. "In Lima it is profitable to sell olluco. For that reason I invest more," he clarifies.

With time he is thinking of expanding his plantings of olluco and potatoes, since he knows how to sell them. For this reason he also buys and sells vegetables and root crops. This will be the 15th loan that he will obtain from MFP.  Because of that, he promises to be punctual in his monthly payments. With regard to his community bank, he recognizes that working as a team is the most important thing to grow as a community or group. He will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizer to fertilize his lands, as well as seeds for potatoes and olluco.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer and seeds for potatoes and olluco.

loans.name: Jessebel

texts.en:
Jessebel is 35 years old.  She is married and has one child.

Jessebel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jessebel has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr. Edgar tiene 49 años, está casado con la  Sra. Eduarda de 59 años. Tienen 2 hijas de 23 y 17 años respectivamente.
El Sr. Edgar trabaja medio tiempo en una Asociación de Empleados y además tiene una pequeña librería y fotocopiadora que atiende desde el mediodía hasta la noche, en el mismo vende artículos de librería, realiza trabajos por computadora y fotocopias. También posee helados de diferentes sabores para la venta  en vasitos, cucuruchos y en potes de  distintas  medidas. El se define como un hombre dinámico que realiza todo tipo de cosas para poder ayudar a su familia.
El Sr. Edgar desea invertir el crédito en la compra de cuadernos, hojas de diferentes tamaños, carpetas archivadoras, cartulinas y otros artículos para poder abastecer su librería. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Señor Edgar is 49 years old and he is married to Señora Eduarda who is 59 years old. They have 2 children aged 23 and 17 respectively.

Señor Edgar works part-time in an Employee Association and he also has a small book and photocopying store, where he works from midday until nighttime. Here, he sells bookstore goods and carries out computer and photocopying jobs. He also sells different flavor ice-creams in cups, cones and different sized pots. He describes himself as a dynamic man who does all sorts of things to help his family.

Señor Edgar wants to invest the loan in the purchase of notebooks, different sized sheets of paper, archive folders, cards and other items to supply his store. He is grateful to the foundation and to kiva for the opportunity given to him.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, different sized sheets of paper, archive folders, cards and other items

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is a young, entrepreneurial woman. She is 21, married, and a young mother of one son. She finished secondary school, but could not continue her studies. Two years ago, in order to support her family, Bahar and her husband decided to begin their own business activities in cattle breeding. Today they have two milch cows, whose milk Bahar's husband sells in the local bazaar, earning about 150 AZN a month. 

Bahar also has a plot of land where she grows potatoes and perennial herbs, which serve as a concentration of forage for her cattle and ensures a high quality of milk yield. She wants to use this loan of 1500 AZN to buy more milch cows in order to increase her sales of milk. Bahar’s young family is learning to overcome difficulties and resolve problems and she is full of energy for the many achievements on her way.

loans.use: to buy more milch cows.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne is a 32-year-old married mother of two children living in Hoima, Uganda. She is hardworking and for the past two years, she has been running a restaurant which has been steadily improving. She faces a challenge of price fluctuation of food items. Her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand her business into new markets. Evelyne needs the loan facility to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
La señora Aura Lila, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, dedica al comercio desde hace 35 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de ropa en un mercado de la ciudad de León, además desea incrementar su inventario de trabajo con la venta de telas, ella realiza esta labor para  solventar los gastos del hogar y así tener un mejor nivel junto.     

Doña Aura, solicito  a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo en la compra de tela para la elaboración de uniformes escolares, lo que le permitirá incrementar su inventario de trabajo al igual su capital de trabajo mejorando su nivel y calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de tela para la elaboración de uniformes escolares

loans.name: Tafa

texts.en: Tafa is married with 10 children. The youngest is 2 years old. This is her fourth loan with SPBD. She has already paid off three since 2004 which she used to develop a flower busines and a canteen business. Her customers for flowers include churches - it is a tradition to decorate churches each Sunday - and people who come to her house. She also runs a canteen 6 days a week from a taxi stand in Apia. Usually her sales from the canteen are about $50 per day. The school fees will be used for her second eldest son who is studying computers.

loans.use: School Fees, bathroom renovation, fertiliser

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida T. is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and manages her business with proper  record keeping. She has been trained in the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $650 to inject into her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs Thuy is 44 years old. She has a son who is going to school in grade 4. Mrs They is supporting her child by herself. She doesn’t have any land. A first loan helped Mrs Thuy selling rice at the small local market. So Thuy’s selling cakes is important for increasing her income, which averages $10.5/person/month. She wants to borrow $75 for her selling business.

loans.use: sells pyramidal rice dumpling

loans.name: Irma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Irma is a single mother and has two daughters, who are fourteen and sixteen years old. They are the reason she began her own business eight years ago by offering her services as a stylist. Since she lived in a town where there had not been stylists previously, she soon had a lot of clients. This is how Irma has been able to obtain the necessary resources to provide for her family and educate her daughters.

Now Irma needs a loan of $750 dollars that she will use to purchase products for her business and also remodel the site for her beauty salon. With this assistance, she hopes to improve the quality of her service and continue growing as she has up to this point. She promises to repay the loan in six months. You can be an important part of the growth of this business and improve the lives of Irma and her family. Decide for yourself to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Irma es soltera y tiene dos hijas, de 14 y 16 años de edad, ellas han sido el motivo por el cual hace ocho años inició su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista, por ser una colonia nueva donde viven no había estéticas y pronto comenzó a tener muchos clientes. De esta manera es como Irma ha obtenido los recursos necesarios para el sostén y educación de sus hijas.

Ahora Irma necesita un crédito por $ 750 dólares que destinará a la compra de los productos que utiliza en su negocio, así como en la remodelación de su local, con esto espera ofrecer un servicio de mejor calidad y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, ella promete devolver este préstamo en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejora la vida de Irma y su familia, decídete a apoyarlas.

loans.use: Remodelling and purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Tuisugaigoa

texts.en: Tuisugaigoa I. is a hard working woman of thirty-one years of age and is married with three children.  Her business is a Flea Market, where she sells different kinds of products such as handicrafts, elei materials, puletasi, and also foods. Together with the assistance she gets from her husband and children, she is able to run her business. She will use her loan to produce more products for her customers.  Tuisugaigoa appreciates the help of the S.P.B.D programme for lending her the money to help her with financing her business' needs. She earns an income of one hundred and fifty tala a day from her selling.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and to restock

loans.name: Mirza

texts.es:
Mirza was born to be become a great stylist. For this reason Mirza studied cosmetology in the afternoons while she was still in grade school. Now she is the mother of five children, three of which still live with her in their small dwelling and attend high school. The other two children live and work independently thanks to the profession that Mirza instilled in them. Mirza lives with her husband who does carpentry and metal work in the small workshop in the patio of their home.

Long ago Mirza began with a small mirror and a pair of scissors. First she cut the hair of grade school students in the living room of her modest home. Obtaining good results she has entered the market even without using the tools, accessories or beauty products used for certain jobs/styles. Now, thanks to the good response she has had, she hopes to continue growing her salon. It is for this reason that she urgently needs a loan to buy more tools of the trade. She agrees to pay the loan back in six months. With the help of the loan she will be able to fulfill the needs of here exclusive customer base and to continue the development of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Mirza estudió cosmetología, cuando aún estaba en el colegio, por las tardes debido a que le nacía la vocación de convertirse en una gran estilista, es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales tres viven con ella en su pequeña morada y estudian en el colegio secundario; los otros dos hijos trabajan y son independientes gracias a la profesión que ella supo inculcarles; vive con su esposo quién se dedica a las labores de carpintería y metálica en un pequeño taller acondicionado en el patio de su casa.Hace mucho tiempo Mirza empezó modestamente con un espejo mediano y un par de tijeras; cortando primero a los chicos en edad escolar en la sala de su modesta casa obteniendo buenos resultados, su incursión se inició de este modo ya que no contaba con las herramientas, accesorios y productos de belleza para la realización de otros trabajos. Ahora espera seguir creciendo en su salón de belleza gracias a la buena aceptación que tiene. Es por eso que necesita de manera muy urgente un préstamo para comprar los implementos de su negocio con un compromiso de cancelación de seis meses.Con esta ayuda podrá cumplir con su selecto público y consolidar el desarrollo de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of salon accessories and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Fatali

texts.en: Fatali F. is a 36-year-old trader who sells food products in Saatli. He has 3 years of experience in trading. He is married and has two children. As he is IDP and his family lives in very hard financial conditions, he would like to increase his income. He is asking for a loan of $1000 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business selling food products

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.en:
Rahbar R. is 38 years old, and she and her husband, a taxi driver, have two children.

Rahbar sells children's clothing in the local market. She has been in this business for 4 years. Rahbar's husband is the main bread-winner in the family, however, Rahbar's business also generates a considerable income, which allows the family to improve its living conditions.

Rahbar has been a client of IMON since August 2007, and she has proved to be a reliable and honest client with a positive credit history. She is now requesting a loan of 600.00 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. She is planning to purchase a greater range of goods sale. Rahbar thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase a greater range of children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is 40 years of age and has three sons. She has a small grocery store business that is located out of the home that her husband build to shelter the family. She has also set up a telephone-calling center and has observed her business grow and her popularity increase in a short amount of time. For that reason she wants to take care of her business and to help it grow. She has decided to request a loan to stock it with a greater variety and quantity of items, so that the member’s of the community can be content.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Yolanda tiene 40 años y tiene tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde que se instaló en la vivienda que construyó su esposo para albergar a su nueva familia, además ha instalado en este espacio cabinas para realizar llamadas telefónicas y ha observado su crecimiento y acogida en poco tiempo, por esa razón no desea descuidar su pequeña bodeguita y ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para reflotarla y ofertar mayor cantidad de artículos para alegría de los miembros de su comunidad.

loans.use: Capital to restock her little grocery store.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mrs. Prak S. is 49 years old and has six children. She makes a living by running a stand near her home from which she sells a Cambodian delicacy that is made of papaya mixed with fermented fish, chili and small shrimp. Her husband works at a construction site and earns about $3 per day. Mrs. Prak S. has applied for a loan to purchase some utensils and more equipment for her stand so that she can raise her income and meet her clients' demand. She will also use the loan to buy a motor-bike that her husband will use to commute to work. This will make their lives easier, and help them raise their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy utensils and equipment for her stand

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Her desire to help support her 4 children become successful professionals has pushed Mrs. Marta and her husband to put all their effort in their daily jobs. She worked selling food on the street in the main square in her hometown of Santa Lucia for several years. After she saved some money she opened her own grocery store, and with these two jobs and her husband’s income (he works as a driver) they have been able not only to cover their daily expenses, but also to send their kids to study in a prestigious university in the area of Puno. Marta wishes to increase her stock and the variety of products in her store, which is widely accepted by numerous people.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

El afán de colaborar para que se conviertan en profesionales de éxito sus 4 queridos hijos es el motivo suficiente de doña Marta y su esposo para esforzarse y canalizar lo mejor de sí en sus respectivas actividades. Esta diligente madre, durante muchos años estuvo dedicada a la venta de comida en forma ambulatoria en la plaza de armas de su pueblito natal Santa Lucia, luego de ahorrar pudo abrir e implementar su tiendita de abarrotes, con estas 2 actividades y con el trabajo de su esposo como chofer están logrando cubrir los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo la educación de sus hijos, quienes muy orgullosamente estudian en una prestigiosa Universidad del departamento de Puno.El deseo de Marta es aumentar el stock y variedad de su mercadería, debido a que goza de la aceptación de muchas personas.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can offer more products in her store.

loans.name: Sambath Tep Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambath T. is the village bank president in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. This village bank consists of twenty-six members.
