Mrs. Sambath T. owns a small restaurant where she sells rice and rice soup as a breakfast food. Mrs. Sambath T. obtained a loan from Amret Co.,Ltd to open her restaurant. Now, her business activity has improved, and Mrs. Sambath T. needs to expand her business, but she doesn't have enough money to buy more ingredients to cook a delicious breakfast for her customers. Thus, Mrs. Sambath T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

She is 49 years old and the mother of foU. children, one of whom is a tailor, and another is a construction worker. The remaining two are enrolled in school. Her husband, Mr. Chantha Saom, is a construction worker.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to cook a delicious breakfast for her customers.

loans.name: Kaing

texts.en: Mrs. Kaing M. lives in Thnol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokha Keov, are subsistence farmers.  They have three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is working as a construction worker. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Although there are four people working in this family, there is still an insufficient amount of money to purchase equipment to repair the family home. Thus, Mrs. Kaing M. has decided to request a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Kaing M. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy equipment to repair the family home.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Mrs. Ang H., 49, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are married and two of them live outside the family home. Her daughter lives with her and is assisting her in her business. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about eighteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh.
 
Mrs. Ang has been selling "Unsorm Chrouk", a kind of Khmer cake that is made from sticky rice, beans, coconut, and pork. They take all ingredients to pack in a banana leaf and steam it in boiling water. Unsorm Chrouk is a very popular cake in Khmer culture. Khmer people eat this cake at every ceremony or special event such as a wedding ceremony. Ang and her daughter produce Unsorm Chrouk at their home and take it to sell at Prek Anchan Market.

Now Ang is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase materials to roof her house.

loans.use: To purchase materials to roof her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in fresh vegetables and meat to produce fried food for her customers.

loans.name: Solema

texts.en: Solema E., 32, is married with 3 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has had  previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Solema's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa is 45 years old, married, and has 9 children: ages 6, 8, 15, 17, 18, 20, 22, 24, and 25. She has owned a small business in Zanzibar for ten years. She works daily from 8:00am to 9:00pm and is able to earn a profit of approximately $45 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory to increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to expand her business.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a wife of A. A. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past three years. She completed her education until 5th standard. She couldn’t study more due to the poor conditions of her house. She got married in the age of 18. Her husband works in a factory and earns $4.00 to $5.00 per month. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her daughter is one and her son is three.

Rukhsna baji makes decorative embroidered clothes. She takes orders from big shops and charges $2.00 to $3.00 per embroidered dress. Her father-in-law also lives with her and has a business selling wood. Rukhsana baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wood for her father-in-law’s business.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell.

loans.name: Florence Babirye’S Group

texts.en:
Florence is a leader of a group of 5 members. She is a 43 year old widow with three children aged between 13 and 23. Two of her children go to school, and Florence also takes care of her old father. She resides in and rents a one room house where she stays with four people. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Florence works in a semi-rban area which is o the outskirts of Kampala. She doesn’t incur any transportation costs since she buys from trucks which get the products from the villages. Florence runs a stall in Kamwokya Market, where she sells to an average of 50 customers a day and works seven days a week. Florence sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. Florence has been in this business for over ten years. She has been with MCDT for ten years, and has worked with the same group mates all the time, and is now servicing her twentieth loan.

Florence wants to use this loan to expand her business. She hopes to buy food directly from the farmers in the villages.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
S., 36, makes baskets to sell from her house. She is married to Phdeak and has five children. They live in Siem Reap Province. Her husband is a construction worker who earns around US$ 2.50 per day. S. and her husband work hard every day to generate revenue to support the family's living expenses. And her two daughters help to earn income by working as construction workers.

To reduce costs for transportation, S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use in their family for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Aun O. is a farmer in Thlos village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Yoeun Hun, is a laborer who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Srey Aun O. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase the family income. She is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is ten months old. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding, to increase the household income.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta E. is twenty-eight years old. She is single and lives at Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana. She has one child whom she is taking care of in school. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood and also sells cosmetics. Henrietta E. is very skillful and a talented hairdresser. Through the innovative touches she adds to her customers' hair, she has attracted lots of clients who come to do their hair. Henrietta has been in this business for the past five years, so she has much experience in customer care. She also has two apprentices who are learning skills for their future businesses.

Henrietta believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products such as weave-ins, pomade, shampoo, activators etc. to serve her customers. Henrietta belongs to a village bank called ‘Joy’. She hopes to receive GHS 800 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weave-ins, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Para Erika, en sus 34 años no ha resultado fácil salir adelante, pero con mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir la casa donde vive con sus dos hijos. Con la responsabilidad de velar por la integridad de sus hijos, sale a vender en las calles de su localidad, grandes cantidades de ropa que compra en el mercado central de su ciudad para luego vender en los distritos donde el costo de venta es mayor, y gracias a la gran demanda de las personas, sobretodo de las señoritas, quienes son las que desean vestir a la moda, Erika obtienen grandes ingresos, aunque estar todo el día expuesta al sol o al frío la agota. Por ello está iniciando una nueva forma de vender, que consiste en distribuir las prendas de vestir en algunas tiendas o clientes para luego salir a cobrar todos los días, actividad que realiza junto a su hija, quien la apoya todas las tardes cobrando. Sin embargo, ambas tienen la meta de poner un stand de ropa para dejar de caminar y tener un lugar estable. Durante estos 4 años Erika tuvo la oportunidad de acceder a nueve créditos con MFP, con los que poco a poco ha mejorado su situación económica, tanto de ella como del grupo, quienes son muy responsables y comprometidos. El deseo de progresar la está motivando en incrementar su mercadería y con los 2000 soles que solicita comprará grandes cantidades de prendas para distribuirlas a sus clientas.
texts.en:
For Erika, who is 34 years old, life has been a struggle, but with great effort she managed to buy the house where she lives with her two children. With the responsibility of taking care of her children and their integrity, she goes out to sell clothing, which she buys in the central market of her city and sells in areas where she can get a higher price for it.

Thanks to the great demand that exists, primarily from young women who want to dress in the latest fashions, Erika makes a lot of money, although being out in the sun or the cold all day wears her out. For this reason, she is using a new sales technique, which consists of distributing the clothing to some stores or customers, and later going out to collect payments every day, which she does with her daughter who helps her each afternoon. However, both of them have the goal of getting a little shop, so they can stop walking and have a stable location.

During these four years, Erika has had the opportunity to take out 9 loans with MFP, with which she has, little by little, improved her financial situation, just like the rest of the group, who are all very responsible and committed. The desire to get ahead is motivating her to increase her merchandise, and with the 2000 soles she is asking for, she will buy greater quantities of clothing to distribute to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua O. is 40 years old, married and the mother of four children. Currently three of her children are working and her last is still in senior high school. She lives at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. She is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls, lunch boxes etc. She mostly sells through hawking, which is house-to-house selling. She has been trading for five years now. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her stand. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She is requesting a loan to buy more products like cooking utensils etc., which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan, she believes she will be more prepared to make lots of profit, to build a store, and to reduce the frequent walking in the street to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance. Akua belongs to a village bank called ‘Mpeasem’, which simply means I don’t want trouble.

loans.use: To increase her stock of inventory like cooking utensils.

loans.name: Lourie

texts.en:
Lourie D. J. is 46 years old and a tricycle (three-wheeled moto-taxi) operator in their village at Silauan Norte of Ecahgue, Isabela. He is married to Julieta and they have two children: Dexter - 21 years old, a high school graduate, and Diwata - 3 months old. Due to life difficulties, he was not able to pay for the college education of his son.

Lourie has worked as a tricycle operator for 20 years and he has also been a fish vendor in their village for two years. He is in need of financial assistance for the maintenance of his motorcycle that he also uses in fish vending. He is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 that will be of great help for the progress of his business.

Lourie is hoping that someday, they can send their younger child to school to earn a college degree.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Lux Estela

texts.es: la Sra. Luz L. tiene 42 años de edad, es residente de la colonia fraternidad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijas, dos de ellas estan casadas y la menor esta estudiando en el colegio, ella ha tenido que trabajar muy duro para poder sacar adelante a sus hijas, ahora su unica fuente de ingresos es su pequeña pulperia que tiene 6 años de antiguedad, antes ella vendia productos varios de forma ambulante pero este es un trabajo muy cansado ya que tenia que caminar mucho para poder vender poco, por eso ella decidio montar una pulperia en la cual le va bien, ella necesita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder tener mas surtida su pulperia. ella dice que este negocio sera su unica fuente de ingresos por muchos años y que su meta es lograr que sea un supermercadito completo.
texts.en:
Luz L. is 42 years old and is a resident of the Fraternidad Colony. She is a single mother of 3 girls, two of whom are already married but the youngest is still in school. She has had to work very hard to support her girls, and currently the only source of income is her small grocery store, running now for 6 years. Before then, she sold various products door to door but that was a very physically taxing work, having to work very long ways to sell only a few things. But this is why she decided to set up a small convenience store, and it has been doing well. She requires a loan to be able to purchase more merchandise and to be able to restock the shelves of her store. She says that this store has been the only source of income for the past many eyars and her goal is to expand her store into a general store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soap, rice, sugar, beans, shortening, chicken, canned goods, sardines, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok C. is a sixty-six year old mother of three children who are single and still living in the family home. She is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals and cares for the children. The family's daily expenses are paid  by Sok C.'s husband who works maintaining a public garden. Another income source comes from their two daughters who work as garment workers for a factory. Recently, heavy rains fell, affecting the family's house with bad water, which is harmful to their health. Because of the problem, Sok C. has decided to ask for a loan of $1200 to purchase a piece of land to surround the house. The remainder of the loan will be used to build a hedge around her house.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to surround the house

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn is the mother of five and she is married to Bonifacio, a helper in a hardware store in the town of Ilagan, Isabela. They are gifted with four children: three are now studying and one is a newly-born baby. 

Revelyn has been engaged in a general store business for more than twelve years. She ventured into this business to help her husband uplift their poor living situation. She aims to become a successful entrepreneur someday. To further do that, Revelyn is asking for the support of Kiva lenders to lend her PHP 8,000 as additional working capital to maintain and grow her business which will benefit their children in the future.

Revelyn hopes that her children will finish their studies in college and find better opportunities in life someday. Her children are all willing to complete their education with the hope to pay back the sacrifices of their parents and uplift their ways of living before they get married.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Agahuseyn

texts.en: Agahuseyn S. is 58 years old. He is married with 3 sons. Agahuseyn sells confections and other foodstuffs in the market. He has been in this business for 15 years. This activity generates the main income for his family. Since Agahuseyn is very popular in the market selling fresh and tasty foodstuffs, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Agahuseyn requests $2,000 USD for the purchase of foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Lizete

texts.pt:
Lizete M. nasceu no distrito municipal da catembe, tem 37 anos de idade e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 14 e 21 anos. O mais velho frequnta 10 classe na escola secundaria da catembe. Vive também com uma sobrinha sob sua responsabilidade na casa própria.

Lizete cresceu com os seus pais, mas muito cedo teve que interromper a escola na 6 classe para emigrar a África do sul para trabalhar para durante 13 anos.
Em 2004 casou se e passa a viver com o marido no distrito de Boane (matola rio) este que edifica um pequeno estabelecimento comercial com o intuito de vender produtos de primeira necessidade, trabalho que faz a mais de 2 anos de experiência e conta com uma empregada.

Aprendeu fazendo, mas também com ajuda das amigas que lhe dão coragem e dicas para melhor gerir o negocio.
Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições e é pela primeira vez que solicita o empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de diversos produtos de primeira necessidade. Pretende aumentar o volume do negocio satisfazer a demanda.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder os outros empréstimos para cumpri o sonho de ampliar o estabelecimento comercial e expandir para novas zonas circunvizinhas.
texts.en:
Lizete M. was born in Catembe. She is 37 years old and has 3 children between the ages of 14 and 21. The eldest is in 10th grade in the school in Catembe. She also lives with a niece under her care, in a house she owns. Lizete grew up with her parents, but had to leave school in 6th grade in order to emigrate to South Africa and work for 13 years. In 2004 she married and went to live with her husband in Boane (Matola Rio). She opened a small shop for staple goods. She has more than two years of experience and has one employee. She learned on the job, but her friends' support gave her courage and hints on how to improve her business. She's never had loans with other institutions, and this is the first time she's requested a loan. The loan is in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase a variety of staple goods. She plans to expand her business in order to satisfy demand. She intends to pay off the loan without problems and request others in order to achieve her dream of expanding her shop to serve nearby areas.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple goods

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
Gelita is a member of the Mtivila borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 49 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 25,22,18 and 12 years.she also cares for other 1 dependents.

Gelita started her own business selling local alcohol 11 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximate 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Gelita`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for her business.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Gelita hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Elvira es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, de profesión profesora de inicial, Elvira tiene una tienda en una galería que esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende ropa.
Elvira necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sacos.
Los sueños de Elvira son tener otras sucursales y surtir con otros productos como ropa sport.

loans.use: Para la compra de sacos.

loans.name: Rose Wairimu

texts.en: Rose Wairimu N. is 47 years old and is married to Edwin Muraya who is a businessman. They have two children, Peter and Josephine, who are 21 and 17 years old respectively. Rose has been in the clothes-selling business for four years. She did not have a previous credit history until she was introduced to KADET by friends who interact with her as she operates her business. Her business is located in a densely populated area where her customers live. Rose has applied for a loan which she plans to use to expand her business. Rose believes she is hardworking, determined, and focused. Her future dreams are acquiring a clothes stock from foreign countries and to start an exhibition in the central business centre in Nairobi. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana M. is a 55 year-old woman living in the town of Sinamoga.  She is married and has 5 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Ana owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community.  Ana has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately $750 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of $750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  Ana is now requesting a new loan of $750 WST which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Ana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle

loans.name: Bebeth

texts.en:
Bebeth H. is from the village of Anahawon in Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Bebeth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Bebeth sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, basic daily-use products, and varieties of finger foods in the local community. Bebeth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Bebeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bebeth is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be Bebeth's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som T. is a 38 year old garment worker who lives in Phnom Penh. Som T. is married with two teenage children, while her husband, Say Chea, aged 38, is a local ox trader. He also buys oxen at reasonable prices from the rural people and fattens them for a while before selling for a profit. Currently, this couple owns a plot of land which they use for farming work. Som T. hopes to generate extra income by borrowing a loan to purchase watermelon seeds, and fertilizer, to grow on her farmland. Note: Som T. was not available for photographing, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase watermelon seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares, a 27-year-old father of 3 children who lives in Palestine, owns a small shop that sells vegetables and fruits. Fares requested a loan of 3,000 US dollars from Ryada in order to diversify the fruits and vegetables he sells in his shop. With your help, Fares will be able to move his business forward and offer his family a better future.

loans.use: Increasing of the variety of fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
La socia LUCRECIA es una humilde madre de familia que ya son varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”.    

La socia tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente. La socia tiene tres hijos que estudian en el colegio, el mayor de los hijos es un niño especial es invidente. 

La socia Antonio vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de repollos, culantro, zanahoria y muchas más, las verduras lo traen de las chacras del valle de Angostura. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar, con la venta de verduras.  Ya son  varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que va sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la venta y compra de aves de corral como gallinas y cuyes. Así de esta manera poder aumentar el capital del negocio y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is a humble mother who has been a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Purificada – Angostura” for several years. She is 34 years old and in a common law marriage. Her three children attend high school. The oldest child is blind.

Lucrecia lives in the community of Angostura in San Jerónimo District, which is located south of the city of Cusco. She sells cabbages, cilantro, carrots, and many other types of produce. She brings in vegetables from her fields in the Valley of Angostura. Lucrecia divides her time between tending to her household duties and selling vegetables. She has several years of experience in this business and has done very well because of her efforts. Lucrecia is a hardworking and enterprising mother who wants to succeed for the sake of her family.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy and sell chickens and guinea pigs. This will allow her to increase her business capital so that she can provide her children a better quality of life. Lucrecia is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens & guinea pigs

loans.name: Ama Abidé

texts.fr:
Cette dame est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle s'est lancée en 2002 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle veut  profiter des périodes de fêtes de fin d’année  pour augmenter ses recettes, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour accroître son stock avec  4 sacs de riz,  3 bidons d’huile, 4 cartons de boîtes de conserve et 3 cartons de pâtes alimentaires.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady is married and is the mother of 2 children; in 2002, she began a business selling general food products, and she gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She wants to take advantage of the holiday period at the end of the year to increase her sales, which is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to augment her stock with 4 bags of rice, 3 cans of oil, 4 cartons of canned goods, and 3 boxes of pasta. She is married and has 2 children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Saye

texts.en: Ms. Saye D. lives in the town of Bambey, about 100 km from Dakar. She began selling palm oil only last year, when her husband was able to give her 10,000 XOF to launch her business. She quickly found the activity to be profitable and quite enjoys it as it gives her something to do. With the loan of 50,000 XOF, she would like to replenish her stock of palm oil. This is her first loan from UIMCEC.  Ms. D. is married, with four children between the ages of three and seven.

loans.use: Replenish her stock of palm oil

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: W. Gerald is a businessman dealing with the timber business. He is 45 years old and married with two children in school. He has been in his business for over three years. He is using the loan to purchase, transport and sell timber from different locations in Luwero district. He usually supplies timber to different customers in Luwero district. In the future, he plans is to open another timber workshop and extend his services to other areas to make more profit.

loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Funke

texts.en:
Funke is 36 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her eldest child is 9 years old, and she is happy because her children are doing well in school.

She is a hair dresser who makes lovely Nigerian and western hairstyles for her customers. Her customers are mostly residents and friends. She hopes to own a world class beauty salon in the future.

She hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more hair extensions, one generator, and one deep freezer. She has a good relationship with LAPO. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, one generator, and one deep freezer

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en: Nicolas Aguero is 44 years old and has been married to Blanca Portillo for 25 years.  They have 12 children together who they care for and who Nicolas supports with his earnings working as a carpenter.  Nicolas' two oldest sons, ages 18 and 20 work with him.  The family lives on Potrerito street in Coronel Oviedo.  According to Nicolas, his work and his family's well being is his life.  He is from a family of modest means and learned his trade from his father, Lorenzo.  Nicolas is seeking the loan from Fundación Paraguaya to purchase basic materials, as he as already signed a contract with a local school to build chairs and desks.  With this loan he will be able to purchase wood in bulk for a low price.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: José Romeo

texts.es: José Romeo L. R. de 43 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a una hija la cual se dedica a estudiar. José posee un taller en el cual se encarga de reparar automóviles, de vender repuestos usados para estos y vender chatarra. Su negocio esta ubicado en una de las principales carreteras de El Salvador llamada Carretera de oro. Desde hace mucho años que él se encuentra ubicado en este lugar, lo que le ha permitido ser muy conocido incluso por las personas que trabajan con trailers quienes se detiene ahí a comprar repuestos. Es de esta manera en como José ha logrado mantener a su familias, es por esta razón que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar un pick up fundido, para utilizar sus partes para realizar otros tipos de trabajo y repuestos.
texts.en:
José Romeo L. R. is 43 years old and he lives in the municipality of Llopango, which is located in the department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife who takes care of the home and their daughter, who is in school. Jose has an automotive workshop. He repairs cars and sells spare parts and scrap. His business is located on one of El Salvador's main highways called gold highway. He has been in this location for many years which is why he is well known in the area even by people who work with trailers who stop there to buy spare parts. This is how Jose has taken care of his family and why he is asking for a loan he can buy a pick-up truck with. He wants to use the parts to do other types of work and for spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron

loans.name: Djamshed

texts.ru: Ахмедов Джамшед проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 22 года. Женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Джамшед имеет среднее образование. Подрабатывает строительными работами. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает скот. В этой области уже 2 года. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Djamshed A. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 22 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. Djamshed has a secondary education. He does construction work. Besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry. He fattens and sells livestock. Djamshed has been in this field for 2 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann F., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Rodrigo F., a driver, and they are blessed with four children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing their own canteen while overseeing the operation of their jeepney.

Mary Ann has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation(CCT)* for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the success of her business, she has applied for a 34,000 Philippine peso loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding businesses to buy spare parts for the maintenance of the jeepney and some stock for the canteen. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of two operating jeepneys

loans.name: Gabat

texts.en:
Gaba J. currently selling bags of charcoal at her store. She is requesting a loan to stock maize and beans to sell. Gaba is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 3 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a car to transport bags of charcoal from the producers to her store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Carolina Elizabeth

texts.es: Carolina Elizabeth C. D. R. D. 33 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, en el mercado municipal D. Soyapango, un lugar excelente para todo tipo D. comercio, lo que beneficia en gran manera a Carolina, ya que posee un puesto muy granD. en la zona D. venta D. ropa del mercado, gracias a el tiempo que posee D. vender en ese lugar, como también a los precios tan accesibles que ella brinda, cuenta con varias ventas ya sea con personas que visitan el mercado o con personas que trabajan en el mismo lugar. Carolina vive junto a sus tres hijos D. 8, 6, y 2 años D. edad, así mismo vive junto a su madre quien le ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar y con el cuido D. sus pequeños hijos. Como madre soltera quien debe sostener su hogar por si sola, es muy responsable, ya que siempre esta buscando alguna alternativa nueva para mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, ya que es ese el negocio que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Carolina solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa y D. esta manera aprovechar las temporadas y celebraciones que se aproximan tales como: el día del padre y el día del maestro, en los cuales ella espera poder mejorar sus ventas, es por esto que desea poder aumentar su inventario y así mismo las opciones para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carolina Elizabeth C. D. R. is 33 years old. She sells clothes in the Soyapango municipal market. It is an excellent place for all types of commerce, which is greatly beneficial to Carolina. She has a very large stand in the area where they sell clothes in the market. Thanks to the amount of time that she has been selling in this place and the accessible prices that she offers, she has many sales. She sells to people who visit the market or to people who work in the same place. Carolina lives with her three children; ages 8, 6, and 2. She also lives with her mother, who helps her with the household chores and taking care of her small children. As a single mother who has to support her household by herself, she is very responsible. She is always looking for a new alternative activity to improve her business and increase her sales. This business allows her to support her household. Carolina is requesting a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of clothes. This way she will take advantage of the upcoming season and celebrations such as Father’s Day and Teacher’s Day. She hopes to be able to increase sales for those days. That is why she wishes to be able to increase her inventory while giving her customers options at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pea seeds

loans.name: Mr. Mon Chae Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has eighteen people who live in Bang village in Kandal province. Mr. Mon C. is a village bank president, selected by the other members. They will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 


Mr. Mon C. is a village chief who earns a low salary with which to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Rum Phorn, is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice, not for sale, but to support her family. Now he has a problem because his wife’s field is infertile. Mr. Mon C. is, therefore, applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. He is the father of two children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ghulam Kubra's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Kubra has applied for a loan to help her husband in his business of selling animals. Her husband handles two businesses: he sells animals and does labor work as well to earn an extra income. She is the mother of six children, who all are getting their education.

Ghulam Kubra is a very supportive lady. By taking care of her growing kids and husband, and by working hard, she shares the work burden with her husband. She helps him by raising up the animals for sale. Both parents work very hard to provide for the family.

Ghulam Kubra is hoping that with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to buy some more animals and earn a good profit when selling them.

loans.use: To purchase animals for resale.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que reside junto a sus cuatro hijos en el caserío La Huaca del distrito de Olmos, la zona es una comunidad rural situada dentro del distrito con mayor extensión geográfica de la región, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a vender artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en la vivienda donde reside, el negocio es de mucha utilidad para ella, ya que le provee de ingresos económicos con los cuales mantiene a su familia y para su comunidad ya que gracias a su bodega sus vecinos cuentan con diversos productos de uso diario al alcance de la mano, ya que normalmente tendrían que dirigirse hacia el pueblo de Olmos para adquirirlos.

Manuela desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más artículos de modo que sus clientes puedan encontrar mayor variedad de productos en su negocio, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre se ha esforzado para sacar adelante a sus hijos, anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos en Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Manuela is 53 years old and is a mother. She lives with her 4 children in the village of La Huaca in the Olmos district. She lives in a rural community located within the district's largest geographic region in the Lambayeque province that is more than 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 3 years she has been making a living selling basic necessity items and groceries from a store that she set up in her house. The business is very beneficial since it provides her with an income that supports her family. It is beneficial for her community also, since it gives her neighbors easy access to various daily use products, whereas normally, they would have to go to the village of Olmos to buy them. Manuela wants to expand her business by buying more goods so that her customers can have a better selection of products from which to choose. In order to meet this goal she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency). She is a hard-working woman and has always struggled to provide for her children. She has had previous loans with this institution and has been punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase daily use products for her store that is in her house.

loans.name: Marina Lizbeth

texts.es: Marina Lizbeth tiene 22 años, su actividad es la venta de recargas telefónicas. Hace mas de 2 años que tiene este negocio, es así que diariamente trabaja brindando este servicio, ya sea en el exterior de su casa o en su pequeño establecimiento, generalmente este trabajo lo realiza hasta las 3 de la tarde ya que luego se dispone a realizar este servicio a domicilio, en donde le toma el resto de día que le queda. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en este servicio porque es un área que conoce bastante además de que se siente respaldada por la experiencia de varios años en esta actividad. Es su primer crédito, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá para compra de materia prima para más recargas que sus clientes solicitan.
texts.en:
Marina Lizbeth is 22 years old and sells cell phone top-up cards. She’s had this business for more than two years and she works daily, whether it be from the front of her home or from within a small establishment. She works [from the establishment] until 3:00 in the afternoon, and then goes door to door. This takes up the rest of her day. She tells us that she enjoys providing this service because it’s a business that she knows very well and she’s backed by several years of experience. This will be her first loan and she is very happy to know that she has financial backing. She has always been responsible with her payments and will use the money from this loan to invest in more top-up cards that her customers have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lemondoi Kareisi

texts.en:
Lemondoi has been rearing and selling livestock in Naivasha town for the last 18 years. He is 38 years old and married to Maria Ene Karesisi. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan. He plans to buy 15 goats, which he will sell later at a profit.

Lemondoi is also planning to open a butcher shop in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora C., 55, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Nelson C., a driver, and mother of six children.

Leonora operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs ranging from round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats, braided quilts and bed sheets, and other crafts that most rug-makers make everyday. Since they are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are among the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while one is riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales each day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php33,000 loan to buy more quantities of raw materials including fabrics, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Leonora dreams of being able to meet all the needs of her family, and faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabrics, thread and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Señor Mario nacido en Santa Cruz, casado con doña Luisa tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. El señor desde su niñez vive en Pampa el Cosal provincia cordillera, el trabaja en la  agricultura,  siembra sandia, yuca, papa, etc. y también tiene su camión que cuando no siembra lo trabaja con pasajero al Torno, pero mas se dedica con negocio propio ya que el auto le sirve para transportar sus productos al mercado de el Torno. El dinero del crédito lo utilizara para contratar mano de obra para la preparación de la tierra y así poder sembrar sus productos, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario was born in Santa Cruz. He is married to Luisa and has three school-age children. From childhood, he has lived in the mountain region of Pampa el Cosal. He works in agriculture, cultivating watermelons, yucca, potatoes, and so on. He also has a truck, so when he's not working on the farm, he takes passengers to the market town of El Torno. However, the more he dedicates himself to his own farm, the more he uses his vehicle to transport his goods to El Torno. He will use this loan to hire farm hands to help with preparing the land so he can plant more products. He thanks microfinace partner Emprender for supporting him.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire farm laborers for the cultivation of watermelons

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.es:
Altagracia es una de nuestras asociadas de Hato Mayor, una de las ciudades mas rurales del pais, cuya economia depende de la agricultura. Altagracia es una empresaria, dedicada a la venta de carne y fabricacion de dulces caseros, es madre de 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 aun viven con ella. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido tener que enfermarse y buscar dinero sin tenerlo, condición que desea mejorar segun su negocio vaya creciendo, mientras sigue asistiendo a la iglesia, la cual es su actividad favorita.

Altagracia está muy emocionada de recibir su decimo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y en cada uno haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha negociado por alrededor de 5 años, el cual inició por su iniciativa de generar ingresos, y cuando obtuvo su primer prestamo. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de varios cerdos para su carniceria, y ingredientes como harina, azucar, coco para la elaboracion de dulces caseros. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para construir las paredes laterales de su casa. Su sueño es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Altagracia is one of our members from Hato Mayor, one of the most rural cities of the country and its economy depends on agriculture.  She is a merchant selling meat and producing homemade sweets.  She is the mother of 6, with 2 still living in the home.  Altagracia tells us that the most difficult part has been getting sick and needing to earn money without having any.  This made her want to work so that her business keeps growing, while she continues helping at the church, her favorite activity.

Altagracia is very excited to be receiving her tenth loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid back her previous loans satisfactorily, and each one having pushed the growth of her business one step along.  She has been working for about 5 years. She started on her own to generate earnings when she had her first loan.  Altagracia will use the money from the loan to buy some pigs for her butcher shop and ingredients such as flour, sugar and coconut to create her homemade sweets.  She plans to use the profit to build side walls on her house.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy pigs and flour

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. is married and lives with her son’s family with two children. Emma’s husband has left home for Russia to find a job. Emma has been trading since 2000. Emma is selling locally made quality shoes, which are cheaper than imported ones and have a higher demand in the market. 

Currently, Emma is planning to purchase new stock from local shoemakers and for that purpose, she requires this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing new shoe stock from local shoemakers

loans.name: Vit's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vit K. is 65 years old. She has been selected as the village bank president by its nine members. They are living Damrei Chhlang village, Kandal province. Each member of the village will use their portion of the loan to support his or her different purposes. 

Mrs. Vit K. earns her living by operating three businesses: fish vending, vegetable vending and cake selling in the local market. Since these businesses are going well, she wants to expand them. So Mrs. Vit K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish and vegetables to support her businesses activities. Mrs. Vit K. is a widow without any children.

loans.use: To buy more fish and vegetables

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is a married lady with three children.  For a living, she does dairy farming.  She started the business in 2005.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has improved her living standards because her business has grown.  Her desire is to be a successful dairy farmer with a good number of dairy cows.  She has requested 40,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao M. (in the photo), and his wife, Kim Chankresna, live along National Road 5, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1989 and have seven children — three sons and four daughters. 

Mao has been fishing since 1990. His wife sells the fish that he catches in the local market. Mao is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase a horse and cart that he hopes will become another business: for a fee, Mao will use the horse and cart to carry goods for his fellow villagers.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and a cart.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Fishing is the most vital part of 26-year-old Noun M.’s daily work. She and her husband have been working on a fishing boat on the river for more than four years. This couple wake up every morning, drive their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fish. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect their M. after their buyers sell all of the fish that they bought. Noun M. and her husband support their only child, who is enrolled in school. 

This approaching fishing season, the lakes are full of fish but the family is lacking tools for fishing. Therefore, Noun M. is applying for a loan to purchase additional fishing equipment in order to support her business activities.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Los Saucitos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "los saucitos", decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama la localidad donD. viven y todos son originarios D. esta población, la  historia es acerca D. la señora Elideth R. P., ya que es la representante D. dicho grupo, cuenta con 27 años D. edad y es soltera, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. pan, lleva mas D. 15 años realizando esta actividad.

Ella eligió esta negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera D. apoyar a sus padres, con los gastos económicos y tener una mejor solvencia económica, para así mejor su calidad D. vida, aparte D. que es una muy buena fuente D. ingresos, ya que también es el negocio D. su familia, es por eso que decidió empezar con este negocio, con el préstamo que recibió va a continuar invirtiendo en su panadería, en la compra D. mas materia prima como son: sal, azúcar, harina, huevos, manteca y levadura, para así tener una mejor producción y variedad D. pan en su negocio.

Su negocio le esta sirviendo D. mucho, ya que D. las ganancias obtenidas, esta sacando para continuar apoyando a sus padres con sus gastos personales e ir mejorando cada vez mas su calidad D. vida, además D. que esta ahorrando para comprarse una lavadora, ya que no cuenta con una y le hace mucha falta . 

Doña Eli dice que su meta es la D. hacer que su negocio crezca empresarialmente, ya que quiere construir un local más granD., ya que quiere poner una panadería y así D. esta forma tenerla muy bien surtida y así obtener más y mejores ganancias.  

Ella dice que conoce muy bien a sus compañeros y nos comenta que son personas muy responsables, gente trabajadora, confiable que tienen ganas D. salir adelante y superarse y por lo mismo en ninguna ocasión se han atrasado o fallado con los pagos D. su crédito, ya que quieren seguir contando con el apoyo D. mas prestamos.

Da las gracias a los prestatarios D. kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, puesto que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener una mejor calidad D. vida junto con su familia y un mejor futuro.

Los integrantes del grupo D. los saucitos y las actividades que realizan son:
Florencia R. G.- venta D. refacciones 
Lucia J. R.-venta D. plásticos
Hilaria A. E.-venta D. pollos
Isabel P. R.-venta D. pan
Ludivina S. L.-frutería
Adela D. J. L.-venta D. ropa
Leonardo C. D. J.-venta D. nieve
Albertina E. N.-venta D. antojitos
Arelia G. B.-venta D. pollos
Maria erid G. M.-venta D. refrescos
Elideth R. P.-venta D. pan
texts.en:
This group is called 'Los Saucitos'.  The members decided to give the group this name because it is the name of their town and they were all born in the town.

This story is about Elideth R. P. since she is the group's representative.  She is 27 years old and single.  Her business is making and selling bread and she has been in this business for more than 15 years.  She chose this business because she wanted to find the best way of supporting her parents with their financial expenses and to proviD. them with better financial solvency so that they could improve their quality of life.  It is also a very good source of income since it is her family's business.  This is why she decided to set up in this business.

Elideth will use this loan to continue investing in her bakery, buying more ingredients such as salt, sugar, flour, eggs, butter and yeast so that she can produce more bread and a better variety of bread in her business.  Her business is very helpful as she is using the profits she makes to continue supporting her parents with their personal expenses so that they can continue improving their quality of life.  She is also saving to buy a washing machine since she doesn't have one but really needs one.

Eli says that her goal is to grow her business.  She would like to build bigger premises as she would like to set up a well-stocked bakery so that she can make more profits and better profits.  She says that she knows her fellow group members very well and she tells us that they are responsible, hard-working and trustworthy people who have a great desire to get ahead in life and improve themselves.  They have never fallen behind in or failed to meet their loan repayments since they would like to continue receiving support with further loans.

Eli thanks Kiva lenders for giving her this opportunity and placing their trust in her but, above all, for believing in her since thanks to your help she is able to invest in her business and enjoy a better quality of life together with her family and a better future.

The members of the 'Los Saucitos' group and the business activities that they carry out are as follows:

Florencia R. G. - spare parts sales
Lucia J. R. - plastic sales
Hilaria A. E. - chicken sales
Isabel P. R. - bread sales
Ludivina S. L. - fruit shop
Adela D. J. L. - clothes sales
Leonardo C. D. J. - flavored iced water sales
Albertina E. N. - appetizer sales
Arelia G. B. - chicken sales
Maria erid G. M. - soft drink sales
Elideth R. P. - bread sales

loans.use: To buy more ingredients such as: salt, sugar, flour, eggs, butter and yeast

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura B. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region.  She is 33 and married. Her husband is engaged in cattle breeding. Together they bring up two daughters, both of them are at school. Thirteen years ago with the initial investment of 3000 soms Ainura started to sell convenience goods. Now she earns 10000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase sausages for sale. In the future Ainura wants to expand her business and build a big house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sausages

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy K. and her husband, Mr. Bunny Noun (pictured together), live in a village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have four children: one son and three daughters. 

Chanthy is a weaver. Her husband is a mechanic. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and to purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and purchase weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
This is Martina B..  She is  49 years old and is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Alberto B., a tricycle driver. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Martina operates a variety store and an Internet cafe. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Php-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store and Internet shop is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help continue the operations of her businesses, Martina is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her store inventory, and to add a computer to her Internet shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Martina hopes to be able to expand soon, as she hopes to have her own house and lot in a prominent subdivision in a nice location. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy inventory for variety store, and computer for Internet shop

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Nansalmaa is a 36-year-old widow who lives with her two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two boys attend a secondary school. Since 2003, Mrs. Nansalmaa has been running a sports shoes retail business. She rents a stall on Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. Every month she travels to China to buy her products for sale. She is a hardworking woman who is left to raise her two children on her own. Her dream is to raise her kids healthy and to have a proper family house in the future. Now spring time is approaching and therefore she is planning to increase her income by extending her stall and inventory by buying more sport shoes.

loans.use: To buy more sport shoes

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet A. is from the village of Maranding, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Juliet is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Wanyinan Group

texts.en:
This group of 11 entrepreneurs all live in the same building in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their second loan with ALIDE.

Christine (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1965 in Adjarra to the north of Benin. She moved to Cotonou 12 years ago. A widow, she still cares for two of her six children.

For the past 12 years Christine has run a stall selling fish and meat meals. This loan will enable her to purchase raw ingredients directly from the lake and markets. Her aim in the long term is to grow her business to be able to fully care for her children's needs. She claims to have strong management skills and a thorough approach to completing her tasks.

loans.use: to purchase fish, meat, and condiments to prepare meals for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old Lebanese single woman. She is living with her parents and three siblings. She participates in funerals and condolence visits. Her job consists in reading biographies of religious persons in addition to enlightening people and giving them advice to do good works.  She has a significant impact on people’s minds. She is recognized in this occupation as she gets invitations from abroad to be part of funerals to spread her inspiring messages. 

 Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car in order to make her transportation effortless since she has lots of customers located in different areas asking for her services and she must fulfill their requests.

loans.use: to purchase a car as transport when working.

loans.name: Orozobek

texts.en:
Orozobek S. is 55, married, and has four children. He worked as a driver, and in order to find an additional means of subsistence for his family he started his business of cattle breeding in 2006.  With the initial capital of 15,000 KGS, he managed to develop a farm with a monthly profit of about $86.  With the revenues, he was able to pay for a good education for his elder daughters and to buy a car for his family.   

Orozobek has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase two bull calves and ten sheep. It will allow him to further improve his household and in the future, to expand his business activities by building a bath house for the local population.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and sheep.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
Gumercindo de 26 años, es soltero, vive en casa de unos familiares que cuenta con servicio de luz y agua solamente, está ubicada en el distrito de Salas  que esta a más de una hora del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Gumercindo se dedica a transportar cargamento en su motocar  (es un medio de transporte conformado por una parte de una moto lineal que lleva una cabina para cargar sacos con productos ) de Salas a otros caseríos.  También se dedica a la agricultura, tiene unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra y comercializa cafe.  Ambas actividades le deja ingresos que le permite solventar todos sus gastos y necesidades.

Por eso Gumercindo al ver que su negocio de cafe a ido incrementándose a solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para seguir comprando cafe y vendiendolo al por mayor y menor, pero también lo va utilizar para brindarle mantenimiento a su moto, para ofrecer un mejor servicio ha sus clientes.  Gumercindoes una persona muy conocida en Salas por el servicio de motocar que brinda y por el buen cafe que vende, por ser muy trabajador , empeñoso y con muchas ganas de seguir mejorado cada vez más.
texts.en:
Gumercindo, age 26, is single and lives with family in a house with electricity and running water.  It is in the district of Salas which over an hour from the department of Lambayeque.  Most of the population here is involved in agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

Gumercindo uses his motorcar to transport merchandise (it is a mode of transportation comprised of a motorcycle in the front with a cabin on back to transport goods) from Salas to other rural areas.  He also is involved in agriculture and has land where he grows coffee which he later sells.  Both activities give him enough income to take care of his needs and expenses.

Due to increased demand in his coffee business Gumercindo has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN to continue buying and selling his product wholesale and retail.  He also wants to provide maintenance for his motorcar in order to provide the best possible services to customers.  Gumercindo is well known in Salas because of the quality services and coffee he offers.  He is a hard worker and always trying to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy coffee for retail sale and provide maintenance for his motorcar.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Terea vive en el estado de veracruz en el municipio de Tierra Blanca o mejor conocida como la novia del sol, la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera y sus abuandantes calores en verano  de hasta 54°c. Doña Maria Teresa tiene la edad de 68  años, solo estudio hasta el primer año de primaria, es viuda y tuvo 3 hijos los cuales ya estan casados.

Doña Maria Teresa nos platica que hace mas de 40 años tuvo la inquietud de trabajar para ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos asi que inicio a vender ropa para dama y caballero la cual vende casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad tambien nos dice que cuando su esposo vivia ella hizo un ahorro y al morir su esposo lo utilizo para construir dos cuartos de renta para ganarse un poco de dinero extra ademas de que a seguido con su venta de ropa ya que no tenia quien la apoyara economicamente y tenia que sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa para dama y caballero (short, blusas, vestidos, faldas, camisas, calsetines y ropa interior) para posteriormente venderlos.

Ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea que dia a dia cresca un poco mas y en un futuro poder ayudar a sus hijos a darle una mejor profesion a su nietos.
texts.en:
María Teresa lives in the state of Veracruz in the town of Tierra Blanca, better known as the Sun’s Girlfriend, notable because it’s a cattle raising area and because of its extreme summer temperatures of up to 54°C. María Teresa is 68 years old and only finished first grade.  She’s a widow and had three children, all of them now married.

María Teresa tells us that over 40 years ago she was anxious to help her husband with household expenses and her children’s educational costs so she decided to start selling women’s and men’s clothing door to door among her friends and neighbors in the community.  She also tells us that when her husband was still alive she saved up some money and when he died she used it to build two rooms to rent in order to earn a bit more money while still continuing with her clothing sales because she had no one to help her economically and she had to raise her children.

She needs this loan to buy women’s and men’s clothes (shorts, blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, socks and underwear) to sell them later.  She hopes that with this loan her business will prosper because she hopes that it will grow more each day so that she can help her children later on provide better professions for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a thirty one year old single mother of five children who owns a house in Kasese Uganda.  She has been dealing in dried fish for nine years.  She formally dealt in selling beans and when her capital increased she switched into fish selling. 

Her hardship is high taxes levied on her.  Her vision is future business growth and to have a good residential house.  Bibiana needs the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en:
Wilfrida is 48 years old, married, and has four children, ages 10 to 30. She sells sugar, Unga Ngaro, Unga Ugali, and rice to locals at a busy market center. Wilfrida intends to use her loan to purchase more sugar, flour, and maize.

Wilfrida hopes to open several businesses in the area. She describes herself as focused and determined.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, flour, and maize.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 53-year-old father who has two adult-aged children. He earns about PHP 13,000 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines. Alexander has been growing rice for almost 33 years. He is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase needed agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Alexander hopes to have a plentiful harvest to earn a higher income for the sake of his family. He is thankful that Kiva lenders offer financial assistance for him to increase his production.

loans.use: to purchase needed agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Kutesa B Development Group

texts.en:
Getting into the good graces of prospective and established clients in any business undertaking is by and large a process that involves good rapport building, exceptional service and, at times, the offering of free service. In the course of the past 12 years, Sarah has exhibited all that as she goes about her clothing sales business at her boutique, just a stone's throw away from Kampala.

To start this business, Sarah, a good-natured mother of 4, banked on capital from her already established rental business. Sarah carries the conviction that there is invariably a silver lining in whatever bad unfolds. She has used this philosophy to extricate herself out of the narrowest of circumstances. This attribute, in combination with the fact that she works painstakingly and diligently hard, is a stock in trade that she says has played very much in the favor of her business.

Sarah has also been operating under the financial auspices of her husband, who often spares time to help at her boutique. In many respects, this has also contributed to the stability of her business. On the side, Sarah ekes out supplementary income from a rentals business. Her weekly gross income totals up to UGX 200,000. Sarah says this Kiva loan will come in handy to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 34 years old and married with seven children between 13 years old and 8 months old. He lives in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. For two years, he has been dealing in the transport business. He started by laying bricks and from his savings, he later bought an Isuzu tipper to use for transport. He faces the challenge of vehicle breakdowns and his dream is to own two vehicles to mitigate risks. Lawrence needs a loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 25 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de su esposo y su pequeña hija. Desde su niñez ha aprendió a desarrollar bellos tejidos hechos a mano y en la actualidad es una fuente de ingreso muy importante para la economía de su hogar. Trabaja todos los días en la comodidad de su hogar, de esa manera no descuida de su hija, y sin preocupación puede elaborar variedad de prendas tejidas. Pero hay momentos en que debe realizar decenas de prendas, es por ello que contrata la mano de obra de varias mujeres a quienes les da una remuneración por su trabajo.  Ella procura siempre abastecerse de materiales como hilos, lanas de diversos colores, y acompañado de la creatividad que tiene instrumentos suficientes para poder mantenerse y superar sus metas propuestas. Ahora se encuentra en temporada de mayor demanda y por ello necesita un crecimiento de capital, por lo que espera le concedan un pequeño préstamo. Una de sus vecinas le platicó acerca de los créditos que ofrece MFP y decidió solicitar un crédito. Las cuales usará el dinero en la compra de  lanas de distintas calidades y colores, de esa manera podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de precios a sus clientes.
texts.en: Nancy, 25, her husband and young daughter live with her parents.  She learned to make beautiful hand-made textiles as a girl and now she operates a business making and selling them, an important source of income for her family.  She works in the comfort of her own house, an advantage because she can look after her daughter while she works.  There are times when she has to make dozens of pieces and there's so much work that she has to hire extra help.  She always stocks up on the supplies--thread, for example, and various colors of yarn--she needs for the business.  Her materials and her creativity are all she needs to support herself and reach her goals.  She's especially busy this time of year and she wants to increase her working capital.  A neighbor suggested that she apply to MFP for a loan and she decided to do it.  She will use the loan to buy wool of various quality and colors so that she can offer her customers products at various price levels.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her textile business.

loans.name: Nkokonjeru Model Group

texts.en:
Musa earns a livelihood as a food sales businessman in Lugazi. This father of 2 has 4 years experience in this business.
