He sells food such as maize flour, rice, beans, cassavas, etc. Though he has not yet made the cut as per what he envisaged at the threshold, he is upbeat about his prospects.

Musa rose to the occasion when the opportunity availed itself.  His close acquaintances too had been prevailing upon him to take root in the business. Musa also ekes out side income from a motorcycle transportation business. 

Musa's group is on their 4th loan cycle.  Food sales businesses are lucrative ventures which many low income people rely on to make ends meet. Weekly, Musa's gross sales income is to the tune of 30,000 Uganda shillings.  Musa says this Kiva loan will help him out witih the purchase of more food  such as maize, rice, beans, cassava, etc. to resell

loans.use: buy food such as maize, rice, beans & cassavas

loans.name: Meliz

texts.es: Meliz tiene 53 años D. edad, es felizmente casada y vive con su esposo en su casa propia dentro D. su tierra natal. VenD. dulces y arrienda cuartos en su casa desD. hace 10 años, pues posee una casa, dandole ventaja para este negocio D. arriendo D. inmuebles. Junto a su esposo administran las ganancias, que les permite tener mensualmente para los gastos D. su casa. La clave D. su negocio es tener siempre a la mano la mercadería que necesita y tener inquilinos honestos porque ya tuvo malas experiencias con algunos inquilinos que se retrasaban en el pago. en la actualidad considera que tiene el privilegio D. tener inquilinos honestos y esto le da ánimos para mejorar la infraestructura D. su casa y su venta D. dulces. En esta oportunidad solita el dinero para comprar bolsas D. cemento que le servirá para pavimentar la parte frontal D. su casa.
texts.en: Meliz is 53 years old, she is happily married and lives with her husband in their own house in their native land. She sells sweets and rents out rooms in her house, something she has been doing for 10 years. The fact that she owns a house has been an advantage for her room renting activity. She administers the income together with her husband, and this allows them to have enough to pay for the expenses of her house every month. The key to her activity is to keep the products she needs always at hand, and to have honest tenants, since she has had some bad experiences with some tenants who were late in repaying. She considers it a privilege to have honest tenants and this encourages her to improve the structure of her house and her sweets selling activity. She is requesting the money to buy bags of cement that she will use to pave the front part of her house.

loans.use: To buy bags of cement.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is 38 years old and married. She has three children who are 18, 16 and 10 years old. Jolly and her husband have been running a fishing business for 10 years. Jolly's husband is a fisherman and is the one who operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Jolly sells her husband's catch at the market. Jolly plans to use her loan to buy nets, hooks and other fishing gear. This will help Jolly and her husband continue earning from their business.

loans.use: to buy nets, hooks and other fishing gear

loans.name: Abesamihigo D Group

texts.fr:
Athanase fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo D. Le nom du groupe signifie « performers ». Il a 51 ans et il est marié avec 9 enfants de 8 à 28 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  6 ans de primaire.

Athanase est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Athanase voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa région et acheter d’autres surfaces après la récolter. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en: Athanase is a member of  the "Abesamihigo D" group. The group’s name means “performers.” He is 51 years old and married, with nine children from 8 to 28 years of age, six of whomo are in school. His education level is six years of primary school. Athanase  is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy chemical fertilizers for growing rice. His business strategy is to do use selected seeds. In the years to come, Athanase would like to be among the best rice farmers in his region and buy  additional land after harvesting. He plans to use his revenues to provide for his children’s education and other needs.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for growing rice

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has operated his M-PESA shop (a mobile-phone based money transfer service) and milk purchasing business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  He is 53 years old, married to Margaret and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of his friends and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more milk for resale in his dairy shop.

In future, James hopes to expand his milk business and get more income.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is married and blessed with three children. He describes himself as a hard-working business man. He has been selling shoes for the last ten years to support his family. He employs two people to assist him in managing the business. The major challenge he faces is competition. With 40,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to add to his stock of leather shoes and slippers for resale. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to add to his stock of leather shoes and slippers

loans.name: Mary Anne

texts.en: Mary Anne, a 30-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Caipilan, Siquijor where she has been operating a sari-sari store for the past two years, earning a monthly average of PHP 10,000.00.  A member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for ten months, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase more stock for her store. In the future, Mary Anne would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 52 years old. She lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. She is married and has nine adult children.

Luciana is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase feed and medicines for piggery.

Luciana has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for four months. Luciana hopes to expand and be able to sustain her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for piggery.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es: Raymundo, de 31 años de edad, habitante de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí. Agradece mucho por la oportunidad brindada atravez del  financiamiento de Kiva pues su producción de cultivo de frijoles fue muy buena, cubrió gastos de producción. El ha ido poco a poco buscando métodos más modernos que le ayuden con el proceso de la siembra y desea ampliarse más con hortalizas. Es por ello que requiere un segundo financiamiento para compra de insumos, pago de mano de obra para sembrar  1/2 manzana de chiltoma . Uno de sus siguientes pasos es aperturar una cuenta de ahorro para tener como respaldo en tiempo de mucha necesidad.
texts.en:
Raymundo is 31, and lives in Pueblo Nuevo, in the municipality of Estelí. He is very thankful for the opportunity he has been given through the Kiva loan, as the production from his bean crop was very good, and he covered his production costs. 

He has gradually been looking for more modern methods to help with the planting process, and he wishes to expand more with vegetables. 

That is why he needs a second loan to buy agricultural supplies, and labor for planting a half manzana (about 1.38 acres) of bell peppers.  One of his next steps is to open a savings account to have something to fall back on when he really needs it.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, and pay for labor, for planting half a manzana of land with bell peppers.

loans.name: María Moncerrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene 52 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos que es soltero vive con ella.
 
Ella es  una gran mujer  que ha tenido que luchar muy duro para salir adelante con sus hijos, desde hace mucho tiempo atrás se dedica a  lavar ropa ajena y  en sus ratos libres dedica su tiempo al comercio, vende productos por catálogos de Avon, Lebel, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días tanto lavando ropa como en sus ventas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, ella aprovecha para visitar a sus clientes en las noches ya a esa hora está desocupada y encuentra a sus clientes, lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad comercial.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.  Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco ella empezó su negocio que le ha ayudado a salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Unión Y Solidaridad' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Here we meet 52-year-old María.  She is a single mother and has three children who are all adults.  She has worked cleaning other people's clothes for a long time.  In her free time she sells catalog products from Avon, Lebel and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day cleaning clothes and selling her products.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells to order.  She visits her customers in the evenings as this is when she has some free time.  She has been in this business for two years.

María will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.  She has been a member of her community bank for four years and she likes it because she used one of her loans from the bank to start her business.  This has helped her to get ahead in life.

María's dream is to do well in her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Farouk

texts.en:
Farouk is a 45-year-old man. He’s married and lives in Lebanon with his wife and four children, one of whom is working and three others are still attending school. He has been working as a constructor since 1980 and has his own projects and customers. He’s an expert in his field and is looking to further grow his business. 

Today, he needs to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s study fees. This Kiva loan will allow them to continue their education and achieve good positions. In the future, he plans to develop his business more to be a good support for his family.

loans.use: to pay his children’s study fees.

loans.name: Nyandit

texts.en:
Nyandit is a 33-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. For the past year she has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan. 

Nyandit is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 48 year old woman from Baqa'a, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to make home improvements. She is buying new furniture for her home and is also planning on expanding her home by building an additional floor. Her children's education is what is important to her.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Ablawa Bénédicte's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ablawa Bénédicte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ablawa Bénédicte âgée de 29 ans a très fréquenté peu l’école. Ablawa Bénédicte ne vit plus avec son mari. Ablawa Bénédicte est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisé et à sa charge. Ablawa Bénédicte vit seule avec ses enfants. pour ce faire, Ablawa Bénédicte vend des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique et des pâtes alimentaires de façon ambulante et par la technique de distribution depuis deux ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Ablawa Bénédicte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ablawa Bénédicte sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique et des pâtes alimentaires.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
This is Gladys. She is a 37-year-old woman who lives in the area of Kitale. It is a thriving area full of people like Gladys, who, with hard and honest work, make this town a very productive one. 

Gladys is a woman eager to get ahead. She lives with her husband. She is blessed with four children, who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to give them a better future. 

Gladys herself was unable to study to get a white collar job because of the difficult situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, and she is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10 and 15 liters a day, and this helps her to support her family. She also does some side hustle business(timber cutting business).

Gladys also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and this is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will also be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence increased profit levels. 

Gladys is really visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Gladys believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Gladys way out of poverty.
Help Gladys with the loan she needs so she can succeed in everything she’s been working so hard for for many years.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Aunt Sarah is a medium-sized commercial farmer. She cultivates crpos and also rear animals including livestock especially locally bred fowls and goats. She wishes to expand her business after participating in her first TEACH lENDING training. She has deveoped her business and marketing plan. Aunt Sarah therefore wants a credit facility of $1100 from KIVA to hire farm 3 more farm hands to assit her in managing her poultry business.

loans.use: Hiring Farm Hands for Poultry Keeping

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to develop her farm by purchasing organic manure and high quality seeds for maize and beans

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a barber in the Kirkuk market. A young 23-year-old man, he is active and ambitious. He lives with his small family. His father died three years ago and he is responsible now for his family, since he is the only worker in the family.

He has small shop. He applied to AL-Aman to get $1200 to develop his shop and buy a new cooler and a new mirror. He is planning to get more funding in the future to develop his business further.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: To develop the shop and buy a new mirror

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Mrs. V. is 43 years old and has three sons. Her husband drives a local city bus in the town that they live. She works in crafts. She weaves bedspreads made out of "poyvi" (fabric of craft thread typical of the city of Carapegua). She started on this trade at a young age, learning from her parents and being her first job. The trade that she learned has serve her all this time as a way to make a living and also it has been able to provide for the well-being and progress of her family.

Thanks to her entrprenurial actitude, Benita became independent from her parents when she married. She also started to notice that she was able to produce more and improve the quality if her capital increased. That's why she applied for loans and was able to buy her first industrial loom (tool that she uses to elaborate the weaves or fabrics). In that way, her work and labor have increased.

Actually, she has another person that helps her in weaving. She also has a small stand at her house. Her next goal is to be able to buy more industrial looms so she can increase the production and be able to employ more people who need work. She is asking for a $400 dollars loan to get a new industrial loom.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Benita, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene tres hijos varones; su marido es chofer de un colectivo interno de esta ciudad. Ella se dedica a la artesanía. Es tejedora de sobrecamas de “poyvi” (tejido de hilo artesanal típico de la Ciudad de Carapeguá). Desde muy jovencita se inició en esta profesión habiendo aprendido de sus padres como su primer trabajo, oficio que le ha servido durante todo este tiempo para su subsistencia y para el progreso de su familia.

Gracias a su actitud emprendedora, Ña Benita se independizó de sus padres al casarse y comenzó a darse cuenta que podía fabricar más cantidad y con mejor calidad si aumentase su capital, por lo que se inició con créditos y compró un telar industrial (herramienta que utiliza para elaborar los tejidos). Así fue creciendo su labor.

En este momento ya tiene a otra persona que le ayuda a tejer. Además posee un pequeño kiosco en su propia casa. Su próximo objetivo es la de adquirir más telares industriales para producir más y así dar trabajo a más personas que necesitan trabajar. Solicita un crédito de $ 400 para adquirir un telar industrial nuevo.

loans.use: Buying an industrial loom

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en: Fuatino is 30 years old and has an existing business of selling popcorn to make a living for her and her family of three kids and her husband. She delivers to the village people and the primary school in Maagiagi. With three kids to put through school, she earns $60 profit weekly from her popcorn business. Apart from her business, her husband works in the NUS as a security guard, and he earns $48 to help with the family's living expenses, school bills, and also for her repayment every week.

loans.use: To expand popcorn business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa Adalia A. Meza, 54 years old, is a married mother of three who lives in San Ignacio, Paraguay. Two of her children are now in high school and the eldest child is now in college. Her husband, Fidel Ramon Meza, owns a construction company. Rosa owns a grocery store, which helps greatly with the family income. Her store is located in an area of San Ignacio where few other stores exist, and for this reason she receives a great deal of customers from the area. This is also an asset for her husband who also works in the area.

Rosa is very thankful for the help and support she has received from the Fundación. She is now asking for a loan to increase the amount of inventory she can buy, and thereby increase the number of clients she can serve. Also, by buying in bulk she will be able to offer better prices and garner more clients.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, and flour.

loans.name: Ndouga

texts.en: Ndouga M. is 43 years old. He lives with his family in Attecoube, a township in the northeast of Abidjan. He has four children. He sells various seasonings and spices. Mr. M. wants to expand his business and purchase goods in bulk in order to improve his margin and revenues. He joined the AE&I microcredit program in July 2005 and has been an excellent performer since then. He has sent all his children to school and hopes to be able to pay for their university studies in the future. Mr. M. is a hard worker.

loans.use: To purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Ziedullo

texts.ru:
Over the past 2 years Ziedullo I. has been working as an ambulance driver in the hospital of the city of Dushanbe, Tadjikistan. Previously he worked as a trolley driver but lost his job with the fall of the USSR. His children were small and his wife was taking care of the household. It took him a while to find work once again. He even worked as a construction worker for a time. Currently he has a stable full time position. Two of his 9 children are married and own their own businesses. This year Ziedullo is planing to celebrate the wedding of his youngest son. When he heard about the services offered by MicroInvest, he decided to become a Kiva client.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

На протяжении 2 лет Исмоилов Зиёдулло работает водителем скорой помощи в городской больнице в городе Душанбе,Таджикистан.Раньше он был водителем тролейбуссов и с распадом СССР он потерял работу. Дети были маленькими,жена домохозайка он долго искал работу и одно время он работал наемным работником на стройке. Сегодня у нег есть стабильная работа и из 9 его детей,двое женаты и имеют свой бизнес.В этом году Зиёдулло планирует сыграть свадьбу соего младшего сына.Услышав о предоставлении потреб. займов со стороны Микроинвеста он стал клиентом нашей организации и захотел принять участие в КИВА программе.

loans.use: To pay for his son's wedding

loans.name: Herni

texts.en: Herni I., 28, works as a coolie at a construction site and earns a very small income. To earn her living and support her only child, Herni sells clothing such as kid and adult wear, sheets, etc., on credit by going around door to door in the villages. She earns $30 a week. She has joined MBK and now she is asking for a loan of $100 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is 38-years-old and makes a living by selling fresh fish at a stand at the market. She has four children, who have become her reason for being since their arrival. María has the responsibilities of both father and mother because she was widowed five years ago. She has a lot of strength to keep growing her business because she has a great clientele that likes the selection of fish that she offers. She has the goal of increasing her profits and the quality of life of her family. She hopes to increase her working capital. Your help will be very important for this noble mother.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora María de 38 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco en un puesto del mercado, ella tiene cuatro hijos los mismos que desde su llegada se han convertido en su razón de ser, Maria tiene la responsabilidad de padre y madre a causa de que quedó viuda hace cinco años.Tiene mucha fuerza de voluntad para seguir creciendo con su negocio ya que cuenta con una gran clientela que gusta de los pescados seleccionados que oferta, con el propósito de incrementar sus ganancias y la calidad de vida de su familia, desea incrementar su capital de trabajo.Vuestra ayuda será muy importante para ésta noble madre.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer a better quality of selected fish

loans.name: Ye

texts.en: Mrs. Ye A. was born in 1984 and now lives in Snam Pok Village in Kompong Speu Province. She is a farmer and sells vegetables in the market. She has a child who is too young to attend school. Mrs. Ye A.’s husband is Mr. Ley Pon, who is a motorbike taxi-driver. Most of their income comes from vegetable sales and motorbike taxi fares. Unfortunately, the motorbike is old and always needs to be repaired, so it is an obstacle for her husband’s business. Thus, Mrs. Ye A. would like to buy a new motorbike. To be able to do so, she is asking for a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motorbike

loans.name: Alton Fernando

texts.es:
Mr. Alton Fernando N. H. comes from the city of Bluefields, Nicaragua. He is 76 years old and is married to Mrs. Lucia Lacayo. Together they have 10 adult children. Mr. N. has been selling cheese for more than 10 years. His clients are residents in the neighborhood where Mr. N. resides, and they like his cheese because he offers fresh products. Currently, in order to meet demand, he needs to purchase 300 lbs of cheese at $1.00 per pound and 700 kg of beans at $36.00 dollars per kilogram.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Alton Fernando N. H. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 76 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Lucia Lacayo ambos tienen 10 hijos mayores de edad. El Sr. N. vende queso por más de 10 años teniendo como clientes a los habitantes del barrio donde reside que lo prefieren por ofrecer productos frescos, en estos momentos necesita comprar 300 libras de queso a $ 1.00 dólar la libra y 7 quintales de frijoles a $ 36.00 dólar el quintal para poder satisfacer su demanda.

loans.use: To purchase 300 lbs of cheese and 700 kg of beans

loans.name: Navy Orm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy O. is the Village Bank President in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. The Village Bank consists of twenty members. Mrs. Navy O. is a pig breeder in the local village. She is 44 years old and the widow of three children, one of whom is sewing shoes in the village while the two others are studying in state school.

Through Mrs. Navy O. business activity, she wishes to buy more pigs for breeding. Thus, Mrs. Navy O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pigs to raise. She will use the rest of money to buy pig food to feed them.

The two women who sit at the back of the photo are not in this Village Bank and a woman who stands at the back of the photo is also not in this Village Bank.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise and the rest of money she would use to buy pig food to feed them.

loans.name: Taunese

texts.en: Taunese A., , is married with  children. She has many years of experience in the Vegetable Garden business. She sells to the villagers/public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan(s) with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Taunese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to upgrade her business.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds, equipment and chemicals

loans.name: Aly Fernando

texts.es:
My name is Aly M. and I have a business selling everyday household items and groceries,  as well as clothing.   My wife helps run the business in the mornings while I sell clothing in the neighborhood.  In the afternoons I return home to run our shop, which is located in our home.    We do this so we can take care of our 3 children, all of whom attend school.  

 Our business has grown a lot, and we've added fruits and vegetables to our stock, as they are in great demand.   We've run our business well and we have good customers who like the quality and the fair prices we offer to the community.  We are requesting a loan to help us grow our business and continue to improve our family's quality of life.  Thank you. 

 Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes 
hola mi nombre es Aly M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular tambien vendo ropa nueva, el negocio de la pulperia es atendido por mi esposa en las mañanas ya que yo salgo a vender ropa de manera ambulante y en las tarder regreso a mi hogar que es mi negocio y ahi atiendo el mismo,  esto es para poder cumplir con todas las obligaciones de nuestro hogar, soy padre de 3 hijos los cuales los 3 estan estudiando, 
el crecimiento de nuestro negocio es notable ya que ahora vendemos verduras y frutas, y las verduras tienen una demanda fuerte en las ventas, nuestro negocio lo hemos administrado muy bien y nuestros clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta la calidad de nuestros productos y que vendemos a precios justos para nuestros habitantes de nuestra comunidad
salicitamos a ustedes una ayuda para poder hacer crecer nuestro negocio y tener mayores ganancias y asi poder vivir mejor. gracias

loans.use: To purchase more stock for their business, increase their income and continue to improve the quality of life for the family.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 43 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 17 and 15 years old. She has been a clothes and shoe seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Riziki is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Moa

texts.en:
Moa L., 46, is married with one child. She has three years of experience in the Ice cake business. She sells to the villagers and the public seven days per week.

She has had one previous loans with SPBD. Moa will use her loan to improve her business by purchasing plastic cups, sugar and koolaid. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 330 Tala (~83 USD). SPBD loans are Moa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic cups, sugar and koolaid

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra E. est âgé de 44 ans et mère de trois enfants. Elle est sage femme et propriétaire d’une clinique installée à Kpalimé au Togo. Elle prend toujours son affaire au sérieux et désire par cette chance de Kiva et ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV faire des approvisionnements en produits pharmaceutiques indispensable pour son activité et tirer rapidement. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire ses patients et de par conséquent gagner plus de fonds pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Abra E. is 44 years old and mother to three children. She is a clever woman and owns a medical clinic in Kpalimé, Togo. She always takes her work seriously, and with this opportunity from Kiva and this second loan from Kiva Field Partner, FECECAV, she wants to quickly stock up with essential pharmaceutical products for her clinic. This will allow her to better serve her patients and therefore make more money to provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pharmaceutical supplies to better serve her patients.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.en:
Florentine C. was born in Cotonou in 1950 and married Boniface Gogan, a law clerk, in Cotonou. She has two children in school and has sold charcoal for the past two years. She also sells pastries in Cadjèhoun, a neighborhood of Cotonou, where she has lived since her birth. She saw her business grow with her first loan and is now applying for a second loan to buy three bags of charcoal and some bags of corn.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Translated from French:

Née à Cotonou vers 1950, elle est mariée à Gogan Boniface agent au tribunal de première instance de Cotonou. Mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés, elle mène cette activité depuis 02 ans. Elle vend également des beignets depuis 01 ans et réside à Cadjèhoun depuis sa naissance. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 100000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase three bags of charcoal and some bags of corn.

loans.name: Trần Thị Thuynh Group

texts.vi:
Cô Trần Thị T. năm nay 51 tuổi Ms 020211030001, hiện cô đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con trai, 1 con dâu. Cô là một nhóm trưởng rất nhiệt tình. Hai chu kỳ trước nhóm cô đã tham gia vay vốn và hoàn trả rất tốt. Hàng ngày ngoài việc chăn nuôi lợn ra, cô còn làm bánh tẻ, còn chồng và các con cô đều là cán bộ nhà nước, vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình cô mỗi ngày khoảng 150.000VNđ đến 170.000VNđ/ ngày. Chu kỳ 3 này cô tham gia vay mức 5.152.000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn và mua đồ làm bánh.
 Các thành viên trong nhóm của cô: 
 Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 37 tuổi Ms 020211030002 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để mua thêm bàn ghế cho thuê.
 Chị Trần Thị V. năm nay 38 tuổi Ms 020211030004 vay m ức 4.256.000VN đ để chăn nuôi gà đẻ.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 59 tuổi Ms 020211030005 vay mức 4.256.000VN đ để chăn nuôi gà làm mộc.
 Chị Nghiêm Thị C. năm nay 31 tuổi Ms 020211030006 vay mức 3.808.000VN đ để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi T. is 51 years old. She lives with her husband, two sons and one daughter in law. She is an enthusiastic group leader. She joined and borrowed from the fund twice before and has completely paid back her loans. Besides pigs raising, she sells rice cakes. Her husband and children are government worker, and the family's income gross from 150,000 VND to 170,000 VND per day. For her third loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise pigs and materials to make rice cakes. Her group includes the following members: Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hanh, 37 years old, would like to borrow 4,256,000 VND to buy furniture for rent. Mrs. Tran Thi Vien, 38 years old, would like to borrow 4,256,000 VND to raise egg laying hens. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hao, 59 years old, would like to borrow 4,256,000 VND to raise chickens. Mrs. Nghiem Thi Chien, 31 years old, would like to borrow 3,808,000 VND to buy feed for pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock raising and cake/pastry making

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Doña Jackeline tiene 31 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad, habita en Waspan Norte en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo trabaja en ventas de verduras en los departamento lo cual tiene que viajar mucho kilómetros para vender, ella se ha esforzado en apoyarlo ya que todo esta caro y hay que ver por los niños, vende fritanga y hace rifas, estas ventas la hace ambulante y le resulta agotador pero al final del día con su venta terminada se siente contenta, este negocio lo inicio con liquidación del trabajo anterior que tenia en zonas franca, esta es su primer solicitud en Afodenic la cual va invertir en la instalación de aguas negras y la compra de un inodoro para estar mas higiénica con su familia ya que tiene una letrina que ya esta casi llena, sus planes es terminar de hacer su casa ya que es de zinc y desea una mejor vivienda para mejor seguridad de su familia, también desea establecer un lugar fijo donde poner su venta de fritanga donde pueda captar sus clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs Jackeline is 31 years old, married with two children aged 2 and 5 and lives in Waspan Norte, in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. Her husband works as a greengrocer, selling his produce among the various districts of the city and therefore has to travel many kilometres. She has made a real effort in supporting him, now that everything is expensive and they have to provide for their children. She sells fried snacks and organises raffles, which means she has to travel around. This leaves her exhausted but by the evening, when she finishes her selling for the day, she feels satisfied. She started this business with a settlement from the previous job she had in the duty-free zone of the city. This is the first loan she requests from AFODENIC and she will use it to install a sewage system and toilet in her house, providing more hygienic living conditions for her family because at the moment, they only have a latrine that is almost full. Her plan is to also complete the building of her house, which at present is made of zinc and to improve her home, making it more secure for her family. Finally, she aims to establish a fixed place from where she can sell her fried snacks and gain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy piping in order to install a sewage system and toilet

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina B. is a fish vendor. She sells fish in her neighborhood to earn a living for her family. She does not mind walking in the street to market her big, fresh catch. Someday, she dreams of having a stall in the public market to more easily sell her fish and to earn a bigger income to better support her family's needs. Her husband is also a fisherman. Together, they work hard to send all their children to school.

Carolina is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. Aside from buying a new fishing boat, she will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. This will allow her to earn bigger profits and eliminate her worries about having enough money for their daily expenses.

CEVI is helping Carolina grow her business. She enjoys the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI offers to all their clients.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna Y., 54 ans est mariée avec 08 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du mil, du sucre, du pain de singe( fruit du baobab) et du bissap pour préparer des crèmes  glaces et de la bouillie de mil.. Son souhait est d’accroître ses revenus et soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Maimouna Y., age 54, is married and has eight children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Vélingara Foulbé for three and a half years. She wants to buy some millet, sugar, monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), and bissap (dried hibiscus flowers) for making ice cream and millet porridge. Her wish is to grow her revenues and to help her husband with family expenses. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell ice cream and millet porridge

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es socia del Banco Comunal Corí Soncco que significa Corazón D. Oro en quechua.
Florentina es casada, tiene 53 años y 4 hijos, Florentina junto a su esposo tienen un laboratorio D. análisis clínico, tienen 3 sucursales todos ellos en locales alquilados para lo cual cuenta con 3 trabajadores que se encargan D. la atención.
Florentina necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. reactivos.
Los sueños D. Florentina son equipar su laboratorio y descansar, irse D. paseo largo junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Florentina is a partner of the Corí Soncoo Communal Bank, which means "Heart of Gold" in Quechua. Florentina, 53, is married with four children. Together with her husband she has a clinical examination lab. They have three offices, all in rented locales with 3 workers to take care of providing services.

Florentina needs a loan of 3,000 soles, which will be invested in buying reagents. Florentina's dreams are to properly equip her lab and to take a much deserved break, going on a long trip with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of reagents

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa A. is 40 years old. She is married with five children. At the moment, all her children are in school. She is a local manufacturer of palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil.  Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to capital inadequacy to buy machines for the processing. She also sells farm produce like cassava. Cassava contains 100% carbohydrates and can be used in the preparation of starch, cassava dough, and for fufu etc. She has been in this business for six years now and has gotten lots of experience in good human relations. For that reason, demand for her products is high demand. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of palm nuts fruits, cassava and gallons to store the palm oil. Palm oil is used to prepare most of the Ghanaian local dishes like stem, fried plantains etc. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwumapa’, which simply means Good Work.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts fruits and other food stuffs.

loans.name: Jan

texts.en:
Jan A. 30 years old, married, and lives with his own family. He is a very honest, hard working, and talented farmer. He works his own land in Jalalabad (Behsood) and has been working in the same area for more than 20 years. During this time, he has not been able to enlarge his business and make a good income for his family; they live in a rental house.

After trying his best, he bought land a month ago and needs some money to build on it. He applied for an individual loan of 30,000 Afghanis with a term of 27 months to start working on his land to build a house for his family. He hopes that after completing the house, he can be more successful in his life. He is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and hopes that this can be a successful process in his country in the future.

loans.use: Material to build a house

loans.name: Rukayatu

texts.en:
Rukayatu Issahaku is forty-three years old. She is married and mother of four kids who are in junior high and basic school. Her husband works with as a farmer. Rukayatu and her family live in a family house at Ejura in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either in farming or sell in farm products. Very few people run different types of businesses.

Rukayatu sells cooking utensils and plastics. She buys plastic materials such as bowls, buckets, and utensils from Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells them in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell through door-to-door sales. She has been in this business for five years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can purchase cosmetics in bulk.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to reach out to other market centers and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “Yesu do” (translated, Jesus’ love) Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and help each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 50 years old, married, and has eight adult children. Vicenta owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Vicenta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is 28 years old and lives in Barangay Aliguigan, Ilagann, Isabela. She is a college graduate but unfortunately was not able to find a job. She is married to Christopher who is now working abroad. They have a seven-year-old daughter named Chrishelle who is already in grade three.

Michel is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used as added business capital for her general store. In this way, she can help her husband to earn a living. She further said that all their sacrifices in life are dedicated to the welfare of their child and future children. She hopes that her business will grow so as to have a stable business when her husband returns for good.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Máxima L. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Máxima trabaja como empleada en un restaurant de La Paz, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
Con sus ahorros pudo adquirir un lote de terreno, el mismo que ya tiene construido tres habitaciones, pero se encuentran en obra gruesa.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra fina para habitarlas.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Máxima L. lives in a house she owns in the Llajeta zone, on the western end of the city of La Paz. Máxima works as an employee at a restaurant in La Paz, generating income with which she supports herself. With her savings she was able to acquire a plot of land, on which she now has constructed three rooms that are still unfinished. The loan she is requesting is to build two rooms that are completed, so they can be used. This is the third time she solicits a loan, and the financial analysis conducted indicates she qualifies favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build two finished rooms in her house.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia E. is 70 years old and married with 5 children. She sells sarongs and has been in the business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of N 70000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs  to sell

loans.name: Clara De Fatima

texts.pt:
Clara de Fátima Macuacua M. nasceu em inhambane, tem 55 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 27 aos 40 anos. Todos já concluíram um ensino geral. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua afilhada que vive com ela em sua casa. 


Clara perde seus pais ainda criança e cresce com o seu avo materno, esta que perde a vida quando ela frequentava a 2 classe. Assim sendo, ela fica desesperada e sem nenhum parente que pudesse tomar conta dela. passa a viver em casa de um vizinho. Anos depois junta se com seu marido e fica grávida do seu primeiro filho e coincidentemente seu marido é recrutado para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório durante 3 anos. A vida de clara fica mais difícil ainda. Apos a sua chegada a namaacha é enquadrado para trabalhar no município da vila de namaacha e leva com sigo a sua família.

Então, clara com ajuda do seu marido inicia seu próprio negocio de venda de potes adquiridas na capital maputo e revendidas no pais vizinho (swazilandia) por encomendas, nas quartas e sábados no mercado informal shoprite onde a intercambio de vários produtos das 5h às 18h gastando 10.000.00MT em cada viagem.
Tem tido de lucro um valor de 5.000.00MT dependendo muito mais da estação do tempo. 

Aproxima se a hluvuku e kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00MT para reforçar o seu negocio (comprando mais potes, ou seja, panelas de alumínio) – o povo swazi e sul africano têm forte tradição de fazer alimento usando este tipo de panelas -. 

Este e o segundo empréstimo de clara na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. O primeiro credito foi no valor de 20.000.00 serão usados para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos. Está confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para a construção de capoeiras para criação de frangos na sua nova casa.
texts.en:
Clara de Fátima Macuacua M. was born in Inhambane. She’s 55 years old; she’s married and a mother of 6 children between 27 and 40. All of them have already finished their general education. However, she is still responsible for two of them and also her goddaughter who lives with her. Clara lost her parents when she was a child and grew up with her grandfather on her mother’s side, until he died when she was on 2nd grade. For this reason, and desperate after not having any relatives who could take care of her, she moved with a neighbor. Years later, she moves with her husband and gets pregnant with her first child, but at the same time her husband is recruited for mandatory military service for three years. So, Clara’s life becomes even harder. After his arrival to Namaacha, he’s assigned to work at the Vila de Namaacha and he moves with family with him. Once there, and with the help of her husband, Clara opens her own kitchen pots business, buying products in Maputo capital and reselling them in Swaziland, their neighbor country by packages, on Thursdays and Saturdays from 5am to 6pm, at the local market where she can also exchange them for other products, spending 10,000.00MT on each trip. Her profits reach the 5,000.00MT depending on the season of the year. She came to Hluvuku and Kiva to request for a 25,000.00MT loan to upgrade her business (purchasing more pots, that is, aluminum kitchen pots) – the Swazi community, on the South side of the African continent bears a strong tradition of using these type of pots to prepare their meals. This is the second loan Clara receives from Hluvuku and the first one from Kiva. Her first loan was for 20,000.00 and was used to increase the stock of her products. She is confident she will repay this money before the stipulated time, and that she will be able to request for a new loan in order to build a farmyard for chicken breeding in her new house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale kitchen pots (aluminum pots)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia  es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Julia es casada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Julia viaja a las ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales, producto que venD. en el mercado, además Julia venD. leña al por mayor, reparte a los negocios.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña.
Los sueños D. Julia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de leña.

loans.name: Oiniso

texts.en:
Their education is the most important inheritance Oiniso and her husband can give to their four dear children. They are both very responsible parents and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school, an opportunity they never had due to poor finances.

This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and with the unconditional help of her husband and elder son, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their number of cattle. Oiniso and her family are waiting for your quick response. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana T. is a 36 year-old woman living in the town of Levi Saleimoa.  She is married and has 2 children school-aged children.  To make a living, Ana owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling soft drinks in the local community.  Ana has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately $200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2005, Ana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering.  Ana is now requesting a new loan of $1000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Ana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Burulcha's Group

texts.ru:
Лидер этой группы – Бурулча. Ей пятьдесят четыре года и она разведена. Бурулча вырастила троих детей. Сейчас старшей дочери двадцать семь лет. Она работает заграницей в г. Дубаи. Среднему сыну двадцать пять. Он работает в Кыргызстане и живёт отдельно. Младшая, двадцати одна летняя дочь, живёт со старшей сестрой в г. Дубаи. Бурулча, несмотря на свой преклонный возраст, активно занимается увеличением поголовья скота, тем самым сама обеспечивает себя всем необходимым. Два года назад дочь отправила деньги в размере шести тысяч сомов и Бурулча смогла закупить скотину. Разведение скота пришлось ей по душе и Бурулча целиком втянулось в это предприятие. Со временем ей удалось увеличить поголовье скота, продав который, она тут же решила подарить сыну машину. На данный момент, она для своих домашних нужд держит корову и бычка, и так же занимается увеличение поголовья крупно – рогатого скота. Бурулча видит огромный спектр возможностей в этом бизнесе, так как сама природа Кыргызстана очень хорошо приспособлена к разведению скота. Именно по этой самой причине и решила Бурулча обратиться за кредитом, чтобы закупить бычков и отправить их в деревню, где живёт её мать. Откарливая скот там полгода, Бурулча хотела бы продать весь купленный скот и купить мягкую мебель для дома. В планы Бурулчи также входит разнообразить поле деятельности и открыть в будущем вулканизацию, где будет работать её сын. В будущем, Бурулча также хочет построить большой дом для себя и сына. Ради этого она готова пожертвовать временем и усилием. 

Вместе с Бурулчой в группу также входят: Гулия, Гульнара и Мыскал. 

Гулие пятьдесят семь. Вместе с супругом они пенсионеры. Дети давно выросли и живут отдельно. Гулия вместе с мужем держат коров и четыре года занимаются мелким скотоводством. Они успели увеличить поголовье скота и построить дом. Гулие нужен кредит, чтобы закупить еще скотины для увеличения поголовья. 

Гульнаре мать пятерых детей. Муж Гульнары строитель. Гульнара занимается животноводством. Муж Гульнары обеспечил её изначальным капиталом и всячески помогал жене в её новом деле. Гульнара рада своему делу и обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить корову и затем продавать молоко.

Мыскал сорок пять. Она вдова и мать троих детей. Мыскал живёт за счёт животноводства. Заниматься этим делом Мыскал решила сама. Из детей ей никто не помогает. Мыскал решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить бычка, откормить его и затем продать. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Burulcha is the leader of this group. She is fifty-four years old and divorced. Burulcha raised three children. Right now, her oldest daughter is twenty-seven years old. She works overseas in Dubai. The middle son is twenty-five. He works in Kyrgyzstan and lives separately. The youngest, twenty-one-year-old daughter lives with the older sister in Dubai. Despite her age, Burulcha is actively involved in increasing livestock headcount, and thus can provide herself with all the necessities. Two years ago, her daughter sent her money in the sum of six thousand som, and Burulcha was able to purchase livestock. She liked breeding livestock so much that she fully devoted herself to this entrepreneurship. With time, Burulcha could increase livestock headcount, having sold which, she decided to give her son a car right away. Currently, she keeps a cow and a bull for her domestic needs and is also involved in increasing headcount of cattle. Burulcha sees a wide spectrum of opportunities in this business because the environment in Kyrgyzstan is very conducive to breeding livestock. This is precisely the reason why Burulcha decided to request a loan in order to purchase bulls and send them to a village, where her mother lives. After raising livestock there for half a year, Burulcha would want to sell all of the purchased livestock and buy soft furniture for home. Burulcha’s plans also include varying her entrepreneurial activity and opening a tire vulcanization shop, where her son would work. In the future, Burulcha also wants to build a big house for herself and her son. For this, she is ready to sacrifice her time and effort.

Along with Burulcha, this group includes Guliya, Gulnara and Myskal. Guliya is fifty-seven. Her husband and she are retired. Their children are grown and live separately. Together with her husband, Guliya keep cows and have been involved in small-scale pastoral farming. They were able to increase livestock headcount and build a house. Guliya needs a loan in order to buy more livestock to increase headcount.

Gulnara is a mother of five children. Her husband is a construction worker. Gulnara is involved in animal husbandry. Her husband provided Gulnara with the starting capital and helped her in other ways in her new business. Gulnara is happy with her business and requested a loan in order to purchase a cow and then sell milk.

Myskal is forty-five. She is a widow and a mother of three children. Myskal makes a living from animal husbandry. She decided to get involved in this business on her own. None of her children help her with the business. Myskal decided to request a loan in order to purchase a bull, raise it and then sell it. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bulls for raising and future resale at a market, which would allow a purchase of soft furniture for home

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo C. has managed a typical retail store in his village for almost 10 years now. He has a daily net income of PHP 500. But that income is not enough for the daily needs of his family, especially now that two of his children are enrolled in college. He is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to improve his retail store. He plans to purchase more merchandise such as canned goods and soft drinks. Aside from his retail store, farming and rasing hogs provides additional income for their family.

He hopes that his requested loan will be granted. Marcelo is married to a vegetable vendor in their village and blessed with three children - Angielhea, age 21, is a teacher who is already married, Evangeline, age 19, is a third-year college student, and their youngest Jojo, age 18, is a second-year college student.

loans.use: To buy morel merchandise for his retail store.

loans.name: Kagongi Tukwatanise, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
N. Didas is a 24-year-old male and the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. Didas is married with one child and he takes care of two additional dependents, all of whom are in school. He has a retail shop. He has been a shopkeeper in Kagongi trading center for one year and so far he has been able to make some little profits that help him run his home.

This is his first loan with his lending group, and being loyal to his customers has done wonders for him. In future, Didas needs to turn the shop into a wholesale business so that he can make more money out of it. He also hopes for a stable and self-sustaining family. He needs a loan to help buy more stock for his shop to avoid shortages. He is a well-behaved and determined man with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
La socia MELCHORA es una humilD. madre D. familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”.    

La socia tiene 70 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos. Los hijos ya trabajan y son independientes. Nuestra socia vive en el distrito D. San Jerónimo en la comunidad D. Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur D. la ciudad del Cusco. La socia se dedica a la venta granos como cebada, trigo y maíz en el mercado “Vino Canchon” en el distrito D. San Jerónimo Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que va sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más menestras para luego vender. 


La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Melchora is a humble mother who is a member of the communal bank "Virgen Purificada - Angostura." Melchora is 70 years-old, widowed, and lives with her four children. Her children already work and are independent. Our member lives in the district of San Jerónimo in the community of Angostura, located south of the city of Cuzco. She works selling grains such as barley, wheat, and corn in the "Vino Canchon" market in the district of San Jerónimo. She has been working in this business for years and it has gone very well, thanks to all the effort she has invested in her work. Our member is a hard-working and enterprising mother that wants to get her family ahead. She needs this loan to buy more dried vegetables to later sell. Melchora is grateful for the opportunity offered by this institution and promises to make all payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dried vegetables for resale.

loans.name: José Isidro

texts.es: José Isidro D. de 47 años de edad, reside en el Caserío Las Flores en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos de 21, 17, 16, 14 y 12 años de edad. Como todo padre responsable ha sabido trabajar muy duro por darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, José cuenta con una carpintería la cual esta ubicada en el patio de su humilde casa, el trabaja por encargo y también elabora ciertas piezas de madera para poder ofrecer a las personas, su hijo mayor le ayuda en el negocio, lo cual alegra mucho a José ya que él espera que sus hijos hereden el negocio. José solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda tener la capacidad de comprar madera al por mayor, esto con fin de poder ofrecer más producto a las personas como roperos, mesas y otros elementos más, lo cual se vea reflejado en la economía familiar y le permita poder brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Isidro D., 47, lives in the Las Flores hamlet in Usulután department with his wife and 5 children, who are 21, 17, 16, 14, and 12 years of age respectively. As all responsible parents, he has worked very hard to provide for his children's needs. He has a carpintery shop in the yard of his humble house. He works based on prior orders but he also makes certain wood pieces to have on offer. His eldest son helps out in the shop, something that gladdens José very much, since he expects his sons to inherit the business. José requests funding so that he can buy lumber at wholesale so that he can have more products, like wardrobes, tables, etc. to offer people, the sales of which he hopes will increase his family's income so that he can offer his children the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El sr. Luis trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año 2005, es un cliente muy responsable, se dedica al rubro del transporte tiene su movilidad propia con la que trabaja como taxi, también trabaja en una orquesta(grupo musical) donde toca la batería, su orquesta es muy conocido por la zona, tiene su esposa que trabaja como tramitadora y sus hijos que están en colegio. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una cámara de eco y efectos para la orquesta y así mejorar la calidad de sonido.
texts.en:
Señor Luis has worked with our institution since the year 2005. He is a very responsible client. He is dedicated to providing public transportation. He has his own vehicle with which he works as a taxi driver. He also works in an band (musical group) where he plays the drums. His band is very well known in the area. His wife works as a clerk and his children attend school. The loan that he requests is to buy sound equipment for the band and thus to improve the quality of sound.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for his band.

loans.name: Djénèba

texts.fr:
Djénèba B. a 42 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses cinq enfants plus 8 enfants adoptifs, à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, elle s’est très vite initiée à l’activité d’achat et  de vente des  tubercules (Pomme de terre, patate, igname), de légumes, etc il y a maintenant vingt ans. Elle mène son activité au nouveau marché de Médine Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de quatre ans. 
Après 2 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 40 caisses de pomme de terre, en gros sur place auprès des producteurs venant à la foire. Elle effectue sa  vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle riche et variée.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djénèba B. is 42 years old and lives with her large family - her husband, five children and eight adopted children. They live in Hamdallaye, one of the popular quarters of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). Never having had the chance to go to school, she entered the business of buying and selling tubers (potatoes, sweet potatoes, yams), vegetables, and other items twenty years ago. She does her business at the new market of Médine Sikasso. Wanting to better satisfy her growing number of clients, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso over four years ago. After two group loans with an association of women from her village, she is on her second individual loan. All of her previous loans have been repaid in full. With this loan, she plans on buying 40 cases of potatoes from the wholesale distributors who sell at the fair. She does her sales at retail, in cash and credit, to a rich and varied clientele. Djénèbe plans on making a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which she will use to increase her commercial funds, contribute to her family's expenses, pay the interest on her loan, and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Potatoes

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny P. is 47 years old and she lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Trach P. wants to start a new business as a horse driver who resells coconuts door-to-door. In order to support her husband's business, Mrs. Ny P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse and a cart for this business. With this loan, she hopes to increase income and improve her family living. Mrs. Ny P. is a mother of five children, one of whom supports the father's business and another who is construction worker; two others are students in the local school, while the youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy a horse and cart for the business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 28-year-old farmer in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been running a mixed farm for the past six years. He is married with one child who is not yet of age to attend school. His primary income comes from the sale of milk and maize, but he also produces tomatoes and other vegetables with the assistance of one employee. At this time, Edwin says that climate issues such as a recent drought have been challenging to his business, along with other occasional problems of disease among livestock and difficulty marketing products.

Edwin successfully completed a recent loan with Juhudi Kilimo and he has now requested this loan for Kes. 30,000 to increase his stock of poultry and to build a new poultry house. He is confident that this project will generate steady income for himself and his family and he is looking to continually expand his operations in the coming years.

In the future, Edwin would like to become a large-scale supplier in his area. He also talked of a desire to attend training seminars in order to improve his poultry and dairy farming practices, if there is an opportunity to do so.

loans.use: To increase his stock of poultry

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
Erica forma parte del Banco Comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR” de la Asociación Arariwa, es natural de Quillabamba, tiene 30 años y es conviviente. Erica tiene dos hijos y ellos son: Ruth de 7 años y Junior de 4 años. Erica es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y se las ingenio para hacer su propio negocio de venta de verduras. 

Erica nos cuenta que lleva sus verduras de la ciudad del Cusco a otras ciudades como por ejemplo a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, Quillabamba y a la zona minera de Puerto Maldonado. La socia viaja los domingos en las noches al campamento minero de Puerto Maldonado para estar los días lunes, martes y miércoles en la feria del campamento donde ahí vende sus productos y los días jueves lleva sus productos a vender a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. Erica al regreso a la ciudad del Cusco de Puerto Maldonado no regresa con las manos vacías si no trae consigo productos como pallares, fréjoles, lentejas y soya y los vende en las ciudades del Cusco o Quillabamba.  Su esposo es chofer y maneja su camión donde llevan sus productos como por ejemplo zanahorias, cebollas, papas, etc. Erica requiere el préstamo para comprar menestras como por ejemplo pallares, fréjoles y lentejas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Erica is part of the Arariwa Association Communal Bank 'Working Together'. She is from Quillabamba, 30 years old, and lives with her partner. Erica has two children: Ruth who is 7 and Junior, 4 years old. Erica is a hard working, enterprising mother who helps her family get ahead, thinking of them as she started her own business selling vegetables. Erica tells us that she takes her vegetables from the city of Cusco to other cities, for example the city of Puerto Maldonado, Quillabamba, and the mining zone of Puerto Maldonado. This community bank member travels on Sunday at night to the mining camp of Puerto Maldonado in order to be there on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, in the market near the camp where she sells her products. On Thursday she takes her produce to sell in the city of Puerto Maldonado. Erica, on returning to the city of Cusco from Puerto Maldonado, does not return with empty hands. She brings products like butter beans, black beans, lentils, and soy beans and sells them in the cities of Cusco and Quillabamba. Her husband is in charge of driving the truck where they carry their products, such as carrots, onions, potatoes, etc. Erica needs a loan to buy more supplies such as butter beans, black beans, and lentils. This member is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and so has committed to comply with the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Erica requests the loan to buy supplies such as butter beans, black beans and lentils.

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Яхёев Одил проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Дети работают на стройке. Сам Одил занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Odil Y. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 50 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a secondary education. The children work at a construction site. Odil is involved in animal husbandry. He breeds livestock at home. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Afusat

texts.en:
Afusat is 38 years old, married with 4 children; they all live in Ibadan town in Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells medicine; she has been in this business for over 8 years and with LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. 

Afusat is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. 

Afusat would like to get a loan to purchase additional medicine and re-supply her inventory. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Abdumukhtor

texts.en: Abdumukhtor is married with two children. He is from Isfara in the southern part of Tajikistan. He sells foodstuffs in his grocery store. His merchandise is varied and of very good quality. He has been in this trade for almost 9 years. Abdumukhtor is very disciplined and responsible. He is thorough and his mind is very sharp – he can keep all his business details in his head. All these qualities have helped him to overcome many challenges that have come his way and allowed him to achieve success in business. Abdumukhtor has always sought to achieve economic freedom and independence. He is hoping this loan will help his venture to continue growing and to continue bringing him profit.
