More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please click here.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff to increase the product range

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: LA SRA. SONIA SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO DE ABARROTES Y CEREALES, LOS REPARTE A CREDITO EN DISTINTAS ZONAS DEL MERCADO, Y ADEMAS SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE PAN Y EMPANADAS QUE SON DISTRIBUIDOS EN LOS COLEGIOS DE LA ZONA, ELLA SE AYUDA CON ESO YA QUE LO QUE GANA SU MARIDO NO ES SUFICIENTE Y TIENE HIJOS EN LA UNIVERSIDAD QUE REPRESENTAN DEMASIADO GASTO, Y ELLA TIENE QUE DEDICARSE A DISTINTAS ACTIVIDADES PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, ES MUY TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE PENSANDO EN EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO DESES COMPRAR HARINA AL POR MAYOR PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS PANES Y TORTAS, TENDRA MUCHO TRABAJO YA QUE SE ACERCA EL DIA DE LA MADRE Y TIENE MUCHOS PEDIDOS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN AL OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sonia is dedicated to selling groceries and cereals. She deals on credit in different ares of the market. In addition, she is dedicated to making bread and empanadas that are distributed to the schools in the area. She helps since what her husband earns isn't enough and she has children at university which is expensive. She has to dedicate herself to different activities to help her husband with the bills. She is very hard-working, always thinking of the well-being of her family. With the money from the loan, she wishes to buy flour at wholesale to make bread and cakes. She will have a lot of work since mother's day is approaching and she has many orders. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided with the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane D. habite dans le quartier de Ndiobene à Guediawaye. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis décembre  2007 et a déjà solde 3 prêts  antérieurs. Il est marie et père d’un  enfant âgé  de 2 ans. Il supporte aussi la charge de deux autres personnes. Monsieur D. est un agent administratif au ministère de l’environnement mais  il pratique aussi parallèlement l’élevage  de moutons vu que ses parents ont été  éleveurs  et vendeurs  de bétails  a la Seras dans le passe. Il trouve surtout son compte dans cette activité lors des événements  de Tabaski. Il emprunte 200 000 frs pour acheter de l’aliment de bétail pour nourrir son troupeau.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane D. lives in the Ndiobene district in Guediawaye. He has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since December 2007 and has already repaid three previous loans. He is married and the father of a 2-year-old child. He also supports two other people. Mr. D. is a representative at the ministry of the environment, but he also raises sheep, given that his parents have been livestock farmers and merchants at SERAS in the past. He derives a benefit from this business particularly at Tabaski events. He is borrowing 200,000 francs for buying fodder to feed his herd.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting his working capital

loans.name: Faith In Action Group

texts.en:
Stanley G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Faith In Action. 

He is 52 years old, married and has five children who range from 7 to 25 years old. He was only able to attend school to 11th grade due to poverty. His children are all attending school. He cares for two siblings. 

For 5 years, he has been involved with crushing and selling crushed rocks in the ELWA Rock Hill community, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 12,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 52,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more rock crushing tools such as shovels, diggers and used tires. He describes himself as a hard-working man.

His dream is to expand his business and to venture into a petroleum business.

loans.use: To buy more rock crushing tools such as shovels, diggers and used tires.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 33 years old and lives with her husband and four children in an area called Gandheyan autad, which is situated in a town called Kot Radha kishan and which is famous for its dairy business. This town is about 15 km from Riwind.  

Rehana's husband, L. A., is 31 years old. He is a very determined person. He not only takes care of their buffalo but he also sells their milk. He has knowledge of animal breeds, and is able to advise the people of his community. They come to him asking about taking care of their animals as well. He always welcomes them because he is very supportive towards his neighbors, and most of all because he is a good human being.
 
Rehana is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah to invest the loan amount in their family business. With the loan they will buy another buffalo and expand their milk-selling business.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for their milk-selling business

loans.name: Agip Womens Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Fifteen years is the time frame that 32-year-old Harriet N. has spent running her salon business in Seeta-Mukono. She was at first into a clothes-selling business. With determination in tow, she fought against all odds to earn her stripes in a business which was increasingly becoming more competitive by the day. 

With the passage of time, she drew up other blueprint plans to obtain a footing in her current business. Profits from this business and her other subsidiary rental business have empowered her in the provision of care and financial support to her family of six. 

At 32, she is happily married and she says her future prospects are good on the basis of the support her spouse gives her. In a week, she makes profits that add to 170,000 shillings. With this loan, she says she wants to purchase another dryer.

loans.use: The purchase of a dryer

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
Mario Jose C. M., tiene 31 años.  Es soltero y vive con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo, Magnolia.

Maria  es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y las vende en la misma localidad a precios muy convenientes.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra semillas de  arroz, maíz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar una casa y un carro para su familia. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.

Le gusta trabajar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Mario Jose C. M. is 31 years old. He is single and lives with his daughter. He lives in Ventanas, Los Ríos province. He has one daughter Magnolia. Mario is a member of the rural community bank “Valle Alto”, which is located in the Voluntad de Dios community an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total and the majority work in agriculture. This is the second loan that they have taken out in the San José cooperative. Mario works in agriculture. He plants rice, corn and beans. He makes her purchases ever month in the city of Ventanas at Fertiza and he sells at the same place at very advantageous prices. He is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of rice, corn and bean seed. He thinks that the loan is a chance to get ahead. His dreams are to buy a house and a car for his family. He faces challenges such as pests. He likes to work and do sports.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, corn and bean seed

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya A. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ligaya owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Ligaya has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ligaya joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ligaya is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ligaya from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julieta David

texts.pt:
Julieta David C. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 6 filhos, destes 4 vão a Escola. Não freqüentou a escola os pais na altura priorizavam a machamba e pastagens de gado. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e tem ajudado seus irmãos em algumas despesas alimentares.

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, trabalha na machamba como agricultor com o seu marido como base de sustentabilidade da família. O marido recebe uma pensão de desmobilizado no valor de 5.159.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua casa.
 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.300.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, arame, chapas de zinco e outros) para iniciar a sua obra de construção da sua residência.
 
No futuro gostaria de pedir um novo empréstimo para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa para sair das condições em que vive atualmente.
texts.en:
Julieta David C. was born in the Boane district, in the Maputo province, which is in the south of Mozambique. She is the mother of 6 children, of whom 4 attend school. She did not attend school, as at that point her parents prioritized their machamba (small agricultural field) and cattle pasture. She lives in her own home with her family and they are helping her siblings with a few expenses.

She has never left her native land. She has worked in her machamba as a farmer with her husband to support their family. Her husband receives a military pension in the amount of 5,159MT, which they use to pay for household expenses and to save from time to time.

She has never taken a loan from another bank. She learned of Hluvuku through some neighbors who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan, for the amount of 10,300MT, which she will use to buy construction materials (iron, cement, wire, zinc plates, etc.) to begin construction on her home.

In the future, she would like to seek additional loans to continue construction on her home to improve the living conditions for her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (iron, cement, wire, zinc plates, etc.)

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
Don José  Daniel,habita en la Comarca El Camastro, jurisdiccion de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa la Sra. Maritza Padilla y sus hijos los cuales le apoyan con el trabajo de su pequeña finca de 55 Mzs la cual presenta buenas condiciones técnicas, donde también realiza manejo sanitario y nutricional, lo cual le ayuda al desarrollo del hato ganadero.  

Esta solicitando su 3er crédito con el objetivo de comprar de 6 terneros con un peso promedio de 255 kilo, los cuales cuidara y engordara hasta que obtengan el peso deseado para venderlos y obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de su familia.  Ademas  recibe ingreso adicionales por la comercializacion de queso y productos de cultivos de granos basicos. José Daniel se caracteriza en su comunidad por ser  trabajador, responsable, con gran liderazgo en la comarca y por tener principios religiosos.
texts.en:
José Daniel lives in habita en El Camastr comarca, a jurisdiction New Guinea. He lives with his family made up of his wife, Mrs.Maritza Padilla, and their children who support him with the work on the small farm of 78.65 acres. His farm has good technical conditions. He manages sanitation and nutrition, which helps in the development of the cattle herd. He is asking for his third loan with the objective of buying 6 calves with an average weight of 255 kilos. He will car for them and fatten them up until they reach the desired weight for sale in order to make a profit and improve his family's lifestyle. He also receives additional income by selling cheese and basic grain crops. José Daniel is characterized in his community as being hard working and responsible with great leadership in the comarca, as well as having religios principles.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma S., 48. She is a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Cancio S., a driver, and the mother of four children, one of whom is already working, while two are in high school. The youngest is currently enrolled in elementary school. By the grace of God, Emma has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college - a dream for most Filipino parents like Emma as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Emma maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Emma dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes that she will be able to recruit many more women like her to her business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members* to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy orders for her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Nuruypa

texts.en:
Nuruypa A. is married and lives in Vozesenovka village with her family. She was born in a large family of farmers and from early childhood was engaged in looking after cattle.  She graduated from medical college and worked as a nurse at the local hospital. In 1994, Nuruypa got married and soon gave a birth to two children. In order to find additional means of subsistence for her family, she decided to begin her business in cattle breeding. Owing to wide experience in this activity, Nuruypa managed to maintain the farm with two milk cows, two calves, one bull and five sheep.   In order to enlarge the number of cattle, she obtained two loans from Bai Tushum and repaid them without any delays. With the revenues, Nuruypa was able to reconstruct one of the rooms in her house into a small shop with groceries and to buy a used car for the family The car was  then adapted to taxi transportations by her husband. Unfortunately, in 2009, her husband met with a car accident and needed expensive medical treatment, which was paid through selling cattle. 

Now Nuruypa is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy tree bull-calves and purchase goods to enlarge inventory in her shop. Nuruypa is optimistic woman and believes that her tireless efforts will lead her family to a new prosperous life.  
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and supplies

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; tiene 39 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía y también trabaja en el sector educación en la parte administrativa y la artesanía lo vende en forma independiente, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de artesanía. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas, mantas, chalinas y pantalones.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the "Los Lideres" (Leaders) Community Bank. The bank is located in the Cuzco district in the province of Cuzco.

Mrs. Luz Marina is 39 years old, married, and has two children. She alternates her daily work between working in handicrafts and in education administration. She sells her handicrafts independently and wants to improve this business. She is asking for a loan to buy handicrafts such as sweaters, blankets, shawls and pants.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, blankets, shawls, and pants.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a kiosk (retail shop) for the past three years, selling from home to her local community. Janet faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop and open a beauty shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase paraffin, bundles of maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase paraffin, bundles of maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora M. is from the city of Macupa Tangub City. She is 61 years old. Dioscora is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Dioscora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Dioscora has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dioscora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dioscora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Dioscora is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dioscora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rosa Alcira

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo.

La señora Rosa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta todo del Banco, sobre todo por la ayuda que brinda la institución a personas que quieren salir adelante con sus negocios. Tiene 65 años de edad, es madre soltera pero  de una  relación que tuvo hace muchos años tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, ella vive en la casa de una de sus hijas rodeada del cariño de su hija y dos nietas.

Se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de productos naturales de la marca Nature Garden. Trabaja tres días a la semana por las tardes unas tres a cuatro horas por dia, los productos que mas vende son los multivitaminicos, hepalive, gel Garden, vitatoro y otros, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos, vitaminas, hepalive entre otros. Sus sueños son ver que su familia este bien y que sean felices.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city with green mountains and alluring landscapes, we find the place where the members of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank meet every two weeks.

Mrs. Rosa is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she enjoys everything about it, especially the help that the institution gives to people which helps them prosper in their businesses. She is 65 years old, is a single mother but from a relationship that she had many years ago, she has 6 children who are grownup, she lives with one of her daughters, it is a home that is filled with her daughter and granddaughters’ love.

Mrs. Rosa sells natural products of the Nature Garden brand. She works three days a week in the evenings, some three to four hours per day, the products that she sells most are multivitamins, hepalive, gel Garden, vitatoro, and others, she leaves her products on credit and collects every two weeks.

This loan is to buy more products, vitamins, hepalive among others. Mrs. Rosa’s dreams are to see that her family is well and happy.

loans.use: To buy multivitamins, hepalive, gel garden, vitatoro, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. K. is 56 years old, married, and supporting a family of four children. Jane is a quarry miner and works on her own piece of land.  She has been quarrying for the last ten years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET who live in her area of residence. This will be her second loan.  She is planning to use it to buy more quarry tools and to hire more manpower. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her business.

Jane’s dream is to be rich and successful in life and to provide a better future for her children. She is a meticulous woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To buy more quarry tools and hire labor

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a resident of Nyamira Town in Western Kenya. She is married with five children, aged between fifteen and two – four of them are now in school. She has been doing mixed farming for twelve years, selling her produce of maize, beans, sorghum and tea at the local market.

She has requested a loan of KES 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She believes this loan will generate enough income to pay for the education of her children as well as improve their living standards. She is optimistic she will be able to buy more dairy cows and start a wholesale business in the future. Her challenges in business are fluctuating market prices and hailstorms which destroy the crops before harvest.

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel   G. C. de 48 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador en donde vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos los cuales dependen de él.  Manuel comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, jugos, leche, huevos y otros más. Desde hace tres años que  posee este tipo de negocio el cual nació por la necesidad de poder contar con una fuente de ingresos fijos, la cual le permitiera contar con todo lo necesario para vivir de una manera aceptable. Manuel solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando productos como: embutidos, sodas, medicinas y otros productos más los cuales son de mucha  necesidad y que hasta ahora no poseía, razón por la cual perdía algunas ventas. Para él es de mucha importancia poder mejorar su negocio, ya que de esta manera podrá tener una vida mejor.
texts.en: Manuel is 48 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with his wife and two children, who are dependent on him. Manuel sells products of primary need such as bread, juices, milk, eggs and many others. For the past three years he has had this business, which started out of the necessity to have a fixed source of income, and it has allowed him to have everything he needs to live in an acceptable way. Manuel is requesting the loan so he can invest in his business by purchasing products like sausages, sodas, medicines and other products of high necessity that until now he has not possessed, which has cost him some sales. It is very important to Manuel to be able to improve his business since in that way he will be able to have a better life.

loans.use: Purchase primary-need items

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is currently in the business of selling buns and alcohol. She is 28 years old, married, with one child who does not go to school. Joyce took out a loan to stock more buns and alcohol to sell. In the future, Joyce hopes to buy land with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more buns and alcohol to sell

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo qui toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers de boutique, de charbon de bois et de céréales.                                                                                                  
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire et tous les quinze prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                         
M’PENE F. compte acheter des articles divers de boutique avec les revendeurs du marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement sur place dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce d’articles de boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the Djekafo group are all married women, averaging 42 years of age, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, Subprefecture of Fana, Koulikoor Region (The second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell various everyday needs items as well as charcoal and cereals. The members of the Djekafo group are on their 16th solidarity loan; all 15 prior loans have been well repaid.

M’pene F. plans to purchase every day needs article from vendors at the Fana market. She sells daily out of her home in the village, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 35,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay the loan, cover the costs of her participation in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase everyday needs items

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Rehema has a small retail shop, which she has had for four years.  She also has a second business selling tap water.  

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as rice for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rehema hopes to generate greater profits and pay her own school fees.  In the future, Rehema hopes to own a restaurant.  

Rehema is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to improve her business and increase her capital.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as rice for resale.

loans.name: Agoba Obwavu Women's Group

texts.en:
32-year-old Hajara N. is a happily married mother of four. She has been a member of Agoba Obwavu Women's Group, Lugazi for seven years now. All this while she has been in charge of a poultry sales business in Nkonkonjeru, which she says she began after she gave up her agricultural business. Hajara says one of her closest friends inspired her to begin this business. Hajara also has a small hotel business.

Hajara says she is going to use this loan to purchase more chickens to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more poultry to resell

loans.name: Belek

texts.en:
Belek A. is a 60-year-old farmer who lives with his family in Cholok-Aryk village. 

As he has been engaged in cattle breeding for the last 30 years and has a wide experience in this activity, he has managed to maintain the farm successfully with a monthly profit of 8.000 KGS. With the revenues, he was able to pay for the education of his children. 

Today he has two horses, three bull calves and two heifers at his farm, which still needs to be developed. For this reason, Belek has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase one milk cow and fifteen sheep. This will allow him to further broaden his business and in the future, to buy a car. 

 Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Adonaldo

texts.es:
Adonaldo, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Ruth de 6 años y Daniel de 3 años de edad, él se dedica a la panadería, desde hace 5 años trabaja haciendo pan, asistió a clases para aprender a hacer pan, el horario  es de 4:00am a 6:00 pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina, azúcar, huevos, levadura, entre otros insumos necesarios, con esta inversión ampliara su producción y la diversificara.
Los sueños de Adonaldo, es seguir en su panadería, tener financiamientos para potenciar el negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Adonaldo lives in Corinto, in Morazán department, together with his wife and two children: 6 year-old Ruth and 3 year-old Daniel.  He owns a bakery and has been making bread for five years.  He attended classes in order to learn how to make bread and works from 4.00am to 6.00pm.

Adonaldo is currently requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, eggs, yeast and other supplies that he needs.  This investment will enable him to expand and diversify his production.

Adonaldo's dreams are to continue working in his bakery, to have access to the funding he needs to boost his business, and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs and yeast

loans.name: Yina María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora  Yina, ella tiene 29 años de edad está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 11, 8, 7 y 4 años, el mayor este año empezó el colegio, los dos siguientes están en escuela y el menor este año ingreso al jardín de infantes. Su marido es mecánico. Está en el Banco Comunal desde del inicio hace cuatro ciclos y  le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudar a su esposo con el negocio en el cual ella también labora.

Tienen un taller de mecánica automotriz en el que realizan muchos trabajos, además también  venden repuestos, llantas, lubricantes, aceites y otras refacciones. Laboran de lunes a sábado desde las 7h30 hasta las 18h00, trabajan con la ayuda de dos operarios, mientras su esposo se encarga de los trabajos de mecánica ella se encarga de la contabilidad, compra y venta de los repuestos. Nos cuenta que llevan en este negocio 9 años y que aunque al principio fue duro con el tiempo han conseguido muchos clientes que los prefieren por su trabajo y responsabilidad. Nos cuenta que muchas veces tienen que salir para hacer sus trabajos fuera de la ciudad.

Este crédito lo va en empleara en comprar aceite, repuestos, filtros, llantas, entre otros productos.
 
Sus metas son ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, rich cuisine and for the warmth of its people, the "Marianita de Jesús" communal bank meets every two weeks.

We met Yina, 29, here.  She’s married and has four children who are 11, 8, 7 and 4 years of age.  The oldest started secondary school this year, the next two are in elementary school and the youngest started Kindergarten this year.  Her husband is a Mechanic.  She’s been in the communal bank since four cycles ago and she likes it because with the loans she’s been able to help her husband with his business where she now works too.

They have an auto repair shop where they do all kinds of jobs.  They also sell spare parts: tires, lubricants, oil and other parts.  They work Monday through Saturday from 7:30am until 6pm; they have two employees.  While her husband does the mechanical work she handles the bookkeeping, purchasing and spare parts sales.  She tells us that they’ve been in business 9 years and, although it was difficult at first, they’ve managed to secure many customers who prefer them for their work and responsibility.  She tells us that often they have jobs to do outside the city.

She will use this loan to buy oil, spare parts, filters and tires, among other products.  Her goal is to enlarge the business.

loans.use: to buy lubricants, spare parts, filters, tires, etc.

loans.name: Heom

texts.en:
Heom, 48 years old, is a humble father who has five children. Three of them are single and attend school and the other two are married. His is a garment factory worker in the Reussey Keo commune. 

Heom is a cow trader. He buys animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. As the selling-animal business is the main source of revenue for this family, Heom requested a loan of $1,100 as capital to purchase an additional cow for selling.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow for selling.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza is from the village of Gharibjanyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with a fourteen-year-old daughter and a sixteen-year-old son.  Tereza has a high school education and has been engaged in farming for the past eighteen years.  In addition to supporting her family she helps relatives living in the city with agricultural products grown on the family farm.  Tereza is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by twenty percent.  It is Tereza’s dream for both of her children to receive a university education, and she is saving some of the income from her farming business.  She enjoys living in Gharibjanyan surrounded by family and friends.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 26 years old.

Ana is a farmer working in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She primarily grows rice to sell. Ana earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. She works hard to improve her business and earnings for the family. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ana hopes to earn better and be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is 33 years old. He is an aggressive, hardworking and focused businessman. He is married and blessed with two children aged eight and two. He has been offering bureau services to make a living for the last five years. He wants in the next five years to have moved to a bigger premise and employed more personnel. His dream is to have a printing firm. 

He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to upgrade the internet and buy printing papers and cartridges. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has now developed a saving culture and become wiser in transacting business.

loans.use: to upgrade his internet service and to buy printing papers and cartridges

loans.name: Khaukharkul

texts.ru:
Хаухуркул 52 года, замужем, имеет троих детей. Хаухуркул  и ее супруг – врачи: они работают в больнице села Чаек и пользуются авторитетом и уважением среди сельчан. Так как зарплата врачей не высока,  Хаухуркул решила параллельно с основной профессией, заняться бизнесом в откорме и реализации скота.  Начав со стартовым капиталом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS), она добилась успеха – на сегодняшнмй день ферма Хаухуркул насчитывает 4 коровы, 2 кобылы, 45 голов овец и 20 голов коз. 
Для дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Хаухуркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)для покупки овец и бычков.   Доходы от деятельности в этом году она планирует потратить на ремонт дома. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Khaukharkul is 52 years old, married, and has three children. Khaukharkull and her husband are doctors. They work in the hospital in the village of Gull, and they enjoy prestige and respect among the villagers. Since doctors' salary is not high, Khaukharkull also works fattening livestock. Since starting with seed capital of 15,000 Som (KGS), she has succeeded.  Now, Khaukharkul's farm has four cows, two mares, forty-five sheep and twenty goats. 

To further develop her business, Khaukharkul contacted Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and calves. She plans to spend the revenues from this year on home repairs. 

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Yonson

texts.es: Yonson, de 22 años, es un hombre trabajador; conformó su familia hace un año. Vive con su esposa e hija en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de Purhuaracra. Su vida dio un cambió drástico, pues ahora tiene que ver por su familia, que es su principal motor. Su principal trabajo es la confección de polos de diferentes colores y tamaños; su trabajo consiste en coser las prendas en un taller textil que se sitúa en la capital del país. Después de 2 meses regresa a visitar a su familia, le es muy difícil estar lejos de ellos, pero saber que le brinda toda lo necesario, le da fuerzas para continuar. Además se siente contento con el apoyo de su esposa, quien le ayuda económicamente en el oficio de “la agricultura”, en terrenos alquilados siembra papa y una variedad de hortalizas como espinaca, lechuga y demás; de acuerdo a temporadas. Los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación, pero como se encuentra sola, comercializa sus cosechas a los intermediarios que visitan sus terrenos agrícolas, ya que no puede llevarlos al mercado mayorista de su ciudad. El principal proyecto de esta pareja es, comprar su propia casa. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Productores de purhuaracra” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para seguir con sus planes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Yonson de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus sembríos de papa de la variedad “yungay”.
texts.en: Twenty-two-year-old Yonson is a hardworking man who started a family one year ago.  He lives with his wife and daughter in a rented house in the neighborhood of Purhuaracra.  His life has changed drastically now that he has to take care of his family, which is what drives him most.  His main job is making polo shirts in different colors and sizes; his job consists of sewing the garments in a textile factory in the country's capital.  After two months he is able to return to visit his family.  It is very hard for him to be away from them, but the knowledge that it provides everything they need gives him the strength to carry on.  He is also happy to have the support of his wife, who helps him economically through farming on rented land.  She grows potatoes and a variety of vegetables such as spinach, lettuce, and others according to the season.  She looks after her crops with a lot of dedication, but as she is on her own, she sells her produce to the middle men who visit her farmland, since she can't take them to the city's wholesale market.  This couple's main goal is to buy their own home.  He belongs to the Productores de Puhuaracra Communal Bank and this is his second loan with MFP, where he is currently awaiting a small loan to continue his plans.  He promises to make his payments punctually.  If he were to receive your help, Yonson would invest the loan money in purchasing natural fertilizers to spread in the "yungay" variety of his potato crops.

loans.use: To buy bags of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy precious stones, fine silver, Swarovski crystal, and other items for making jewelry.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace 3 años inicio con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada  donde ofrece variedad de artículos como lo es ropa en diferentes tallas, zapatos, calcetines, zapatos. 
En este momento el desea invertir en su negocio para compra de mercancía como lo es ropa de temporada ya que la gente ya comienza a buscar la ropa de frio, Patricia sabe que si su negocio cuenta con mayor variedad de artículos sus ventas son mas altas y de esta manera obtendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Patricia is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Three years ago she began a business of selling used clothing and she offers a variety of clothing in various sizes, and shoes and socks.

At this time she wants to invest in her business and she is asking for a loan in order to buy goods such as seasonal apparel because people are already beginning to look for cold weather clothing. Patricia knows that the more variety of items she offers, the greater her sales will be and in this way she will have a better income.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for her business

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 33, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sophal sells groceries, earning an income of $5 USD per day. Her husband is a local police officer, earning an income of $3.5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. 
Each month, the family has to spend $50 USD on food and $25 USD on other necessary expenses. Sophal is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more groceries items to stock her store. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to stock her store.

loans.name: Abuzuzanya Group

texts.fr:
Florent fait partie du groupe Abuzuzanya. Le nom du groupe signifie «fulness together ». Il a 43 ans et il est marié avec 8 enfants de 2 à 17 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  8 ans de primaire.

Florent est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des fertilisants et la semence sélectionner. Dans les prochaines années, Florent voudrait vendre beaucoup la production récolte dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Florent is a member of the Abuzuzanya group.  The group's name means 'Fullness Together'.  Florent is 43 years old, married, and has eight children between 2 and 17 years of age.  Four of his children are in school.  Florent studied for eight years at primary school.

Florent is a rice grower.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop.

Florent's strategy for growing his business is to use fertilizers and selected seeds.  In the coming years, he would like to sell a lot of the harvested crops in his region.  With the profits he makes, he plans to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop

loans.name: Rosas Lindas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS LINDAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maribel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de DVD’s, venta de chompas, venta de rellenos, venta de salchipapas, venta de dulces, venta de calzados, carniceria. 

La señora Maribel  indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción y de sus vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que trabaja hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de dulces, masitas, refrescos, etc.), que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo comercializa en el puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es divorciada y tiene y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con el grupo la capacitación de salud y de crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ROSAS LINDAS”  ("Beautiful Roses") is starting their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Center.  The group is made up of eight members, and is led by a board of directors headed by Señora Maribel.  The members of the communal bank are progressing various businesses, including DVD sales, sweater sales, stuffed chilli pepper sales, hot dog and fries sales, confectionery sales, shoe sales, and a butcher shop.

Señora Maribel tells that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago at the invitation of the promoter and her neighbors.  She currently has a business which is a neighborhood store; she has been working here for years.

The loan that she is now looking for is to expand her merchandise (purchase confectionery, pastries, sodas, etc.) which she will purchase at the markets and later sell at her sales location.  This form of work will allow her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, as she is divorced and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys sharing the trainings on health and loans with her group.

loans.use: to buy confectionery, pastries, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 23-year-old married lady. She lives with her two kids and husband who is a police officer.

Aya is known for her artistic talent in making crafts like arranging fake flowers, and antiques, but especially embroidery. As shown in the picture, Aya does embroidery as mirror frames, tray bottoms, and different types of covers and wall hangings.

It has been two years since she started to sell what she makes and add another source of income to the family.

Now Aya has applied for a loan to buy more embroidery materiA. to make more pieces of art to sell, and look for the opportunity to participate in locA. exhibitions if she can.

loans.use: to buy more embroidery material

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар много лет занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и откормом скота. Она любящая мать и жена. Она вместе с мужем и со своим сыном работают на земле. Труд приносит хорошие доходы. Они выращивают  пшеницу, ячмень и лук. Отходами вскармливают скот. Она хочет получить займ в размере 10000 сомони для покупки скота и зерновых. Она надеется на получение займа и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Munavvar has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock for many years.  She is a loving mother and wife.  Munavvar, her husband and son work on the land.  This work brings in a good income.  They grow wheat, barley and onions, and use the crop residue to feed the livestock.  Munavvar wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10 000 somoni for the purchase livestock and cereal crops.  She hopes to get this loan and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock and cereal crops

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a humble farmer from Roma Norte Enrile in the province of Cagayan. He is married to a housewife, and Jose is now 42 years of age. They were blessed with two children whom he sends to school. He owns a hectare plot of land which he plants and cultivates with rice to merchandise. This is Jose's primary source of income. He usually acquires a net income of P20,000 each harvest season, during the months of April and November.

Now, Jose is borrowing a loan amount of P12,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides in order to maintain good crops from his farm. In the future, he aims to alleviate his family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Gloria Lisett

texts.es: La señora Gloria , no le fue muy bien con su antiguo negocio , ya que estos productos de alimentación son muy caros para el sector que ella estaba atendiendo , lo cual tuvo que tomar una decisión y no venderlo más , ahora ella se dedica a lo que es venta de ropa , zapatos , comenticos , bisutería ya que su mama le apoyo con un espacio dentro de la pulpería, para que se apoyara ella y sus hijas , ya que es su mayor fuente de ingresos , ahora Gloria enfrenta una situación difícil ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la inversión del muro de su hogar ya que por no tener mucha seguridad ingresaron a su casa delincuentes para robar , pero gracias a la ayuda de vecino que la acudieron no se llevaron nada . El crédito lo quiere para la compra de piedras canteras, cemento y hierro para realizar el muro de su vivienda.
texts.en:
It did not go very well for Gloria with her previous business [Herbalife products].  These nutritional products are very expensive for the sector she was serving, so she had to make the decision to stop selling them.  Now she works selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.  Her mother helped her with a space inside her grocery store so that Gloria could support herself and her children, since it is her major source of income.

Now Gloria is facing a difficult situation since she does not have sufficient capital to invest in the wall for her home.  Since there is not a lot of security, criminals came into her house to rob them.  They didn't take anything with them, though, thanks to the help of a neighbor who came to her aid.

She wants the loan to buy quarry stone, cement, and metal to make the wall for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a teacher by profession in Kyenjojo and also a business man at that selling produce for profits.

He took stock of this predicament as a simple salary earner and started up his own business with the hope that it would do him and his family of four a great deal of good. It was at the threshold of 2009 that he took root in his food sales trade.

The income he generates from selling foods such as maize, groundnuts and coffee has brought forth a new lease in his and his family's circumstances. He says he wasn't able to make the kind of leaps and bounds progression he is making now on his teacher's salary. What he earns in a month , UGX 150,000,as profit is of great benefit to his business, life and family. So for Stephen, laying great store on this business is worthwhile and understandable.

He says he will use his loan to purchase more maize, groundnuts and coffee to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, groundnuts, and coffee to resell.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en: Sokhim, 29, is married and resides with her husband and son in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She is a farmer. Her husband is an ice cream vendor who carries ice cream to sell around the village and market. Sokhim is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to increase capital in her husband's business in order to run an ice cream store at home. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her son to study until he gets a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to increase capital in her husband's business in order to run an ice cream store at home

loans.name: Urbanos

texts.en:
Urbanos is 42 years old, married, and has three children aged four, 11, and 15. He sells shoes to earn a living, a business he has done for seven years. He also does farming. He describes his business environment as competitive due to the existence of many people doing the same type of business. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income. He hopes to educate his children and expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Quelita

texts.es: Quelita, de 53 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Cesar quien es agricultor, fruto de ésta unión tiene 04 hermosos hijos de 22, 21, 20 y 14 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Quelita es la venta de abarrotes para eso cuenta con un bodega instalada en su propia casa, desde donde atiende a su clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, iniciando hace 06 años por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional. Éste negocio no fue posible gracias a un préstamo más un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros que los utilizó para montar su tienda, y con el tiempo ha crecido y captado muchos clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite   estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico, además del tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en otras actividades  y el cuidado de su hogar. Por lo contrario no le gusta cuando sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras pues comenta ya tuvo malas experiencias con este tipo de venta pues no le pagaron los créditos, por eso ahora se niega a realizar este tipo de venta y todo lo vende al contado, y ve que tiene mejores resultados. Tiene planes de seguir creciendo y ampliando su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor buscando los mejores precios y más bajos para así obtener mejores ganancias, además como juguetes para ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Quelita, 53, is a hard-working woman who is determined to get ahead.  Her common-law husband, Cesar, is a farmer and they have four beautiful children, ages 22, 21, 20 and 14, who they love very much.  They live comfortably in their own home.  Quelita sells groceries out of a store set up in her house.  Here she attends to her customers, the majority of whom are neighbors.  She started the business to make extra income and has been in it now for six years.  With the help of a loan and her own savings she was able to set up the store and over time has grown and attraced many customers.

She enjoys her work because it allows her to be at home and have an income while also having free time for other activities and housework.  What she does not like so much is when customers ask for credit for their purchases since she has had several bad experiences.  So now she sells everything on a cash basis which gives her better results.  

She plans to continue growing and expanding the business.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial support so she can carry out her plans.  She likes her communal bank and knows all the members, who she considers to be responsible, supportive people.  The 1,200 PEN loan will be used to buy wholesale groceries, at the best prices possible, in order to improve earnings.  She will also buy toys for this Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Pedro Jesus

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 29 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Computación e Informática, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones come unos riquísimos Pallares con Seco, el cual es su plato favorito.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Pedro trabaja brindado servicios de seguridad como Serenasgo, él puede trabajar una aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de una pequeña habitación en la vivienda de sus padres, ya que ellos le dejaron como herencia un pequeño terreno en su hogar, así pues de esta manera Pedro podrá iniciar la construcción de lo que en un futuro no muy lejano será su hogar; Pedro espera poder seguir trabajando y esforzándose a fin de lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional y tener su propia familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 29 years old and unmarried. He lives in the city of Ica. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Thanks to his effort, he was able to study a technical degree in computing and informatics. 

In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends, and occasionally he eats a delicious dish called Pallares con Seco (a Peruvian dish made with lima beans), his favorite food.

With plenty of effort and dedication, Pedro works day in and day out offering his services as a security guard. He works for about 12 hours per day. He believes that the job is going well, thanks to his responsibility and for the friendly service he offers to others.

Pedro is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to carry out the construction of a small bedroom in his parents' home. They left a small area of their home to him as an inheritance, so Pedro will now be able to begin construction on what in the not-so-distant future will be his home.

Pedro hopes to continue working and striving to make his greatest dream come true: to study a professional degree and have his own family.

loans.use: to carry out improvements to his home.

loans.name: Argi

texts.en:
Argi is the son of a KOMIDA member. He is a student in Al-hasyimiyyah Vocational High School.

His parents became a Komida client and they are getting a loan to pay the costs for their son to take the national examination. Now, because of the loan, Rgi can continue in school.

loans.use: To pay the costs to take the National Examination

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a clothes saleswoman. She mainly sells to the people in her community, including much of her family and friends. She buys the clothes from a wholesale distributor who asks for 50% of the price of the clothes up front. Once she sells she finishes paying the orders off and she invests in new products. She needs the loan in order to buy clothes and toys for the holiday season.

Martha is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is a construction worker who is very dedicated to his family. Recently one of their daughters fell 4 meters and fractured her skull. Although she is almost fully recuperated, it was a difficult financial and emotional burden on the family. They are currently building their home in a piece of land given to them by Martha’s mother in law.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to buy clothes and toys for the holiday season.

loans.name: Ipat

texts.en: Ipat is a 35 year old mother of four children. The eldest works in a factory nearby and he often gives her some money. She and her husband, Mamet, have two businesses which are making doormats out of fabric remnants, and selling household goods like dishes, pans and woks on credit. She sells her products in her village and collects the payments every week. She wants to get this loan to expand her businesses.

loans.use: Capital to expand her business

loans.name: Jane Nasike

texts.en: Jane is married with five children, all in primary school.  She has not undertaken any formal training.  Her husband is a company employee.  She started her business in 1992 in order to supplement her husband’s income.  Her business includes selling green vegetables, particularly the ones in season.  She buys in bulk and sells both in wholesale and retail. With a loan from PEMCI, Jane intends to increase her stock in order to improve her profits.  Through her business, Jane has been able to help her husband in educating their children, provide them with some basic family needs, and also develop their farm.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Business Description

Maria serves snacks, lunch and a la carte entrees in her restaurant. She started this business when she immigrated from Colombia in search of a better life. With her husband's help, she has been successful in Ecuador and runs a business that continues to grow each day. She has also added a pay phone booth at the same location.

Loan Use

She needs this loan to expand the size of her restaurant and make improvements to the space, which will allow her to better serve her growing clientele.

Personal Information

Maria is 49 years old and has three children who are students. Her house is made of cement. Her husband helps her around the house and they enjoy a stable family life.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Maria tienen a la venta almuerzos meriendas, platos a la carta. Empezó este negocio cuando inmigro desde Colombia para mejorar sus situación, con la ayuda de su esposo ha logrado superarse en Ecuador y tener un negocio que cada día crece mas por la excelente sazón que ella tiene. Además ha incorporado locutorio que administra junto a su restaurante

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para hacer adecuaciones en su restaurante porque como ahora tiene mas clientela ella ya no tiene espacio suficiente para atenderlos de buena manera por lo que necesita ampliar el local.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 49 años y tres hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento su esposo le ayuda en la casa y tiene estabilidad familiar

loans.use: To expand and make improvements to her restaurant

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa, 46, married with 4 children, is from the village of Saletele Fagaloa. Here, she is pictured making “afa” one of the main materials used for producing handicrafts. Handicraft production has become the main source of income for Elisa and she started working on this small business enterprise through the assistance from SPBD.

Elisa and her family now enjoy the fruits of her own labour through the production of handicrafts which she sells at the market in town. She says she will continue to utilise the assistance of SPBD as needed for she cannot meet the requirements expected of “borrowers” at other financial institutions and this can put a lot of pressure on her as a borrower. She is therefore grateful for the assistance that SPBD gives as it has allowed women like herself, with no formal employment, to receive financial assistance to start their own small businesses that their families can now rely on for financial support.

loans.use: To cover overhead costs of her handicraft micro-business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sumarmi

texts.id:
Ketut Sumarmi and her husband Ketut Wiana comes from Manistutu village. She has a 6-year-old son called I Putu Diva who is now studying in kindergarten. She raises and breeds pig. Although she doesn't have a pigpen and can only raise the pig traditionally, she wasn't discouraged at all to start this business. Her pig just gave birth to 10 piglets 2 weeks ago. Every day she takes care of the piglets. The food mixtures that she gave to the pig consist of fine rice chaff, concentrate, and mineral so that the milk quality is good. After 2 months, the piglets can be sold for Rp. 250,000 (about $27) per piglet so she can earn Rp. 2,500,000 (about $276). As the food expense was Rp. 500,000, the net profit was Rp. 1,500,000 (about $166). She hopes to buy 1 more female pig.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut Sumarmi dan suaminya Ketut Wiana berasal dari desa Manistutu. Ketut Sumarmi memiliki 1 orang anak yang diberi nama I Putu Diva baru berumur 6 tahun dan sekarang baru bersekolah di TK. Ketut Sumarni saat ini memelihara babi penginduk.Walaupun belum memiliki kandang dan hanya memelihara secara tradisional, tidak membuat Ketut Sumarmi putus asa untuk memelihara induk babi. Saat ini induk babi Ketut Sumarmi memiliki anak 10 ekor baru melahirkan 2 minggu yang lalu. Setiap hari Ketut Sumarmi memperhatikan perkembangan dari semua anak babinya. Adapun campuran makanan yang diberi Ketut Sumarmi seperti dedak padi yang halus, konsentrat dan mineral susu supaya air susu induknya bagus. Umur 2 bulan 10 ekor anak babi ini akan siap dijual dengan harga 1 ekornya Rp.250.000,- jadi uang yang didapat nanti Rp.2.500.000,-. Sedangkan pengeluaran pakan sampai dijual menghabiskan biaya Rp. 500.000,-. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat Ketut Sumarmi setiap panen sebesar Rp.1.500.000,-. Harapan Ketut Sumarmi supaya bisa membeli 1 ekor lagi induk babi.

loans.use: To purchase female pig and pig food

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
Lida is an example of courage. She possesses the enthusiam and entreprenurial spirit that all Peruvian mothers have to progress in the company of her family. With the work that she does every weekend selling clothes at either the fairs or door to door, she has been able to obtain great sales that have allowed her to improve her family's quality of life. However, her income has been shortened slowly due to the low capital that she has. A lot of the garments that she offers had been left with a promise of payment note and this fact had maD. it difficult to continue buying clothes for selling. She asks that we support her with an amount of money to continue to get clothes and garments to sell and introduce at local fairs in her town. Let's be generous and contribute to her petition and let the people of her town continue supporting her by buying clothes from Lida

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Un ejemplo D. valor es Lida, que posee el entusiasmo y espíritu emprendedor que toda madre peruana posee para progresar en compañía D. su familia. Con el trabajo que realiza todos los fines D. semana vendiendo prendas D. vestir en las ferias o D. domicilio en domicilio ha obtenido interesantes sumas D. dinero que le han permitido mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.Sin embargo sus salidas se han ido acortando poco a poco debido al bajo capital con el que cuenta ya que muchas D. las prendas que oferta las deja con un compromiso D. pago y este hecho ha dificultado la compra D. mayor cantidad D. prendas para continuar con su labor. Solicita la apoyemos con una suma D. dinero para adquirir prendas D. vestir a fin D. continuar con su introducción en las ferias D. su ciudad.Posibilitemos su petición y hagamos que las personas D. su ciudad sigan usando las prendas D. Lida.

loans.use: Increase her capital to acquire a larger quantity of clothes to sell to the people of Chachamayo.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 42 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Two of them are studying in school, and the other one is going to university. He has a small general store and applied to borrow $1200 to purchase more new goods and to purchase a new ice box. He also wants to make new shelves and renovate the store to increase his income and develop his business. He wants to have a safer and better life for his children.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new ice box  and more new goods

loans.name: Tiira Road E Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Jennifer N.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to expand her fish business. Jennifer is 37 years old and is a widow. She has 7 children ranging from age 6 months to 15 years, and five of the children go to school. Each week, Jennifer makes approximately UGX 150000 (~ $87 USD) in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

Jennifer has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 400000 (~ $233 USD) to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time.

Jennifer is joined in her small group by Irene N. and Annet N.. Irene N. has a business selling ripe bananas and wants to add to her banana business. Annet N. also sells ripe bananas and wants a loan to increase her stock of bananas.

loans.use: To expand fish business

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum S., 39, is a mother of 5 children and works selling grocery products, earning around $5 in revenue each day. Her husband, who is a construction worker, also supports the family income and normally makes on average $5 a day. One child is married and lives away from home while two work as laborers and two others are students. 

Mrs. S. needs this loan to purchase wood, cement, and other material to renovate her house. (Mrs. Prum S. is not available for picture, only husband)

loans.use: To purchase wood, cement, and other material to renovate her house

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 35 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages four and one years old. She and her husband also take care of one other child, age 13 years old. Lucy owns a small food vendor store which she started in 2006. Everyday she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Jesila's Group

texts.en:
Jesila leads a group of five women of Haitian descent, all of whom live in the San L. community of Santo Domingo.  Jesila is forty years old and a proud mother of two sons and two daughters.  Her husband works as an independent cabinet-maker.
To supplement her family’s income and help her husband fend better for the children, Jesila plans to start selling women’s clothing for a couple of months. She says that each day, after preparing breakfast for the family, she’ll be visiting her friends and other people of the neighborhood in order to sell her products.  Jesila is very confident and says that she knows how to convince people to make them accept a product.
The entrepreneur is expecting an improvement of her family’s lifestyle as a result of her new business.
The other members of Jesila’s group are:
Cristina L. L., a clothing retailer
Felicia L. B., to buy perfumes and beauty products to add to her stock
María G., to replenish a small clothing store
Zelandia L. L., to buy perfumes, hand and body lotions and cosmetics.
Photo. Left to right: Zelandia, María, Felicia, Cristina Y Jesila.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk in order to start a small business.

location.town: San Luis, community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Sokkhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkhoeun S., 44, and her husband, live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1986 and have four children, one son and three daughters. All of their children are in local school. Besides her children, Sokkhoeun's youngest sister lives with her.  Her sister, shown in the photo with her, is a silk weaver. 

Mrs. Sokkhoeun has been a silk weaver for four years, a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while her husband is a policeman in Phnom Penh.

Now she is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk materials for her sister’s loom and hers.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Júlia Tomás

texts.pt:
Júlia Tomás N. is married and 33 years old. She was born in Catembe on September 6, 1975. She studied until the 6th grade. She supports 3 children who are all in school.

She was born and raised in a family environment with her parents but when she was young her aunt invited her to live with her because she did not have any children. She was going to school and in her free time would help her aunt with her work in Machamba.

She returned to her parents' home when she was 15. Due to the war and her health she interrupted her studies and went to live in the city of Maputo with her oldest sister. When she was 16 she had her first child. As soon as the war ended she returned to her parents' home and began to work as a volunteer activist for the Institute of Social Action in 1998.

Currently she works in the ONG Imagine as a community coordinator. With the loan she intends to purchase beams, zinc plates, and cement to build a home where she has sufficient space. Work is moving along reasonably well. In the future she longs to build a mini grocery store to help with the family income.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Júlia Tomás N. casada maritalmente, tem 33 anos de idade, nasceu em catembe aos 06 de Setembro de 1975, estudou até 6ª classe, sustenta 3 filhos e todos estudam. Nasceu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais, só que cedo a tia convida-a viver com ela pois esta não tinha filhos, estudava e nos tempos livres ajudava a tia nos trabalhos da machamba.
