Regressa a casa dos pais quando tinha 15 anos de idade, devido a problemas da guerra e de saúde interrompe os estudos e passa viver na Cidade de maputo com a irmà mais velha. Aos 16 anos teve seu 1º filho e logo que termina a guerra regressa a casa dos pais e começa a trabalhar como activista voluntária no Instituto de ação social em 1998. Actualmente trabalha na ONG imagine como coordenadora comunitária. Com o crédito pretende comprar barrotes, chapas de zinco e cimento e tem espaço sufuciente para erguer sua casa e conseguiu-o por trespasse e as obras estão a decorrer razoavelmente. No futuro almeja construir uma mini mercearia para ajudar na renda da familia.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Ni Kadek

texts.id:
M.ś food kiosk has been growing very fast. She started the kiosk with $110 and then later she invested another $130 with loans from DInari. The kiosk started in a simple temporary building, now grown to a permanent building wit larger floor space. This is all due to M.ś hard work. Each day she opens the kiosk at 7 am. Sometimes she opens till midnight. M.ś hard work has started to show result. She saved the profit from her kiosk little by little. Now she is building a new home and kiosk with that savings. M. gained more motivation and is hoping to obtain more loans from DINARI that she plans to use to increase her kioskś offering. So she can increase its profit potential. M. plans to use the incremental profit to pay fore her kidś tuition.

Translated from Bahasa Inconesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Usaha warung milik M. berkembang sangat pesat .Warung yang dengan modal awal sebesar Rp 1.000.000,- dan tambahan modal Rp 1.200.000,- dari Dinari kini sudah menjadi warung yang cukup besar . Bangunan warung yang dulu sangat sederhana kini juga telah berubah menjadi warung yang permanen. . Hal ini tak terlepas dari kerja keras yang telah M. lakukan . Setiap hari M. memulai membuka warungnya dari pukul 07.00 pagi. Bahkan sering kali M. harus berjualan sampai tengah malam. Hasil kerja keras M. kini telah menuai hasil. Keuntungan yang didapat sedikit demi sedikit di tabungnya kemudian di pergunakan untuk membangun sebuah rumah dan tempat usaha yang baru. M. semakin bersemangat dalam menjalankan usahanya dan masih berharap mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari untuk periode berikutnya yang nantinya akan dia pergunakan untuk membeli barang dagangan untuk melengkapi isi warungnya, sehingga dengan demikian usaha warung M. akan menghasilkan keuntungan yang lebih banyak, untuk persiapan biaya sekolah anaknya.

loans.use: Increase Product Offering

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en: Elnara is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and has settled in Fuzuli region, in Bala Bahmanli village. She was born in 1983. Elnara has been in the buffalo business for 4 years. She is single. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy a buffalo to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Faauluuluga

texts.en:
Faauluuluga E. is 38 years old and married with four children. She has three years of experience selling chips. She sells to the public three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 Tala (~$41 USD).

This is Faauluuluga’s first loan with SPBD (South Pacific Business Development), and she is eager to improve her business operation so that she is in better financial standing to support her family. She plans to use the money to buy a stove, frying pan, and 20 liters of oil for her chip-selling business. SPBD loans are her only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan.

loans.use: To purchase a stove, frying pan, and 20 liters of oil for her chip selling business.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada K. has been preparing and selling food in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $50 each month. She is requesting her first loan so she can buy more basic ingredients like sugar and flour, and produce a greater output of the foods she prepares and sells.

Saada is 26 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy  more sugar and flour for her food business.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.ru: Носирова Рукия жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 48 лет,замужем, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей.Она имеет торговую точку на местном рынке.Бизнес является основным источником дохода ее большой семьи.Рукия закупает у местных крестьян овощи и реализует их в розницу.На полученный кредит клиент хочет закупить товар.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ruqiya N. lives in the city of Tursunzade. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She completed secondary school. She works selling vegetables at her stall in the local market. The business is the primary source of income for her large family. Ruqiya buys vegetables from local farmers and sells them retail. The loan will be used to buy produce, and repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Naziran Abdul Ghanni Group

texts.en:
My name is Naziran and I’m a 54 year old married lady. I have resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan since 1985. I belong to a Punjabi family. Punjabi people are famous for their kind heart and soft feelings. I am proud to be called a Punjabi. My husband's name is A. G., and he is a wood seller by profession, and has 20 years of experience. I have five children: four sons and one daughter. My first two sons drive a tractor for agriculture. The other two work as delivery men and use a donkey cart for loading material from one place to another. My daughter stays at home and helps me in making embroidered dresses. I make embroidered clothes by order and earn Pak rupees 2000. My work supports my husband in some ways, e.g. to pay electricity bills, and water bills. I successfully repaid my first loan which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again to expand my husband’s business of buying wood.

I am a group leader of a few more members in my locality. Sajida S. baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Ameeran baji wants a loan to buy plastic shopping bags to resell. Samreen naz baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore”. Razia sultana baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce H. is thirty-two years old; she is married and the mother of four children. All her kids are in school. She has been selling food for the past 13 years to support her family. She sells gari (cassava couscous) and beans with ripe plantains in the community school at Nkawkaw. Gari and beans is a dish enjoyed by many Ghanaians because it contains lots of protein and it is also affordable to buy.

Joyce's business is doing well because she is good at human relations and due to the tasty meals she sells. Her major challenge is when the students are on vacation; this means she must also break for a while. In order not to be idle during school vacations, she wants to expand her operation while students are on vacation by selling in the community market.

Joyce wants this loan to buy foodstuffs such as gari, plantains, beans, charcoal etc. to restock her inventory. It has also been her dream to save more from her business proceeds to pay school fees for her children in school. Joyce belongs to a village bank called ‘Asetenapa’ meaning Good Living. She hopes to receive GHS 400 to make business progress.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as gari, plantains, and beans, etc.

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Хабубулло мужчина в возрасте 35 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Жена швея на дому.Сам Хабибулло работает врачом в районной больнице.Он врач терапевт ,весь Уткансой его знают и обращаются за медицинской помощью.Кроме своей основной работы он занимается откормом скота.У него сейчас дома две коровы и 7 баранов.В его отсутствие за скотом ухаживает его жена и сыновья.Для увеличения численности скота Хабибулло решил получить кредит.Для чего и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Habibullo A. is 35 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a seamstress and works from home. Habibullo is a physician at a local hospital. He is well known in Utkansoi and people often turn to him for medical help. In addition to his regular job, Habibullo raises livestock. When Habibullo is at work, his wife and sons take care of the two cows and seven sheep that they own. Habibullo is applying for a Microinvest loan because he would like to purchase more livestock.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Nancy es conviviente tiene 30 años, dos hijos de 9 y  3 años que van a la escuela estatal. 
Ella no estudia por de desde niña siempre trabajo, le ayudaba a su mama a vender fruta, ahora ella alquila un puesto en el mismo mercado vende fruta  cada día compra por lote (10 cajas de fruta) trabaja de 7am hasta las 5pm.  
Desde que esta en Finca le va mucho mejor, tiene mas capital, aprendió a ahorrar. Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para poner un negocio de comida, comprar sillas, mesas, platos. 
El sueño de Nancy es tener un negocio propio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the community bank "Unidas Triunfaremos" (United we will triumph). She lives with her partner, is 30 years old, and has two children, aged 9 and 3, who attend the state school. Nancy herself never went to school because since she was a girl she has always worked, helping her mother to sell fruit. Now she rents her own locale in the same market, selling fruit. Each day she buys stock of fruit (10 boxes) and works from 7am to 5pm. She has done well since aligning herself with Finca; she has more capital and has learned how to save. Nancy needs a loan of 1200 soles to build a food-selling business and buy chairs, tables and plates. Her dream is to have her own business selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a food-selling business and buy chairs, tables and plates.

loans.name: Gabriel Gertrudis

texts.es: Gabriel Gertrudis V. O. tiene la edad de 55 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Gabriel tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Don Gabriel es un restaurante. Hace mas de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio el labora con sus hijos y su esposa atiende todos los días de la semana, pero los fines de semana son los días de mayor actividad. Los propósitos de Don Gabriel son de ampliar su negocio para proporcionarles más comodidad a sus clientes. Es por este motivo que don Gabriel decide visitar las oficinas de Fundación León 2000 con el propósito de invertir en negocio destinado para el capital de trabajo para la compra de pollo, verduras, granos básicos, gaseosas y condimentos. Sus deseos son de obtener un local que sea exclusivo para  eventos empresariales. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 15.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Gabriel Gertrudis V. O. is fifty-five years old and married. He has four children and they all work. Gabriel's business is owning and managing a restaurant. For over fifteen years he has been in this business and works with this children while his wife attends every day of the week, although weekends are the busiest days. Gabriel's objectives are to expand his business in order to provide more comfort to his customers. This is why he decided to visit the Fundacion Leon 2000 offices with the purpose of investing in this business with work capital to purchase chickens, vegetables, grains, soda pops and condiments. He desires to acquire a locale that is exclusive for business activities. The amount he requests is $750 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Master Kwame, as he is popularly called, is 35 years old. He is married, a father of two children, and very hardworking too. Kwame is a dealer in electrical goods like assorted lights, electrical cables, extension plugs, wires, electric lamps, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He is requesting a loan to enable him to increase his stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to save enough to expand his shop to include refrigerators. He would be very grateful for your support. He has a lot of experience and has been in this business for the past eleven years, widening his market share in his business area. He belongs to a village bank called "Merciful."

loans.use: To increase his stock of electrical appliances

loans.name: Suduridin

texts.ru: Судуриддину 30 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Работает в колхозе. Дополнительно к своему заработку в колхозе занимается откормом скота в этом ему помогает его жена. У Судуриддина дома несколько коров и баранов. Условия для содержания скота у Судуриддина имеются и поэтому он решил подать заявку на займ и прикупить еще 2 бычков.
texts.en:
Suduridin is thirty years old, married, and has four children. He works on a collective farm. To add to what he earns on the collective farm, he works fattening cattle. His wife (pictured) helps him in this. At Suduridin’s home, he has some cows and rams. Suduridin is able to maintain the cattle, and consequently he has decided apply for a loan to buy two more calves.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sharifa Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is the group leader of Sharifa group. There are four members in this group and all of them would like receive money for their businesses.

Sharifa and Nazifa want to take a loan for their general stores. They each want to buy necessary materials for their business. Also Soria wants to take a loan for her carpet-weaving business and Bebe Arifa wants to take a loan for her bakery. She wants to buy firewood and flour for baking.

Together they requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani.

loans.use: To expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Abimbola

texts.en: Abimbola is 35 years old and married with 2 children.  He sells bags of flour.  He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more bags of flour to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour to sell

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu H. is fifty-two years old, married, and has given birth to nine children: eight sons and one daughter. Some are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works with a security agency.

Zenabu is a food vendor: she prepares and sells rice and stew. She has been in business for over fifteen years and sells on a table at a local school compound. She buys her goods from Kumasi and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mujeres De Amor Group

texts.en:
Amancia G. acts as the group coordinator for ten women from Los Nunez, a neighborhood on the outskirts of Puerta Plata.  She, like many of the women in her group, is unhappy with the poverty which her family lives in.  A few years ago Amancia’s husband died leaving her struggling to support herself and her three kids.  Although she has recently remarried, she remembers the hardships she experienced as a single mother and wishes to secure a future for her family.

After Amancia’s first husband passed away she provided for her children by selling clothing in Puerto Plata.  Amancia says that she used to buy clothes at a discount from a warehouse in Santiago and then sell individual items of clothing in her neighborhood.   Now, she hopes to use Esperanza to help her to start selling clothes again.  Amancia believes that with the help of Esperanza she will be able to make her business a success.  She says that Esperanza’s loan will allow her to obtain an additional discount from the warehouse because she will be able to buy in bulk.

Amancia’s hope is to spend the income from her clothing sales to provide her children with a good education.  She says that she wants to help her children to learn English and dreams that she will be able to send them all to college.  Amancia is particularly interested in helping her youngest son Rafael to pursue an artistic career. Although he is only ten, Rafael has demonstrated musical talent.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie, ce commerce lui réussit très bien. Elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de pagnes. Présentement elle veut augmenter ses recettes, elle doit pour cela augmenter  son stock de marchandises. Ayant déjà obtenu deux prêts de WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé elle sollicite un troisième crédit pour agrandir ses marchandises avec divers articles de mercerie et 11 pièces de pagnes.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman's business consists in selling sewing supplies and works very well for her. She also sells pagnes (colorful African cloth). At this time, she would like to increase her revenue, and to this effect she needs to increase her stock. After having repaid without problems the two loans she obtained from Kiva's partner, WAGES, she's now seeking a third loan to buy various sewing supplies and 11 pieces of pagnes. She's married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and 11 pieces of pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: David Salomon

texts.es: El señor David Salomón de 33 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, el se desempeña  como soldador y disector de cadáveres el cual aprendió gracia a su padre y es a si que se gana la vida día a día para sobresalir a delante con su bella familia, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 9 y 19 años, uno estudia y el mayor trabaja, el ha logrado comprar mucha de su maquinaria con las que trabaja lo que se le hace mas fácil. Con este préstamo  es el noveno en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por el apoyo financiero ya que ha logrado comprar su maquinaria, con este préstamo comprar materiales para elaborar soldadura y poder dar un buen servicio y seguimiento a su clientela. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. David Salomón is 33 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación in the capital of Managua. He works as a welder and a dissector of cadavers, skills he learned from his father and uses every day to support his beautiful family. His wife has two children, ages 19 and 9. The older child is working while the younger one is still a student.

Sr. David has managed to buy most of the machinery for his welding business, which helps make his job easier. This will be his ninth loan with AFODENIC. He is thankful for the financial support that helped him acquire his machinery. With his current loan, he plans to buy welding materials so that he can provide good service and follow-up to his customers. He plans to continue making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase welding materials

loans.name: Sonia Lilliam

texts.es: Sonia Lilliam Ramírez R. tiene 70 años de edad. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Sonia es una mujer muy luchadora y a pesar de tener esa edad, ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo y ofrecerle la oportunidad de estudio. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos. El sueño de Sonia es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda, par que el día de mañana sea de provecho para su hijo.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph Gitau has been making furniture for the last 20 years in Naivasha town. He is a 54 year old man who is married to Hannah Wanjiku. Together they have three children in school. Having no previous credit history from any other microfinance institution, he was introduced to KADET by a friend who is already a client. This will be Joseph’s first loan from KADET, which he will use to buy materials and tools to expand his workshop. His future aspiration is to open a chain of workshops in Naivasha town.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools to expand his workshop

loans.name: Malahlay Group

texts.en:
Malahlay is the leader of Malahlay group, which consists of three members, each of whom would like to receive money for their businesses. Mahalay wants to take a loan to buy necessary materials for her tailoring business.

Yar Mohammad wants to take a loan to increase the stock for his business.

Alam Sha wants to take a loan for his general store.

They are thankful for the loan of 12,000 Afghanis, as it will provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Terisita

texts.en:
Teresita has been selling fruits and snacks on the school campus for almost 15 years. She is 34 years old and has been separated from her husband for almost a year. She has three children, namely: Michelle, 18 years of age, third year college student; followed by Riza Joy, 14 years old, second year high school; and their youngest is Randy, 9 years of age, Grade V pupil. She is living peacefully in barangay San Francisco, Alicia, Isabela, with her son. Her two daughters are living with their grandmother in Nueva Ecija, Philippines.

Teresita's net income for five days is 400 pesos. Wanting to increase her income for the education of her children, she would like to borrow 5,000 pesos from ASKI for additional capital and to purchase some grocery items for her retail store. She hopes and prays that her requested loan will be granted as soon as possible to financially support her business and her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Aracelie

texts.en:
Aracelie M. is from the village of Valencia City. She is 39 years old. Aracelie is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Aracelie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Aracelie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aracelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aracelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Aracelie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Aracelie from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mirembe Women's Group Of Mukono

texts.en: Robinah M. is 51 years old and the leader of her group in Mukono. She cares for one orphan in addition to her six children.  Robinah has been a brickmaker for 7 years and generates 200,000 USH per month from her business. She hopes to be able to expand her business with the loan and to be able to continue paying for her children’s education.

loans.use: Expansion of Business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
En la foto sale la esposa del señor por razones laborales.

El señor Julio Cesar es una persona trabajadora desde hace años se dedica a conducir camiones de carga; es por ello que la mayor parte del tiempo se la pasa fuera de casa. Su esposa la señora Isabel Santos se queda en el hogar al cuidado de sus dos hijos y en fin de semana sale a vender ropa usada. Esta familia se da tiempo para convivir y aprovechar el tiempo lo mas que se pueda, este esfuerzo es con el fin de  dar mejor comodidad a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida. En el crédito pasado que se le otorgo fue para construir un cuarto enfrente de su casa ahora quieren poner las ventanas y protecciones para ya empezar habitar esa recamara, es por ello que necesita el apoyo de nosotros.
texts.en:
For work reasons, this photo is of the wife of the borrower. Mr. Julio Cesar is a hard worker and for years has been working driving freight trucks; for this reason he spends most of his time away from home. His wife, Mrs. Isabel Santos, stays at home to take care of their two children, and on the weekends leaves to sell used clothing. This family lives together and takes advantage of their time the most possible. This current effort is for the purpose of making their children more comfortable and giving them a better quality of life. The past loan granted to them was to add a room to the front of their home. Now, they want to put in the windows and protection features to make the room habitable. For this reason they need our help.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add windows and protection to a room.

loans.name: Shovkat

texts.en: Shovkat A. is 44 years old and married. She has nine years of experience growing and selling fruit. She uses all the money she makes to take care of her two sons and provide for their education. Shovkat always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her stock in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her customers are always very happy with the service they receive from her. As her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today, Shovkat is requesting 1,600 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer in order to increase the variety of her goods. She is grateful to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase more seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sembrando Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEMBRANDO” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa y esta conformado por 12 socios. En el video se ve que la junta directiva a cargo del señor secretario Erasmo, da la bienvenida a los nuevos socios al banco comunal y la asesora da unas palabras de saludos por las fiestas navideñas y por el año nuevo a los socios.           

Algunas de nuestras socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta de panes, venta producto de belleza y venta de productos de limpieza. Otros socios dan servicio de transportes en sus propios taxis. Los socios Erasmo y Carlos son docentes. La socia Tania es psicóloga.            
     
La socia Antonia tiene 52 años es casada y se dedica al negocio de producción de panes. La socia se levanta de madrugada de  4 a.m. a 5 a.m. para hacer las actividades del negocio como preparar la masa del pan y calentar el horno. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos para seguir produciendo panes. 

Los socios requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos para sus negocios y así de esta forma aumentar el capital del negocio y tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Las socias valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Sembrando Communal Bank. They live in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. The members meet every 30 days in the central office of the Arariwa Association. There are 12 members. In the video you can see the governing board. The secretary, Erasmo, is greeting the new members of the communal bank. The treasurer says a few words of greetings for the Christmas and New Year’s holidays. Some of our members alternate their activities between their diverse household chores and selling bread, beauty products, and cleaning products. Other members provide services like driving their own taxis. Erasmo and Carlos are teachers. Tania is a psychologist. Antonia is a 52 year old member. She is married, and her business is making bread. She gets up between 4 a.m. and 5 a.m. to do work for her business. She makes the bread dough and heats the oven. She has been in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs the loan to buy supplies to continue making bread. The members need the loan to buy more products for their businesses. That way they will be able to increase their business capital, get greater earnings, and give their children a better quality of life. The members value and appreciate the loan given through this medium. They promise to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur  JOSE LUIS from  Peru

loans.use: Buy more products for their businesses

loans.name: Bary Maramou I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bary Maramou 1 est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans la ville de Yanfolila qui relève de la 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des relations professionnelles. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur ressource financière et de faire assez de stocks enfin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de céréales. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le précèdent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, auprès des fournisseurs de Yanfolila, 3 tonnes de maïs, 4tonnes de sorgho et 2 tonnes de petit mil. 
Les produits seront revendus dans le marché de Yanfolila, en gros et en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 40.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé dans l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Bary Maramou 1 is composed of married women who average 28 years of age and three children each.  The women live in nuclear  families with their children and husband, and they reside in the city of Yanfolila, which is part of the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  They know one another through professional ties.   With the intention of increasing their financial resources and having enough inventory to satisfy customer needs, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, so as to do commerce in grains.  They are now on their second solidarity loan.  The previous one was properly repaid. With this new loan, they intend to go to Yanfolila suppliers to buy:  three tonnes of corn, four tonnes of sorghum, and two tonnes of petit mil (millet). The goods will be sold retail and wholesale at the Yanfolila market accepting cash or credit from customers composed of men and women.  With this loan, the group members hope to obtain a profit of 40,000 francs CFA per month that will be used for educating their children. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buyiing grain

loans.name: Help Woman Gobefo Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Help Women Gobefo group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni city who want a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones for each to enable them to expand their businesses. This will be their very first loan from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses so that they can attract more customers, make better sales, earn more profit and improve their living standards. 

Aminata W. is the leader of this group. Aminata is now age 50. She was born in Makeni and is married with six children. All of her children are now grown-ups except for one, who is in secondary school.  

Aminata sells gara lappers (locally dyed clothes). She has been in this business for 12 years now. She will use this loan to buy working materials like white cotton, inks, caustic soda, powder and so on.

loans.use: Buy working materials like white cotton, inks, caustic soda, powder and so on

loans.name: Claudia Liseth

texts.es: Claudia Liseth R. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a sus cuatro hijos D. 12, 10, 8 y 5 años D. edad. Claudia posee una venta D. productos D. belleza tales como perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo, ropa y otros más. Mucho D. estos productos se comercializan por catalogo, D. los cuales se venden a crédito, esta es una estrategia que Claudia utiliza para poder asegurar sus ventas aunque en muchas ocasiones es bastante riesgosa. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. cosméticos, ropa y perfumes, la cual debe pagar al contado para obtenerla, es por ello que es D. mucha importancia obtener el préstamo dado por Integral, para que este le permita aumentar el inventario D. su negocio y poder mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia. Claudia es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual siempre se ha esforzado al máximo por brindarles Todo lo mejor a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales dependen por completo D. ella, ya que no recibe ayuda D. nadie para el sostén D. ellos.
texts.en:
Claudia Liseth R. D. M. is 34 years old. She lives in LourD. Colón, which is in the La Libertad department. She lives with her four children; ages 12, 10, 8, and 5. Claudia sells beauty products like perfume, body cream, clothes, and other things. She sells many of these products by catalog, and she sells on credit. This is a strategy that Claudia uses to be able to assure her sales even though, on many occasions, it is pretty risky. That is the reason that she is requesting a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of cosmetics, clothes, and perfume. She needs to pay cash to get these items. That is why it is very important to get the loan given by Integral. This will allow her to increase the inventory in her business and be able to improve her family’s living conditions. Claudia is a very hard-working woman who has always put forth maximum effort to give her four children all the best. They completely depend upon her because she does not receive help in supporting them from anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair creams, perfume, and clothes

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora  María G. vive en a unos 10 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, en la comunidad de Huizhill en la parroquia  Baños, localidad muy reconocida por sus aguas termales curativas que son aprovechadas en  las piscinas y baños termales que se realizan los visitantes de éste hermoso lugar del Ecuador.

Nuestra socia se encuentra de 55 años de edad de estado civil casada, fruto de esta unión  ha procreado 5 hijos que no recuerda las edades de cada uno de ellos pero nos comenta que ya todos son casados y viven de manera independiente, su esposo no trabaja por lo que le ayuda en su negocio.

María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, tiene un local de venta de todo tipo de ropa en la Feria Libre lleva  20 años con este negocio y le va bien,  su horario de trabajo  es de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. de lunes a sábados y el domingo labora el medio día. 

Nos comenta que este es su segundo ciclo en la fundación anteriormente ya formó parte del banco pero se retiro por motivos personales y ahora esta integrando nuevamente este gran grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, con el nuevo crédito solicitado a la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR comprará  casacas, camisas, blusas, pantalones etc. para abastecer su local con mercaderia para toda la familia.

Su sueño es dejar de trabajar ya que siente el peso de sus años  le gustaría descansar y disfrutar un poco mas de lo que le reste de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. María G. lives approximately ten minutes outside of the city of Cuenca, in the community of Huizhill in Baños Parish. The area is known for its healing warm waters that fill the swimming pools and thermal springs. This has attracted visitors to this beautiful place in Ecuador.

María is 55 years old and married. Her relationship has resulted in five children, but she no longer remembers the ages of each one. She says all of them are married and live independently. Her husband does not work, so he helps with her business.

María is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Combate” (Women in Combat). She has a vending location at the Open Fair where she sells all types of clothing. María has been in this business for 20 years and has done well. Her work schedule is from 8am to 6pm, Monday through Saturday. On Sundays, she works half a day.

María says that in her second loan cycle with the Foundation, she was part of the Communal Bank but had to withdraw because of personal reasons. Now she is reintegrating with ths great group of women entrepreneurs. With the new loan she is requesting from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy jackets, shirts, blouses, pants, and other items to restock her location with merchandise for the entire family. Her dream is to stop working because she already feels the weight of her years, so she would like to relax and enjoy what little remains of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jackets, shirts, blouses, pants, and other items

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Ramatoulaye Traoré est âgée de 53 ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant, elle vit dans la grande famille traditionnelle à Bougoula Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ramatoulaye Traoré  est une couturière de profession qui  achète des balles des draps, rideaux et de napperon afin de les modifier pour pouvoir les revendre  et cela depuis maintenant plus de vingt ans. Elle mène son activité à domicile où elle possède sa propre machine à coudre. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de  six ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son neuvième prêt individuel et tous les prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 8 colis de napperon, 8 balles de rideau et 4 balles de drap. Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente très généralement  au comptant, à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ramatoulaye Traoré is 53 years old, single and mother to one child. She lives in a large traditional family in Bougoula Ville, the central town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Ramatoulaye is a seamstress by profession and she buys bundles of sheets, curtains and tablemats in order to alter them and resell them; she has been doing this for more than twenty years. She carries out this activity from home where she has her own sewing machine. In order to satisfy her ever increasing customer base, she decided to join the mincrofinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, over six years ago. After several group loans with an association of women in her neighborhood, she is now on her ninth individual loan and all the previous loans have been repaid correctly. With this loan she is planning to buy eight parcels of tablemats, eight bundles of curtains and eight bundles of sheets. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers, and she sells generally for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of women. She is expecting to make a monthly profit of 250,000 FCFA which will be used essentially to expand her business, contribute to family expenses and pay the interest on her loan; the rest will be invested in her activity.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheets, curtains and tablemats

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammad is the father of a nine-year-old daughter and a six-year-old son.

Mohamamd is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority but his salary barely covers basic family needs. Therefore he is thinking of a job which he can do after work hours that will help him afford living expenses, especially that his daughter is having health problems which requires regular hospital visits.

Mohammad came to FATEN to take a loan in order to purchase a three-wheeled carriage to sell candies, beverages, sweets and snacks. He will start selling these items in Ramallah bus station which usually has a huge number of potential customers.

Mohammad hopes with this income to improve his family’s living conditions and be able to provide his daughter with the proper treatment she needs.

loans.use: To purchase a cart for his new retail business

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias, aged 27, is single and lives in Githurai area, a Nairobi suburb. It is an area of mixed businesses with a high population, most of whom are low-income earners.

Elias operates as a shoe shiner and has done this for the last seven years. His customers are mainly working-class people in the busy Githurai area. With this loan, he plans to set up a modest structure for his business costing KES 6,000 and buy a stock of shoe-related products to sell like shoe polish and other items which will cost him KES 14,000.

Elias has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, he hopes to venture into the matatu (minibus) industry.

loans.use: To set up a presentable structure for his shoe shining business and start selling shoe-related products

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es:
Emerson  vive en la zona Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive con su esposa, y su pequeño hijo en la casa de sus padres, la cual ya se encuentra dividida con sus demás hermanos.
 
Emerson  se dedica juntamente con su esposa en la atención de un pequeño restaurant donde expende comida. Por motivo de ampliación y progreso en sus actividades decidieron tomar en alquiler otro local el cual se encuentra en un lugar mas concurrido, con la esperanza de incrementar sus ventas, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
El crédito lo destinará para aumento de capital, compra de mesas, sillas, para atender su demanda y seguir creciendo económicamente.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Emerson lives in the Exaltacion area of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and their small son in his parents' home which is divided amongst his other siblings. Emerson works with his wife running a small restaurant. In order to grow the business, they decided to rent a different location in a more highly-trafficked area which should help them grow sales and their income. This loan will be used to provide capital to buy tables and chairs and to meet their demand in order to grow economically. This is his second loan through Impro; his evaluation qualified him to receive this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase fuel & equipment for baking bread

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
K. Bahodir is 38, married, and has three children. Bahodir's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. 

He is a taxi driver and travels the streets of Spitamen city in search of customers. He has owned his business for 5 years. At the same time together with the help of his family he runs a grocery sales business. Currently Bahodir’s car needs thorough repair and he wants to borrow 5,000 Somoni. The financing will go towards general repairs of his vehicle, the purchase of additional foodstuffs for his grocery store, and to buy an additional deep-freezer for expanding his business. He thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: repair of a taxi, grocery store inventory, and deep-freezer

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 28-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair garage since 2005. He is a specialist in repairing the bodies of cars. He repairs all types of cars. He decided on opening his garage because of his experience. When he first started, he had some financial issues. He is a hardworking man who does his best to improve his work. 

Today, Husein is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools and purchase a scanner. He hopes to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To buy new tools and purchase a scanner

loans.name: Kiburara Tweheyo, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Stephen B. has subsisted on profits from his eight-year-old produce-selling business in the Kiburara market of Ibanda and those profits cater to all his family responsibilities. He is a married man with three children. What has through the years played havoc with his business are the constant unpredictable weather changes. In his business, he has mostly been relying on his down-to-earth demeanor to attract customers. 

In a week, his business brings him profits that amount to 40,000 shillings. With this loan, he wants to buy more lucrative cash crops like coffee, maize and cassava that he will later resell.

loans.use: Purchasing more cash crops like coffee and cassava for resale

loans.name: Segundo Julian

texts.es:
Segundo Julian M. C. tiene 29 anos. Es casado y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 4 hijos que se llaman Nathaly, Bayron, Brayon, y Estalin. 

Segundo es un socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para su agricultura. Esta préstamo lo ayudara en mejorar su situación economico. Su sueno es comprar un terreno propio. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene enfermedades y plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

En su tiempo libre le gusta estar con la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Julian M. C. is 29 years old, married, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has four children named Nathaly, Bayron, Brayon, and Estalin.

Segundo is a member of the Communal Bank “Narcisa de Jesús”. There are 15 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Segundo is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys and sells his products in the canton of Ventanas. Segundo is requesting a loan to use for his farming activities since it will help improve his financial situation. His dream is to purchase his own land. Among the challenges he faces in his work are the diseases and pests that impact his corn crop. One such pest is called “langosta”.

In his free time, Segundo enjoys being with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for his farming activities

loans.name: Zakhir

texts.ru:
Zakhir G. 33 let. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo sina kotoromu 6 let on v etom qodu poydet v shkolu. Zakhir i eqo semya jivut v Fuzuli regione. 

Zakit uje 5 let kak rabotayet taksistom. Vodit mashinu eqo nauchil eo otec . Zakir ochen lubil vodit mashini i on ochen akkuratno vodil i poetomu reshil stat taksistom. Zakir Seychas nujdayetssya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya toqo chtobi pochinit mashinu.
texts.en:
Zakhir G. is thirty-three and married with one six-year-old son, who will be going to school this year. He and his family live in the Fuzuli region. For five years Zakhir has worked as a taxi driver. He learned how to drive from his father. He loved driving and was good at it so he decided to become a taxi driver. Zakhir currently needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts so he can fix up his car.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ilhame

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Ilhame M. has operated a business of selling dresses that are specifically intended for wedding and engagement ceremonies. She rents a place in the central bazaar of Imihsli city. Her monthly income ranges from about $375 to $625 and she would like to increase it. She also wants to be able to cover the demands of her many customers. A hard-working mother, Ilhame has successfully grown her business, inspired by her goal to establish a stable income for her family.

Currently, Ilhame is seeking a loan of 1,000 AZN to enlarge her variety of goods for sale. With the increased profits, she hopes to continue supporting her child's education. She believes that one day she will have her own shop.

loans.use: purchase more wedding dresses to sell to increase income

loans.name: Ker

texts.en: Ker P., 58, is a widow and lives with three children. She is a teacher at a state school and is able to make about US $2 a day. She is also supported by two of the children who are employed. Since her children spend a lot on transportation, Ker P. would like to take out a loan of US $800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is a 39-year-old married lady who earns her living by operating a tailoring shop. She has four children. Her business, which is situated in Wayani, Malindi, has been in existence for the past five years and now she wants to expand it with the loan she has taken out. 

Elizabeth is taking out her second loan which amounts to Kshs. 30,000 from KADET LTD where she was introduced by another client. She wishes to expand her business by buying a modern sewing machine and materials for making clothes so she can satisfy the needs of her ever increasing number of clients. Elizabeth plans to use the anticipated profits from the business to help educate her children and help out with the family's needs.

She hopes to eventually grow her business and that one day she will own her own established boutique which would be able to serve her clients in Wayani and elsewhere.

loans.use: To expand the business by buying a modern sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Gloria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Gloria se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Esta no es la primera vez que tiene este tipo de experiencia de créditos. Pues siempre está mostrando mucho empeño por mejorar en su negocio.  Su negocio consiste en ofrecer los diferentes productos a sus clientes, lo que siempre ha caracterizado a Gloria es simpatía y la forma de expresarse con sus clientes. Ha sido difícil la lucha que ha atravesado por obtener este negocio que tiene desde hace 9 años, pero han valido la pena pues así puede ofrecerle a su hijo un futuro mejor. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como calzado, ropa interior, comenticos entre otros.
texts.en:
Gloria sells general merchandise.  This isn’t her first experience with credit.  She is always looking for ways to improve her business.

She sells a variety of products to her customers.  What has always set Gloria apart is her kindness and the way she relates to her customers.

The road to having this business for the last 9 years has not been easy but it has been worth it because she is able to offer her son a better future.

This loan is to buy raw materials like: shoes, underwear and cosmetics, among others.

loans.use: To buy shoes, underwear and cosmetics, among others.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel S. is from the village of Villa M Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 26 years old. Liezel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $214 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Liezel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Liezel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Lisbeth Carina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lisbeth Carina; tiene 22 años de edad, y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de enseñanza a niños del nivel primario, ella es profesora, la socia quiere seguir estudiando y mejorar la enseñanza que tiene a los niños, la socia quiere abrir una tienda de abarrotes. La  socia solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This is Señora Lisbeth Carina.  She is 22 years old, single and a member of the communal bank "Los Lideres" (The Leaders).  It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.  She works as a elementary school teacher.  She wants to continue studying and improving education for children.  She would like to open a grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to for home maintenance purposes.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: For home maintenance

loans.name: Alice V.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Ahmadiyya Primary School, in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1947 by the Ahmadiyya Mission. Currently the school is staffed with fourteen teachers and has an enrollment of 400 pupils.    

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 8,750,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone cannot do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials, some a piece of land, pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest the loan in business. 

Alice V. K. (first row right) is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Magburaka town, Alice is married with four children – three in primary school and one in secondary school. Alice V. K. has been in the teaching profession for sixteen years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy market food - rice, palm oil, etc. in large quantity to sell. In this way, Alice will be able to earn more money that will supplement her monthly salary, thereby improving her livelihood.

loans.use: Buy market food - rice, palm oil, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia R. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods and canned goods in the local community. She is also engaged in sewing services, like making curtains and mending clothes and uniforms. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $164 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Lydia is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, and also sewing supplies. This will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, and sewing supplies

loans.name: José Victor

texts.es:
José Victor es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, limón y maracuyá. La zona pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero en una de las plantas procesadoras de mango que se encuentra situada  cerca a la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja junto a su esposa en un negocio de venta de ropa, para lo cual tiene un pequeño establecimiento en su negocio. Ellos ofrecen su mercadería en venta a los vecinos de la zona en donde reside y los ingresos que perciben de esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante la economía de su familia. Esta es una actividad bastante importante para su sostenimiento por lo que siempre tratan de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

José desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más prendas de vestir de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José Victor is a 24-year-old family man who lives with his wife and their three children in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a zone that mostly grows fruits like mangos, lemons and passion fruit. The zone is part of the Piura region and is located four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.
He works at one of the mango processing plants located near the zone where he lives. He and his wife also run a clothing business, for which they have a small establishment in their home. They offer their merchandise for sale to their neighbours and the revenue is used to improve the family’s financial situation. This business is a fairly important source of income for the family, which is why they try to keep it running in the best way possible.
José would like to expand his business by acquiring more clothing such that he can increase his sales and take in more revenue. This is why he has requested an 800 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa to help him reach his goal.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to expand his business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is currently in a business of selling clothes. She is 35 years old, married to an NGO worker with one child. Stella hopes to increase her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running three small businesses: aquaculture, tailoring and raising livestock. Her husband, Hernanie E., who is 60 years old, works as a laborer. They have four children who range in age from 26 to 34. Virginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because wanted a better life for her family. With the help of her 14 previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Virginia has been achieving this goal. Her most recent loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000 and meant improvements to her family's life. She is applying for a new loan, her 15th, for PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to expand her aquaculture business and thereby help pay for her children's education and for home repairs. Virginia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To expand a small aquaculture business

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman who lives in Compostela, Cebu. She operates 2 business ventures:  abaca weaving and a general store. Her husband, Ronelo, who is 48 years old, works as a farmer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children aged between 16 and 25.

Annabelle joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annabelle has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her abaca weaving business. In that way she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and home repairs. Annabelle is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her business

loans.name: Saidmurtazo

texts.ru: Сафоев Саидмуртазо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Саидмуртазо имеет средне - специальное образование, шофер. Он предоставляет услугу, занимается перевозкой. У него имеется трактор и грузовой автомобиль. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Saidmurtazo S. lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 38 years old, married and has 4 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Saidmurtazo has a secondary-specialized education as a driver.  He provides a transportation service.  He has a tractor and a heavy-duty truck.  Saidmurtazo has a lot of experience in this business.  He is requesting this loan for car repairs.

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Clementine

texts.fr: Clémentine D. est élévatrice du porc dans le district du Rubavu.  Elle est mariée, et elle a 2 enfants entre 2 ans et 5 ans, un de qui va a l’école, et une personne en charge.  Clémentine a un niveau d’éducation d’A2 en Pédagogie, et ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des bétails (porc) pour en élever, et construire leur ferme.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de suivre de près la sante de ses bétails, augmenter le nombre des bétails à élever, protéger-les contre les maladies, et les nourrir bien.  Elle voudrait élever le nombre d’élevage, tirer une source de revenu suffisant dans ce projet, et l’autofinancement de ce projet.  Pour sa famille et sa vie, elle voudrait scolariser tous ses enfants, continuer ses études, et améliorer l’habitation de sa famille.
texts.en: Clémentine D. raises pigs in the Rubavu district. She is married and has two children (a two-year-old and a five-year-old; one of them goes to school) and a dependent. Clémentine is educated to the A2 level in pedagogy; this credit is her first cycle with ABC. She will use her loan to purchase livestock (pigs), to raise it, and to build up her farm. Her strategy for the growth of the business is to closely monitor her livestock's health, to increase the number of pigs to raise, to protect them against diseases, and to feed them well. She would like to increase the number of pigs she raises, derive sufficient income from this project, and to reach self-financing. As far as her family and life are concerned, she would like to send all her children to school, pursue her studies, and improve her family's housing.

loans.use: To purchase livestock (pigs) to raise and to build up their farm

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en: Liberty is 45 years old, married and has three children, the oldest of which is 18. She makes a living as a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato, growing rice that she sells to people in her community. She works hard because she is committed to provide her each of her children with a good education and a bright future. She has applied for this loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: La Sra. Lorena Vive en la localidad de el torno es nacida en el departamento de Santa Cruz, es de ocupación comerciante de productos de belleza cosmeticos y también trabaja como secretaria en el colegio de la localidad del mismo municipio, su esposo es empleado en una empresa, tienen un hijo, pequeño el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción,  para la  construcción de un kiosco, en su domicilio, son clientes antiguos en la institución, por lo que se sienten agradecidos por el apoyo que se le a brindado. La Sra. Lorena es una pesona responsable y trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, con muchas ganas de superacion con el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Lorena lives in the town of El Torno, but she was born in the Department of Santa Cruz. Her occupation is that of a merchant who sells beauty products and cosmetics. She also works as a secretary for a local school in the same town where she lives. Her husband is a company employee and they have a young child.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials for building a kiosk in her home. Lorena and her husband are long-time clients of Emprender and express their appreciation for the support that has been given to them. Sra. Lorena is a responsible and hardworking individual who is always thinking about the welfare of her family. With great desire to succeed, she wants to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for building a sales kiosk.

loans.name: Lecilda

texts.en:
Lecilda A. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Lecilda is married and has five school-age children. Lecilda owns and operates a food stall, selling snacks and other delicacies, like bread, rice cakes, pudding, and cups of coffee and milk, in the local community. Lecilda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2009, Lecilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lecilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients for rice cakes. Lecilda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bread, flour, milk, and coffee. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lecilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bread, flour, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Foli Mawulolo

texts.fr: Jeune homme marié de 35 ans, Foli et sa femme sont tous les deux agents commercial des produits ‘’FOREVER ‘’.ils sont  parents de 03 enfants.il  revend de manière ambulante  ces produits. Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2008 et s’approvisionne au siège de’’ FOREVER LEAVING PRODUCT’’ .il sollicite ce premier crédit  dans notre institution pour acheter un vidéo projecteur et un portable pour pouvoir mieux parler de ses produits à ses clients et favoriser la vente car plusieurs personnes s’intéressent à la chose mais aimerait voir des reportages des clients qui en parlent .Ce qui lui faciliterait les ventes et majorer son revenu  mensuel .
texts.en:
A young married man of 35, Foli and his wife are both sales representatives for "Forever" products. They have three children. They sell these products as itinerant vendors; they began in 2008, and they get their supplies at the "Forever Leaving Product" headquarters.

They are seeking their first loan in order to purchase a video projector and a laptop computer. They will be able to make a better presentation of their products to their customers and make more sales, as many people are interested but would like to see testimonials from customers. This would make selling easier and increase their monthly revenue.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a video projector

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with 4 children. Regina is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Regina is a farmer and plants and harvest rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. 
Regina has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Moussodjeton  3 Group

texts.fr:
MOUSSODJETON 3  est un regroupement  de six femmes mariées du village de DJALAKORO  de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et au moins 3 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel  de ADA, qui est la présidente du groupe et qui est la première debout à gauche avec une écharpe bleu,  sera utilisé pour acheter, de la semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, la récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de SAN et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 17000 à 70000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et  les  dépenses  courantes  de la famille.
texts.en: MOUSSODJETON 3 is a group of six married women from the village of DJALAKORO in the SAN region of SÉGOU, the fourth largest administrative region of Mali.  They live in traditional families.  Their average age is 29 and they have an average of at least 3 children.  They cultivate peanuts.  With the goal of making their agricultural business profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago.  After fully repaying their prior loans, they are on their third loan. The current loan for ADA, who is the president of the group and the first person standing on the left with the blue scarf, will be used to buy peanut seeds, small equipment, and inputs for cultivation, at the main market in SAN.  After the rainy season, the harvest is stored for a certain time so that it has value, before being sold at the main market of SAN and at other nearby markets, at retail (often at wholesale), in cash, to customers who usually come from large cities.  The members of the group expect to each make, after the distribution and sale of their agricultural products, a profit of 17000 to 70000 FCFA, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase inputs, seeds, and small equipment.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years she has operated a water-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells clothes and real estate, which provide additional sources of income. The major challenge her water-selling business faces is seasonality. During the rainy season she experiences low sales volume, while during the hot dry season she experiences a high number of sales.

With the KES 20,000 she wishes to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.  Fatuma dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family.  She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Elsie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her abaca weaving.

Elsie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Severiano

texts.es:
